1.title: CC's Call

choices: I wonder who else will come?
11.content:
"Nada?"

"Yes?"

"It's ChewieKittie. I heard on the grapevine that you were rounding us up to come two by two. I'm not sure if you've heard from Party yet, but if you are coming to Montana, swing by and pick me up if you would! I'd love to come to England and see the Queen!"

"Alright, honey. Be standing in your backyard ready to go, we are taking off within the hour!"

"Thanks, Nada, see you soon!!"

Hot DANG! I thought as I hung up the phone. I'm going to England in this lifetime after all!

I ran downstairs and started packing. Hmmmm, this is a Nada cruise, I wonder if we'll have a formal night? I'd better find some nice dresses to wear. Good thing I got my eyebrows waxed last week. I'd better call Hubby really quick and tell him he and Monilad are on their own for a while!

With a laugh of pure glee and a wicked grin I tossed the last of my clothes into the biggest two suitcases I could find.
11.title: Don't Forget the Kittie!

111.content:
Tor hangs up the phone and shakes his head in amazment.

"This is too weird," he mumbles as he heads out to the shed in the back yard. As he nears the shed he stops and yells at the top of his lungs:

"ALRIGHT YOU DUCKS, GET YOUR BEHINDS OUT HERE NOW!"

Tor stands and watches the shed door for a moment, looking for movement. Suddenly the door is flung open and out comes Dirk Duck and his henchducks: Dirty, Dangerous, Dippy and Delbert. Delbert is the brains of the operation having gone to college at the University of Oregon (Mighty Ducks).

The ducks exited the shed in single file and lined up, waiting for Tor to address them. Dirk took one step forward and announced:

"All present and accounted for sir!"

"Okay you ducks, listen up. I just got off the phone and you will not believe what is about to happen."

All the ducks strained forward, waiting for Tor to tell them the news, hoping an adventure was in the works.

Tor continued: "First thing that happened was that dufus, CC called me".

As the sound of that name the ducks began to growl (What? You never heard a duck growl?) They remembered the last time they had run afoWL of the Bucketheaded Knight...it had not been a pretty sight.

"Settle down you ducks. Seems that CC was calling to tell me he would be arriving in Galveston very soon to pick us all up...HE WANTS US TO GO TO ENGLAND WITH HIM ON AN ADVENTURE!"

Tor waited for the uproar to settle down then he continued.

"I just got off the phone with Nada and she assures me that CC is on the up and up...if you can believe that. Seems She is behind this little trip and we will be joined by a bunch of other Blogville citizens".

Dirk looked around him and at his brother ducks. "Looks like we got some packing to do, boys," He growled. "Boss, this time do we get to stick something sharp into CC...just for fun?"

Tor let out a laugh: "Gawd, now that would be fun....but no....this time we are gonna play nice with the Buckethead....well at least till we see which way the wind is blowing, if you get my drift".

Dirk grinned evilily..." Yeah boss, we get you: Nice for now...then....POW!"

"We'll see," Tor told him. Then he left the ducks to pack as he headed into the house to tell Mel that she was about to get that vacation she was always talking about.

"Dang, I hope she decides to leave the dang frying pan at home, my head could use a rest." Tor said as he entered the house again.

"OH Sweetie," He called out to Mel who was in the bedroom. "You'll never guess where we are going......"
111.title: Tor Gets a Call...

1111.content:
There I was, minding my own business, writing a few mental metaphors while watching my Finn fish swim around his brand new ten gallon home, when my peaceful state of oblivion was shattered by the ringing phone.

“Call from NADA” my caller ID announced. Any idea of ignoring the interruption fled my mind.

“Hey there, Lady!” I said chirpily.

“Hey back!” she replied happily.

“What cha want?” I inquired eagerly. I knew if Nada was calling me, there had to be some excitement in the making.

“I cornered CC into taking me and my closet pals to see Scarlett,” Nada said conspiratorially. Chewie and Tor are coming, too. Wanna join us?”

“Well Nada, I sure as heck would like to do that. But listen, I just got Finn in his new home, and how can I leave him now, while he’s still getting used to all that water?” I asked puzzedly.

“I tell ya, Lauren. If CC can bring Advillicious and Tor can bring all his ducks, I don’t see any reason you can’t bring Finn.” Nada answered confidently. “After all, a fish should do well on an ocean trip. And maybe the ducks will like to paddle around his aquarium. Who knows, Finn just may enjoy teasing them by tickling their feet,” she concluded breathlessly.

“You got a good point there, Nada.” I answered contemplatively. Sign me up!!”

“Okey Dokey,” she hollered loudly. “You’re exactly on my way, so I’ll pick you up.”

“I’ll be waiting with swim fins on my feet and a life vest tied on tightly!” I answered excitedly. And I made a mental list of the five things I better bring just in case. These trips have a way of turning crazy, and you never know what you’re gonna need for survival!

I hope I don’t forget to turn off the iron.

1111111.content:
Ring Ring

“DebW is unavailable at the moment; please leave a detailed message at the beep and she will call you back if you’re important enough.”

BEEP

“Deb this is Nada…

“Nada! Hey there. Sorry but I was screening my calls and I saw it was you. How the heck are you?”

“I’m fabulous. Listen, I have organized a luxury cruise for all of us at WDC. We are going to see Scarlett!”

I’ve got this image of a huge cruise ship with room service, parties, COCKTAILS with umbrellas, and dancing the nights away.

“Omg Nada that sounds great. I’m so excited and count me in for sure! Wow, I can’t wait to meet everyone in person. By the way who all is going?”

“Well so far Tor, esperaza, the Great Windini, L. Gale, ChewieKittie, and and uh CC…click.

“Deb, we got disconnected.”

Yeah I don’t know why I threw the phone in the terlet. Luckily I have two phones.

“It happens. Bad connection I guess. I got this feeling you haven’t told me everything.”

“Well CC is bringing advilacuss and Tor’s ducks are coming too!” Nada said holding the phone away from her ear.

“WHAT THA? Oh hell no. Tell me it ain’t so.” I screamed.
Silence

“Deb?”

“Okay I think I can do this. I want to meet Scarlett. Do I have enough time to get the dosage on my medication upped?”

“Sure you do hun. If not you can borrow mine.” Nada replied. {i]I’ll tell her about the Ocean Floater CC is getting for us after we knock her out and we are in the middle of the pond. The damn city girl is going to freak out!

I hung up the phone and thought hey, a cruise ship is huge and I should be able to hide from CC’s jabby thing and his moody ass horse. And hopefully Dirk gets an exorcism before boarding the ship!
1111111.title: The Invite

11111111.content:
NOTTINGHAM AHOY


At the crack of 10.30am Scarlett was blasted from her dream about…well, we won’t go into that …by the telephone ringing.

Her frown turned into a smile when she heard the sound of her dear friend’s voice.

‘Hey Nada, lovely to hear from you. What’s happening over there?’

‘You’re WHAT?... WHEN? WHERE? WHO? HOW? ‘

‘A helicopter? And you’re bringing Delphine and the gang? Wow, my hammock gang will go quackers when I tell them. What? There’s more?’

‘HE is? Wow…my hero got an ark? What a man. He’s WHAT? Better be a damn big ark then and he’ll just have to sedate the wimp of a horse if he’s scared of water. And what was that?’

‘She IS? Bringing her cat too? Is she duck-friendly? And kidnapping inviting her neighbour? What a knockout PARTY this will be. Okay carry on…’

‘Oh,IS he? We’ll see about that. Just HOW many evil ducks is he bringing? Hmmm…I smell trouble brewing. Better make sure you check their baggage on board. Gonna play nice? Now, why don’t I believe that?’
What’s that? Oh GOOD, tell her to remember the frying pan okay? Anyone else?’

‘Oh fantastic, I’m sure she’ll be a great asset, especially in the kitchen. Oh, and Finn too? Well, the more the merrier. Remind her to turn off the iron before she leaves.’

‘And the great Texan lady herself? I’m gobsmacked. No, I know she won’t be but she’ll be a great addition. Yeah sure, we could all use some lawn clippings …pack plenty.’

‘What’s that? Do I speak French? Sadly only un peu. But we’ll manage, she’ll soon adapt to the captain’s flappage. Sheep? HOW many? Any fainting goats? Well, it will be great to have someone from that part of the world aboard.’

‘Another addition? Oh that’s wonderful. She’ll keep the men in order. What’s that? Oh, a few glasses of vino and she’ll be fine. I better go tell my ducky dudes and get moving. Bye.’

Scarlett dashed up the stairs and gathered all the ducks together to tell them the news. As anticipated the hammock started rocking, the air was filled with excited squawks and quacks and a million questions.

‘I don’t know Dainty…I’ll ask CC if Sonny is coming along.’
‘Yes, Divine, you will get to meet Diamante.’
‘I think so Disorderly but we’ll worry about Dirk later There is much to be done. I must make a list.’


1. Arrange barges to bring the passengers on the ark to Nottingham via canals.’

2. Secure Nottingham Castle for private use only.

3. Order cheese sammiches, beer, wine, spirits, cat and fish food, straw, farm animal fodder and Advil.

4. Hire stable for Advillicuss, aquarium for Finn, sheep pens and duck ponds.

5. Buy new outfit for da Queen with matching shoes of corset.

With that Scarlett sets off for Nottingham to get things ready. But is Nottingham ready for this?
11111111.title: Nottingham Ahoy

choices: Who else?  And what are we gonna eat on board?
111111111.content:
ring ring....ring ring

Party: "Hello?"

Nada: "Party?"

Party: "Yep."

Nada: "Cruise? Scarlett?"

Party: "Okay."

click

Party always loved a woman of few words.

Wow, he was going to England! To see Scarlett, no less. There would be alcohol. And, knowing Nada, there would be a lot of familiar bloggers on deck. This was exciting!

What to bring, Party pondered. He was fairly sure England was somewhere not in America if they were taking a cruise. And what kind of cruise would this be? Maybe he would finally meet his idol, Kathy Lee.

Party packed his clothes, peanut butter cups and an inner tube, just in case they happened upon any icebergs. He looked around the house one last time, trying to think of anything he'd forgotten. Just as he was about to close the door behind him, he had a thought.

"I'll bet CC brings that dang pony of his!" he said.

He quickly rushed back inside and pulled a bag of moose poop out of the cereal cabinet. "That darn pony won't have anywhere to do his business, so I'd better bring some incense or it'll be a long cruise."

Satisfied, Party scooted out the door and waited for his ride.

Enter our heroine, who is grumbling and counting out bags of Purina Sheep Chow. She is, as usual, talking in the phone to her sister, Anne.

"I can't believe I'm stuck bringing food for everybody!"

"Ami, don't go! Who will take care of your family for the next month? Who'll do all the laundry and bathe those kids every night?"

"Thanks for putting it into perspective for me, Anne. I'm outta here."

"Oh well," Ami mused, as she finished packing. "Most of them won't make the trip anyway."

With that, she added several boxes of Betty Crocker Sheep Helper: Sheepy Lasagna to her suitcase, and went to wait for the helicopter.

111111111111.title: Ship Shapes

1111111111111.content:
Dan walks up to the counter at the little WalMart in Livingston, Texas.

"Hey, ma'am, I'm ready to check out."

The checker eyes the good-looking dude standing in the cute pajamas, as he unloads on the counter.

"OK, Hon, let's see watch ya got here...sixteen packages of 9-volt batteries, one roll of duct tape (extra strength), one-hundred fifty feet of heavy duty electric extension cord, one blow-up life vest--will that be all?"

"Yes, ma'am."

"Darlin', what in the world are you gonna do with sixteen packages of 9-volt batteries?"

"Ma'am, I can't tell you that. Just be comforted to know that tonight the free world will sleep easier because of WalMart and this here stuff. Tonight evil will quake because of the unseen force that moves among the shadows of the night protecting you. Tonight..."

"Yeah, yeah, I get the picture. That'll be $38."

Dan hands her two twenty dollar bills and waits patiently for his change, which he gets promptly.

"One other thing, ma'am."

"Yes?"

"That old coot standing outside the door greeting, folks--does he work here?"

"Well I don't know how much work he does, but we pay him. What about him?"

"Well, you might keep an eye on him. He's got a passel of ducks out there and he's talkin' to them. He looks a little short of a full load, if'n you ask me."

"He's harmless."

"Well, thank you ma'am." Dan scoops up his goods puts them in the backpack and walks out the door, giving the old coot a wide berth.

He walks around the corner of the building and flips open his battery pack on the utility belt that hold up his pajamas. Tearing open a package of batteries, he slips them in and closes the battery pack. He flips a button and a green light comes on. He can hear a steady humming sound. "Aw, it works!"

Dan looks around to assure that he is unobserved and then pushes the stealth button. In an instant he fades from view. Stealthman is here--ever vigilant--almost competent!

Stealthman pushes the stealth atomizer and instantly his atoms are disassembled and flung through space only to be reassembled on a distant dock.

Stealthman looks around, "Galveston! I made it. Now where's that dang boat. Shoulda known better to trust that dufus to get here on time"

With nothing but time on his hands, Stealthman climbs up on a crate near the dock and begins his wait for the boat...ship...vessel...whatever. How long will he have to wait?
1111111111111.title: Now you see him; now you don't

choices: Let's Get Packed, Y'all - Time's A Wastin'
11111111111111.content:
Well shoot. I thought we were gonna get a nice, comfy luxury cruise across the Atlantic, but CC seems to be a cheap you know what. He’s gettin’ us a boat with the middle missing! I’ll bet it was on sale.

I don’t know if any of the other passengers have the pull to get him to change his brain about that, but I can see I need to make some special preparations just in case. Like a suction cup for the bottom of Finn’s travel bowl. And I’m thinking I better go buy a life boat, just in case we get washed overboard. We may need more than one, what with all the animals coming – the two, four and no legged varieties.

All I can say is if that horse don’t learn to swim, CC’s liable to be in a world of hurt ‘cause they don’t make any horse-sized life boats.

As I think on it though, the boat looks big enough so I won't have to pack light. And I can see how I’d have the chance to stay in shape, riding my bike on deck. Looks like there’s plenty of room. I wonder how many laps will make a mile? And if I put Tor on the handlebars I can really get a work out! (He just better keep that Black and Decker drill he lifted off the shoplifter outta his pants. I don’t want any scratches on my baby.)


Well, now I know what errands I have to run. I can tell it’s going to take multiple trips to numerous stores to get properly packed for this trip. Thankfully I have my backpack of secret weapons already put together. The Girl Scout in me is always prepared!

I just hope EmmyLoo brings good food! Sheep helper’s all fine and good, but what about the veggies? And the oatmeal? At least Party can be rest assured his peanut butter cups will be safe from me, but I can’t make any promises about who else might kipe a few of his stash.

Too bad we won’t have any freshly butchered pork on board. I wonder if Esperanza would consider shipping some Maisy to hold us over till we get across the Big Blue?

Dang it, time’s a wastin’ – I gotta get to the store!
11111111111111.title: So Much To Get

111111111111111.content:
Scarlett returned from her mission in Nottingham, grabbed her photos and map, then dashed up the stairs.

‘Hi gang; well that’s everything ready for the arrivals. Isn’t it exciting?’

A few muffled sighs and grunts came from the hammock.

‘And look – here’s some photos of the boats Captain CC is thinking of steering across the pond. I thought we could plot their journey on my new map here too. What do you think?’

Scarlett was met with stony silence.

‘What’s up ducky dudes? Has something happened?’

‘Nada phoned again while you were out,’ stated Damask flatly.

‘Oh is something wrong?’

‘No, but she said to tell you Phyllis and Deanna are joining the ship.’

‘Wow, that’s great. I wonder what size shoe she takes?’

‘And The Ben and Emmyloo are coming as well.’

‘GREAT! Oh you’ll love them, they’re SO funny.’

‘And even Dan is taking some time off from his busy schedule to resume his Stealthman role.’

‘Oh Joy, this just gets better and better.’

‘Oh and Partydude is definitely joining the crew and bringing peanut butter cups.’

‘Yummy. I guess it’s okay to forget the diet for a bit.’

‘And who the hell is Kathy Lee?’ Damask continued grumpily.

Scarlett shrugged as she observed the frowning faces glaring from the hammock.

‘So what’s the problem with you lot?’

‘The problem is…’ Defiant jumped in. ‘While they’re all sailing the high seas and having a blast, we’ll be stuck in this boring hammock waiting for days and days for them to arrive.’

‘And,’ cut in Dangly. ‘By the time they get here they’ll all know each other really well and we’ll all feel like strangers.’

‘Plus,’ added Daredevil.’ There could be trouble at sea with pirates or dark ducks and we feel without us there wouldn’t be enough reinforcements.’

‘So, what are you saying?’ asked Scarlett.

‘The way we see it,’ said Dearly Beloved.’ Is if you and all of us joined the ship now, it would be far more beneficial than just sitting here tapping our beaks. I mean, we’ve always wanted to see the big pond and you’ve always fancied a cruise and a break from domestic bondage.’

‘Hmm, I see your point, but they did say they wanted to come to Nottingham for some reason.’

‘Do we know the reason?’ asked Demur.

‘I’m not quite sure – something to do with Robin and his seven hoods I believe.’

‘Well, we could always help navigate them back here from the ship,’ suggested Diabolical.’ Anyway, you know how impulsive they all are. Knowing them they could change their minds mid-ocean and head off to that water hole in Africa instead. Then we’d all miss out.’

‘And we could pick up Bo Peep…er…esperaza and her sheep on the way,’ added Dizzy.

‘I see what you’re getting at,’ Scarlett conceded. ‘But how do you propose we get out to the ship?’

‘Well perhaps we could borrow Stealthman’s suit and travel the way he does. We’ve got a huge supply of batteries we could give him as payment.’

‘Or,’ butted in Dinkum.’Surely we can hire a ‘By Royal Appointment Only’ helicopter or private plane. You are supposed to be da Queen after all.’

‘Oh sod it, you’re right. Where there’s a bill…er…will there’s a way and this is bloody fiction after all. I’ll go call Nada and see what she thinks.’

1111111111111111.title: Sendin a pick-up

11111111111111111.content:
It had been two days since Tor got his surprise call from the Buckethead, CC telling him of the impending trip to England. Two days of frantic packing, making plans, arranging for a Pet sitter to stay will Mel's herd of animals and doing all the things needed in order to leave home for an extended trip abroad.

Tor sat comfortably resting in his recliner, a sense of well-being suffusing his mind. He had managed to pull everything together and now they were all ready to go. The car was packed and Mel was giving last minute feeding instructions to Marlin Perkins who would be taking care of all the animals in their absence. Yup, life was good, Tor thought, all ready and no bumps in the road.....

RIIING! RIIING!

Tor snatched up the phone...

"Hello".

"Yo, Tor, my buddy. It's CC and I got some news for you."

"Oh lord, CC. What now?"

"Well bud, seems Da Queen and her ducky friends are headed to the good old U.S of A. and will be joining us on our trip back to England."

Tor rolled his eyes....oh lord, he thought, this could mean trouble.

"Okay, so she's headed this way. So what does that mean for the trip?"

"Uh....well...there has been a slight change in plans."

Tor closed his eyes and mumbled: "I knew it...I knew there was gonna be trouble".

"What was that Tor, I didn't hear you".

"Nothing, nevermind. What is the problem?"

Well you see, dude, with DA QUEEN headed this way and so many other folks to pick up...well I just ain't got time to sail down there and pick up you Texas folks. But, don't worry, I'm sending an old buddy of mine to pick you guys up and get you up here in time to catch da boat to England."

Tor knew it was only his imagination, but he was sure, at that moment he could actually hear the trap door spring open on his own personal gallows......

"Uh...and who might this friend be?"

"You remember back in our Pirate War Days, that guy that helped me out against you and Helenhighwater the female pirate?"

"OH MY FREAKING GOD! YOU MEAN YOU ARE SENDING THAT IDIOT, CAPTIAN CRUNCH, DOWN HERE IN THAT LEAKY ROWBOAT OF HIS???"

Tor's screaming brought Dirk and the other ducks rushing into the living room, followed closely by Mel who was holding her frying pan just in case Tor had done something he needed Bopped for.

Tor waved his hand at them to halt and then he spoke into the phone again, his voice strained to remain calm....

"Was that your plan, little buddy?"

"Yeah, but don't worry, the Captain has a new boat now and he don't hold a grudge against you for sinking his old one...well I don't THINK he does anyway."

Tor was suddenly overcome by a feeling of being sucked into a whirlpool of stupid, the same feeling he always got when dealing with CC. He let out a sigh, he surrendered. What was the use of arguing, he thought, CC was gonna get him in trouble no matter what he did....

"Okay," Tor mumbled into the phone. "We are leaving for Galveston now. We will sit there on the dock and wait for Capt. Crunch but I gotta tell ya bud...if that idiot shows up and demands a quart of milk from each of us before we can board...I'M GONNA SINK HIS OTHER DAMN BOAT!"

CC let out a short laugh: "I knew you would understand buddy," he exclaimed with false high humor. "And don't you worry one bit, I explained everything to Capt. Crunch and he promised to be on his best behavior. Just make sure that Dan, Deb and Winda are all there on time...I don't want anyone to miss the boat, ya know!"

Tor slammed the phone down.

"ALL RIGHT", he yelled. "EVERYONE IN THE CAR. LET'S GET THIS FIASCO STARTED!"

With that, Tor, Mel and the Ducks loaded up and headed to Galveston and the beginning of their adventure.
11111111111111111.title: CC Changes Da Plan. So what else is New!

111111111111111111.content:
“Uh-huh….I see absolutely no problem with that…your Highness. I will tell CC…errr..Da White Knight to expect the Royal Plane with all of your friends. And what time will you be needing that airstrip cleared? That soon, no problemo.” Static interference….dang, “Hello? Queenie? Can you hear me?” Not another word from her. Drat….I better call CC…

Ring. “*&•@..hello….Dang it Advilicuss…*^$*!”

“Well, hi CC! Having a problem wif your steed?”

“That dang nag doesn’t want to….OUCH…..dats NO carrot, dats my …”

“Hmmm, sorry bout that… Luckily it’s a minor loss from what I’ve been told …so anyways, I need you to get some of da guys together and clear off a landing strip near da new boat, cause your QUEEN is on her way in da Royal Jet.”

“THUD!”

“Oh Gawd…ADVILICUSS…….Get CC up, there’s a ton of work to be done, and we all will be there soon…..Dagnabbit Advilicuss….remember….this, Da Queen herself is coming to be wif us, so git your sorry arse ober to the field and start clearing it…or you will have to deal with Wally.”

“THUD!” Oh horse-s*#*...can’t depend on that cussing bag of…oh well, I’m sure someone is around to revive them…Capt. Crunch and that mess will be there soon, the smell of Skanky Doodle in the vicinity ought to do it!

A few minutes later Nada stood back, shielding her little buddies from the wind of the rotary blade of the worlds largest helicopter, aptly named the “Superstallion’. It was capable of holding 20 tons, not to imply that anyone boarding weighed that much….but we had Lauren’s bicycle, aquarium for Finn, her oatmeal and essential oils, all my Duck pals, Knottingham Bear and 15 suitcases of shoes, gowns, grass clippings and assorted tools…then on to Phyllis and Deanne and their luggage (which could be a vast amount, knowing her shoe fetish), on to Montana to get Party and his 83 pairs of waders, peanut butter cups, extension cords (by special request of Deb… for some Macarena thingy she’s bringing), his inner tube….countless numbers of bags of Moose Poop, and I’m sure some Pocket Fisherman gadget, cause he won’t want to be in England and not fish, then to find Emmylou in Detroit, and all of her Lamburger Helper and stuff, and probably stuff we know nothing about yet... then pick up Chewie and her cat plus two suitcases of the huge variety, then on to Manhattan where we pick up Ben….hope he has managed to pick up Kathy Lee in that stretch limo…but it is outta my hands now. Then, we’ll meet up with Stealthman, if we haven’t already…gawd that man is always invisible, you never know where or when he’ll appear.

“Ok,” Nada yells….”all aboard! And I mean in an orderly fashion…hup-two-three.”

Led by Nottingham bear they board the chopper, two by two, singing, “Hi-ho-hi-ho.. its off to the watering hole we go…”

Nada rolls her eyes.

11111111111111111111.content:
Emmyloo wiped the sleet from her eyes and squinted into the distance. "Woohoo! It's the helicopter!"

Suddenly, the approaching chopper veered south, away from our delightful, and, it must be said, super groovy heroine.

"Waaaait!" she yelled. "You forgot me! I haven't been standing out in this sleet all day just for you folks to blow over Michigan!!! Please don't leave here to listen to my husband whine about the Tigers losing the World Series!"

Quickly, our resourceful heroine piled the boxes of Sheep Helper into the fire pit and started a smoke signal...
11111111111111111111.title: Get back here, dang it!

111111111111111111111.content:
“Pipe down ya’ll.” Gawd, the natives are restless. Okay, so the pilot didn’t see Emmy waving…but we see the smoke, so I suppose we’ll just circle back and pick her up.

“I saw the smoke signals. Dang, she’s one resourceful groovy babe! Who knew??? Mr. Handsome pilot, ya gotta brave the sleet, we just can’t leave her behind, or soon she’ll be a SnowWoman, frozen and all she’ll be able to contribute is a dang CARROT-NOSE for Advilicuss!”

“Whaat Phyllis? Ya gotta yell, the noise in this thing is horrible.”

“I SAID….THAT EMMYLOOOOO IS ONE TROUBLEMAKER, ALREADY!”

“SHHHHHH. We’ll not start that nitpicking now, we got plenty of time. “ Oh sheep-poo…how am I ever going to keep the peace until everyone is all together?

“I TOLD YA SHE”D BE TROUBLE!” Party yells from the mound of peanut butter cups he was sitting on.

“Hush Party…and when we pick her up, you scoop up some snow, or there’s going to be melted chocolate all over the place.”

“EWWWWWWWWWWW!” Exclaimed Lauren. “Party has on his waders and is trying to get in Finn’s aquarium…with his POCKET FISHERMAN….GET OUTTA THERE!”

“Listen up….if you folks don’t behave I’m picking up Emmy and leaving the whole lot of you in the snow…ya hear?”

“Quack…..mumbles and grumbles rising above the din.”

“Ok, that’s better, now hang on, we’re going down….wheeeeeeeeeee!”

Nada pulls out her bullhorn and opens a window….”E-M-M-YYYYYY…” waving frantically to her.

Whoosh-whoosh, the snow parts as we set the chopper down. The door opens and Emmy, looking very stylish in her snow-suit, climbs aboard, dragging her cargo on a sled, talking to Anne on her cellphone…”Well, I’m aboard, take care of everything…byeeeeeee!”

“Welcome aboard, next stop…Manhattan!”

Deb looks at her watch, “Damn, happy hour is over,” she said throwing money down and running out as if someone had yelled “FIRE!”

She drove home and inspected the contents of her “mandatory bag.” “Let’s see I have my little blue pills, pink pills, orange pills, Excedrin, vitamins a, b, and c, and last but not least the cyanide tablets (in case advilacus or Dirk need calming down),” Deb mumbled as she zipped the bag. She dialed her friend Brian.

“Hello”

“Hey Brian, I need to get to Galveston ASP! Didn’t that city slide into the ocean already?

“Deb have you been drinking again? Girl, that’s California and it hasn’t happened yet. So you want me to drop everything and fly your happy ass to Galveston NOW?”

“Uh yes.”

“Alright meet me at the airfield. You know blackmail is wrong Deb; so wrong.”

“Okay whatever. LOL”


Deb settled in the plane wondering if she is even supposed to be going to Galveston.

choices: The Boat's in Sight!!!  Isn't it???
111111111111111111111111.content:
This chopper has gotten waaaaay too crowded. A super stallion it may be, but the stud is groaning! Nada’s in the bubble up front but I don’t begrudge her that; after all, she did get this thing started, and someone’s gotta give the pilot directions.

I don’t mind sitting in the back here with the others, but things have gotten so tight, Party’s just about sittin’ in my lap. The stinker keeps eyeing Finn and I can see those fingers of his twitching over the lures stuck in his fishing hat. The waders came off, but he’s not fooling me. He’s in the mood for a fish fry, I can tell. I’m gonna have to keep a sharp eye out.

It was a close call, nearly missing EmmyLoo an’all. See, I knew there was a reason to have Nada up front! I bet she saves the day more than once on this trip.

Tara’s sleeping like a doll in PV’s lap even though the air’s foul with the smell of Party’s peanut butter cups. It’s enough to make a body sick, I tell ya. I know how to beat that though.

“Hey Party, I think I’ll have a snack before we land. Wanna share?”

“Sure thing.” Party holds out his hand. He doesn’t have to hold it out far, seein’ as he’s about sittin’ in my lap.

“I don’t know if I have enough. Lemme see. Oh yeah, I do. Here.”

“What in the heck is that?” Party stares at the small green orb in confusion, then looks at me. I’m munching away in utter happiness, the smell of peanut butter cups obliterated by the beautimus fragrance of Brussels sprouts.

“Why Party, haven’t you ever seen such a vegetable before?” I said this right in his face, which wasn’t hard, seein’ as he was about sittin’ in my lap.

Good thing I reached my stash of throw-up bags quickly. So, it’s not so nice in here now, but Party’s face is slowly de-greening and I think we’ll be at the boat soon!

Plus there was no place else to land. Fortunately, The Ben was outside waving the large bird in. Who scrables out of the limo just before it gets all smushed? Kathy Lee, ready to go.

** Image ID #1172805 Unavailable **


She had her cruise dress on already. The Ben kinda felt like he might have seen it before, but he loved it just the same because it brought the girls together so well.

The Ben helped her on with her voluminous luggage, full of sneakers and slave boys no doubt. Emmy greeted them at the door, patchy with soot.

"You been playing with smoke?" asked The Ben.

"Er, something like that."
1111111111111111111111111.title: Mishap in Manhattan

11111111111111111111111111.content:
Dan crumples up the spent bag of super-size Cheetos and tosses it over his shoulder where it lands on the other crumpled wrappers. He checks his watch and takes a long look out on Galveston Bay. He sees tankers and shrimp-boats and a Sea-do or two but there’s not a Captain Crunch driven yacht in sight.

“Dang that buckethead. I been sitting on these crates for darn near a week. Shoulda known that Yankee would be late. Probably coming by way of South America.”

Dan hears a rattling noise behind him and looks over his shoulder. Coming down the road toward the dock he sees a cloud of black smoke. What is this apparition. Could it be an evil spirit spewed from the depths of hell?…nope. Could it be a swarm of locust sent like the plague of Moses to strip the land?...nope. As it comes closer he sees the headlights of a beat-up 1967 Ford pickup truck with Texas tags hanging off the front bumper with on screw. A cloud of dark blue exhaust smoke engulfs the truck as it pulls to a stop with squealing brakes.

Immediately the passenger door opens and a lovely woman steps from the cab and kneels down and kisses the ground, it’s the amazing Mel. Dan hears her exclaim in the distance, “Thank you Lord! It’s a miracle we all got here alive.”

Out of the bed of the truck black ducks begin piling out, flapping wings and kissing the dirt. The divers door opens and to his surprise he sees the old WalMart coot step out of the cab.

“WooWee! Galveston! Mel, darlin’ look at all that water. Where’s my dang canoe? Drat! I knew I forgot somthin’!”

Mel stands gracefully to her feet, walks over to Tor, and whacks him on the head. “You dunderhead! If’n you weren’t so dang lovable and loyal I’d a left you in Livingston! You’re like a broken-in pair of boots; you’re so dang comfortable. Guess I’ll just have to keep you.”

Tor kicks the dirt and casts those big puppy dog eyes at Mel and smiles. Her heart melts.

Dan says to himself, “Good grief, love really is blind!”

Dan reaches down and pushes the stealthifier button and fades into nothingness. He reaches in his backpack and pulls out the 150 extension cord. He walks over to the warehouse wall and plugs into the outside outlet—might as well save the batteries.

Stealthman turns his attention to the Bay. Off in the distance, is that a yacht or is it his imagination? Where in the Yankee dude? Who else will show up on this dock to meet that boat…ship…vessel…yacht…whatever? How long will these hopeful travelers have to wait?
11111111111111111111111111.title: Wait, Wait, Wait

111111111111111111111111111.content:
Teresa sat on the edge of the dock writing in her journal.

Oh my Gawd. Was all I could think when I squeezed out of the helicopter. I never want to make that crowded a trip again.

Chewie was crying in her carrier the whole time. She kept wanting to get at Finn that and she didn't like all the quacking that Delphine, Diamonte, the Duckaneers and the rest were doing. But she was too afraid of Nottingham Bear to make too big a fuss.

She hates travelling, I hope once we get on the boat I can let her out to roam some.

And Ami stinks like smoke (sorry, Dear, but it's true), she was making my allergies act up in those close quarters.

I'll be glad to get to that luxury yacht that CC talked about.

"So, Nada, where is that big fancy yacht CC got for us for the queen. I'm a tad ruffled from sitting in that helicopter, and I wanted to let Chewie out to play in my cabin."

Nada looked embarassed and cleared her throat. "Well, um, see, while we were travelling, CC ran into a problem with the yacht. There was a problem with all the animals."

The two of them turned and looked at the menagerie lined up on the side of the dock. A host of ducks, a cat carrier, a fish tank were all sitting beside one very confused Kathy Lee whom the Ben was trying to calm down.

"We've got a water-shy horse and a herd of sheep and sheepdog coming, too," Nada reminded her. "And lots more ducks."

"Oh. I guess I didn't really think of all of that," Chewie looked chagrined.

"Here comes our ship now!" Nada cried with an almost forced enthusiasm.

Several of the adventurers looked all around excitedly at the large fancy yachts moored in the harbor.

"Which beauty did CC pick us?" asked Lauren.

"Here she is folks! Isn't she a beauty?!" CC popped out of what looked like a floating blue barn.

Teresa could only think woefully about the evening gowns she'd carefully packed. Gulp!

Thud!

Behind them, the Ben was trying unsucessfully to revive Kathy Lee.

Winda and Lauren were trying to be cheerful, but Phyllis was already asking Nada if she'd lost her dang mind.

Party was grinning from ear to ear and patting CC on the back. "She's a beauty, buddy!"
111111111111111111111111111.title: She's a Beauty!

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Tor sat on the end of the dock in Galveston and quietly watched the pirate ship burning in the harbor. He seemed to be in deep thought as he watched the confligration on the water much like he might watch a campfire in his native Pine forests of East Texas.

Finally he turned toward the empty space next to him and said:

"You know, I never thought a cartoon ship would burn like that."

"Well what did you expect it to do when you threw that molitov cocktail in the bow of the boat?"

Tor absently reached down and yanked the extension cord attached to Stealthman's belt and suddenly Stealthman/Dan who was sitting in that empty space beside Tor.

"That's better," Tor said with a nod. "I like to see the dufus I'm talking too".

"Well, like I said: What did you expect?" Dan said, unperturbed by being suddenly visible and wearing his Stealman costume/jammies.

"Geeze, I don't know. I guess I was still a little peeved at Capt. Crunch. That dumb-ass caused me a peck of trouble back in the day. He was once a minion of CC in one of our wars...I owed him some payback."

Dan shifted his gaze from the burning boat to the small figure of a cartoon navel Captain treading water and moving away from the blazing ship.

"How long you figure he's gonna last out there?"

"Hell, I don't know. He's a ceral character so I figure at worse he will swell up and get a bit mushy in all that water but he ought to make it to shore okay."

"He might," Dan agreed, "if a shark don't decide to take a bite outta him first".

Tor stood up and turned his back on the drama happening on the water. He shaded his eyes as he stared past where Mel and the ducks stood. Someone was getting out of a taxi and pulling a bunch of baggage out with them.

Dan reached down and plugged his suit back in. "A guy can't be too careful", he mumbled as he disappeared once again.

Mel walked over to Tor and followed his gaze. She smiled then and said: "Well looks like Deb has finally made it here."

Tor looked again as the figure came closer. Now he could see that it was indeed Deb.

He smiled: "Well hello, good-looking!" He yelled as Deb made her way to where they were standing.

"VAA-VAA-VOOOM!" The disembodied voice of Stealthman/Dan came from Tor's side.

"TWANG" The iron skillet made that familiar sound as it bounced off Tor's head.

"Hehehehe" Dan chuckled.

"TWANG"

The iron skillet struck again. This time in the "empty" space next to Tor and right on Dan's head.

"That's for Linda", Mel grinned.

Dan once again became visible and Tor gave him a smug look. Both of them were rubbing the knots on their heads as Deb walked up.

Mel took care of the introductions as all three welcomed Deb to the adventure then Mel took Deb off to one side where they compared notes on the correct handling on a iron skellet. Deb discovered that they both favored the overhead delivery but where she used a wrist flip, Mel was partial to the locked wrist position.

This chit-chat went on for a few minutes until finally Tor interrupted:

"Okay, its time to get this show on the road," he declared. "We've been here long enough".

"What's burning in the harbor?" Deb asked.

"That's our boat ride to Deleware", Mel said ruefully.

"Nevermind that,"Tor said. "Stealthman and I have it under control".

"We do?" Stealthman said uncertainly.

"Of course we do. We are gonna steal a plane and fly to Deleware".

"Oh yeah we're gonna.....WHAT? STEAL A PLANE? Who the hell is gonna fly it?" Stealthman's voice was beginning to crack.

"I'll fly it," Tor told the unbelieveing group. "How hard can it be....the plane goes up, the plane goes down....piece of cake!"

With that Tor gathered his baggage and his ducks and walked off the pier, followed slowly by three very unsure companions.

*********************


Five hours later a four-seater Cessena prop plane crashed into a farmer's barn on the Deleware border!

Tor staggered out of the ruined barn, hay was hanging from his clothes which were torn and oil streaked as was his face. He was quickly followed by three other figures, in equally as bad a shape as he was.

"See," He croaked to his companions. "PIECE OF CAKE!"

(THUD)

Tor fell over in a dead faint!

Well now all they had to do was find CC and the ship!
1111111111111111111111111111.title: The Texans are on the Move....

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb staggered out of the barn and looked down at her new ‘Limited” pants now ripped and torn. Picking the hay out of her hair, Deb stomped towards Tor.

Deb thumps Tor on the head

“The plane goes up…the plane goes DOWN! How hard can it be?” Deb mocked Tor’s words as she sat down on the ground.

“Mel, did his mama leave him at wal-mart when he was a child? Who the hell tries to fly a plane when they don’t have a clue what is up or down?”

About that time Dirk waddles up to Deb and gives a loud “Quack” in her ear.

“Where’s my bag? I need my little blue pills.” She said smacking Dirk back to the barn.

“Damn duck.”
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Dirk faces Debs wrath

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ok, it's official. I'm confused! I thought I was taking a canoe down the Mississippi to meet up with Tor and the gang in Galveston, but somehow I made it on the helicopter to Maryland, and trying to be damn cheerful about it too. It's a good thing though, cuz them dang Texans took off without me... or they would have had I been there when I was supposed to be.

~~~The Great Windini scratches her head~~~

Oh well. Not to worry. Deb's got all those pills, Party's got peanut butter cups, surely CC or Tor brought some beer, and Nada brought the old pipe and yard clippings. PARTY ON!
111111111111111111111111111111.title: What the?????

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Meanwhile back at the harbor Nada was trying to contain her enthusiasm at seeing the floating barn-thing. “All right….is everybody out? Wind….where are you?”

“I’m here, not sure how I got here, but at least we made it!” She did looked confused, but then, who wasn’t?

“Hey CC! We made it…which apparently is more than the rest of the group…have you heard from Captain Crunch as when we can expect their arrival? And…and…what about the Queen? I don’t see her jet here yet.” Nada looked around, surely this old barn thingy wasn’t going to make the trip across the Big Pond. She shook her head. CC had sent her a picture of the ship they were going to take, but she didn’t see it.

“Oh hey Nada!” Party and he were popping a beer and walking over to meet the rest of the gang. Party looked too dang …well…HAPPY This can’t be good.

Slowly each one of the copter passengers came walking to greet CC. There was Ben, arm in arm with a stunned Kathy Lee (still recovering from Party’s enthusiastic greeting..which I won’t reveal here), Chewie carrying her cat-carrier, Lauren trying to ride her bicycle with Finn’s tank balanced on the handlebars, PastVoices dragging a screaming Tara (who badly needed changing), Emmy was spraying some Eu d’ Terlett water around, in an effort to get rid of the smokey smell and trying to drag some boxes of that Lamburger helper, Phyllis had already gotten her cute tennis outfit on, and was swinging her racquet at imaginary tennis balls….and then there were all those ducks and Nottingham Bear. In all fairness Nottingham Bear had kept the quackers pretty calm amidst all of the chaos, even though our first attempt at lowering a duck was less than a wonderful experience…..wrong ship!


Everyone “high fived” CC, then, of course the complaints started.

“HEY….where’s the Lugshury Cruis boat??” Chewy asked.

“Yeah…where is IT?” Everyone was whining now, and Nada had to grab CC and Party by the hair to keep them from running away.

“Boys….you’re staying right here and giving us some answers. Party…did you know about this?”

“Nah, I’m innocent, but this looks like a great barn-type ship to me!”

Everyone but CC rolls their eyes.

“Nada hon…sweet muffin cakes…don’t cha all get worked up, this is just for all the animals!” CC takes a swig of beer.

“Groan”….Nada looks at the rag-tag group behind her, “then you aren’t talking about ALL of US are you?” She laughed, trying to ease tensions. Nervous laughter accompanied her own.

“Nah, I got us a beeeee-yew-tiful boat, it’s being brought over as we speak! Don’t worry..and…and…we got a call from Da Queen Scarlett and she will be here in an hour!”

“And Tor, Mel, Dan, Stealthman and Deb?” *Reminder to self NOT to book another adventure and try lead the group.

“I don’t know nuffin ‘bout them.” CC muttered, nearly inaudibley.

“HUH? They shoulda been here by now…Capt. Crunch went for them didn’t he?”

“Ummmm…mehbe.”

“CC….what’s happened to them?”

“Well….blink…blink…I got a call…actually two…one was a MAY-DAY thingy, da boat burned up.”

The crowd leaned forward…audible sounds of, “Oh nooooooo..what tha…. And quacking…”

“And the other?” Nada demanded.

“Well, shucks….it seems old Skankyface stole a plane and was trying to fly it here wif da rest of em….” His voice trailed of.

“GASP.” The crowd let go at once.

“And????” Nada was growing very impatient…she had thought by now they’d be sitting down to dinner, all dressed in their finery, This was not good news, she could tell.

“Welp…he crashed into a barn somewhere.” CC kicked da dirt. Party put an arm around him and offered him a melted peanut butter cup. “Thanks bud…I think they all survived, but we better send someone to find them.” His eyes cast downward.

“Okay then, who wants to volunteer?” Silence. “I SAID.,. who will volunteer to go find em?” Nada taps her foot.

Finally, Lauren comes around the crowd on her bike. “I’ll go find them…but somebody has t o watch Finn…and nothing better happen to him!” She glared at Party, who had perked up when he thought he might get to go fishing.

“I’ll watch Finn for you.” Chewie stepped out of the crowd.

OMG….with a cat, this is trouble. “CC…wheres Advilicuss? He’d be the perfect one to keep an eye on Finn.”

Then they heard some loud cussing from the barny-ship. Heads swiveled…listening…”&%*## White Knight my arse…Sh*%, I’m gunna have to babysit some dang FISH!”
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: Holy Moley!

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Stepping out of that crowded chopper with Tara on one hip and a stuffed diaper bag hanging from the opposite shoulder. "It's OK Tara, grandma will change your diaper and get you fed. That chopper was crowded but you liked being passed between Nada and me though. I am so glad you took to Nada."

All the chopper occupants had milled around the landing area, some dazed from claustrophobia collateral and others from inhaling Emmyloo's fumes.

We were a bit restless before coming up on CC and the barn boat thinking he had decided we should all take the barn. CC has apparently had a misunderstanding with the owners of the ship he is renting. It seems he had to sell some photoshop pictures to a less than reputable site for some extra money to cover the damage deposits being demanded for this party. How could they know we are a rowdy bunch together, we don't even know that yet.

(Kathy Lee looks like she is having second thoughts about joining our group after Party's "welcome". I don’t think she is quite sociable enough for our group but then who am I to say.)

I am really worried about Mel, Deb, and Dan since Tor stole a plane and apparently crashed it. Lauren is biking a search party to find the "survivors." I am really disappointed in Dan not stopping Tor from endangering his recently unendangered life. I just hope Mel didn't lose the frying pan in the crash, it's beginning to look like it will be more useful than we thought.

Tara, clean, changed, and fed is now sleeping on my shoulder as we wait here on the dock in the gathering darkness. I think I heard CC tell someone that the cruise ship will be here soon. If Advilacuss does a good job watching Finn, I wonder if we can use him as a babysitter when baby is sleeping. Hmmm.

I just hope Emmyloo quit worrying about her ashen state long enough to fix some dinner, I am getting hungry enough to eat Tara's strained carrots.
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: Sittin' on the dock of the bay...

111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dan spits a wad of straw from his mouth, "Dang it, Tor, you buckethead, I told you there's other ways to stop a plane than hittin' a barn. You shorted out my batteries and now I'm gonna have to put new ones in."

Dan scooped a handful of hay out of his backpack and fished out a new package of batteries, tearing the case and plopping them in the stealthbelt nimbly while murmuring under his breath.

"Dang it, Stealthman is 'possed to be a secret identity. How in the world can you be a super hero if'n everyone knows who you are? This dang trip's gonna ruin my reputation."

Tor swivels his head around from east to west looking the countryside over real good. "OK troops, lets get goin' we ought to be there in an hour or so. Heck, this is Delaware; it can't be that big!"

Mel lifts the skillet ready to deliver a whomp and just holds it there. "Tor! Love of my life, you dummy, you don't even know which way to go; how do you expect to get there?"

Tor grins that grin, "We got a secrit weapon."

In unison the rest chime in, "What secret weapon."

"We got ducks! Heck these fellers have been flying north for years." Tor whistles a duck whistle and the Ducks line up in front of him. "OK fellas, take us to CC!"

As a group the duck quack to attention, look to the sky, and take flight. Off to the northeast they head--fast.

Tor yells, "Hurry up, ya'll! Gotta go that way! Hurry before they get out of sight!" Tor begins to trot off after the ducks.

The rest of the group looks at each other and just lets him trot.

Dan pushes the button on the stealthbelt and fades to nothing. The remaining group hears a voice, "Stealthman will save the day. Ladies, cuddle close to me and I will atomize you."

Deb cuts her eyes over to the vacant spot and says, "Yeah, I've heard that one before!"

"No, really," Stealthman returns with a hurt dignity, "all you have to do is to be holding on to me when I atomize and you will go too?"

"Yeah, well, how do I know I won't reatomize with a hoo hoo?"

"Trust me!"

Mel pipes up, "And I've heard that one before."

"I don't have time for this." Stealthman walks between the two women and slips his arms around both waists. He pulls them close to him. He gives Deb an extra squeeze, just for grins."

Both women squeal but let the manly Stealthman do his stealth thing. They fade to nothingness.

"Wow, this ain't so bad!" Deb proclaims. "Watch the hand there, super-dude!"

"Sorry, just looking for a handhold."

"Yeah, well look somewhere else!"

"Geez, it's tough being a super-dude."

Mel interrupts, "Hey, Stealthman, you gonna just hold on here or are we gonna go somewhere? We're waiting!"

Meekly Stealthman drawls, "It seems I got a problem. With both hands full of wimmins, I got no hand to push the atomizer button. Someone's gonna have to push it for me."

"I knew it! I knew there was a catch!" Deb spurts. "OK, where's the dang button?"

"It's just above my navel. You're gonna have to feel around a little to find it."

"WHAT?"

"Here, let me do it!" Mel interjects and swings the skillet into Stealthman's midsection with a vicious swing." WHUMP!

The atoms of the three folks begin to disintegrate to nothing as they are flung across space. The last thing that's heard was "EEEooowww!"

*****

Standing on the dock, CC and company are startled as Mel and Deb materialize from thin air, both grinning wickedly.

"What the....where'd you wimmins come from?" CC yells as he swivels his head left to right. "Are there any more?"

Mel grins at CC and throws her arms around Nada as she answers, "Stealthman's here somewhere; but he ain't talking."

Deb giggles, "Nope, not for a little while. Hi Guys!"

The crowd runs up and surrounds the two women; all of them jumping up and down and greeting. CC and Party open another beer.

"Well, I guess we are ready to go?" someone says.

"Not quite" CC shakes his head, "The Skankyface ain't here....Dang it, why can't he follow instruction?"

The group all fall silent and murmur, "Dang, Skankyface...dunderhead...bucketface." They silently turn their eyes towards the southwest...and wait...again.
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Flung Across Space

1111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Scarlett drilled the hammock gang about their impending flight across the big pond.

‘So, are we all ready ducky dudes?’

‘YOU BETCHA,’ came a loud chorus from the hammock.

‘But, but, but…’ stammered Divine.

‘What’s up me duck?’ asked Scarlett, sensing problems.

‘I can’t go without my twin Desirable and she’s at Aunty’s house.’

‘Sorry, can’t do anything about that, you’ll have to cope somehow. Come on, let’s get moving. Line up in pairs.’

** Image ID #1173251 Unavailable **

Scarlett attempts to console a broken-hearted Divine.



Scarlett lay back in the luxury private jet, a glass of wine in one hand, a bar of chocolate in the other. The ducks snoozed peacefully around her apart from Divine who was still snivelling and snotting about her twin.

‘Ah, this is the life, but I better let Nada know we’re on our way.’

‘Hi Nada, we’ll be with you in about an hour. Okay? Well it IS da Queens plane you know. ‘I couldn’t find the shepherdess and her sheep I’m afraid, but maybe they can catch up later.’


Five minutes later Scarlett received a return call from a rather troubled Nada.

‘He’s done WHAT? The dufus. Are they all alright? Crashed the plane? What a Wally.’

‘Oh that’s kind of her. I hope she can locate them. What about the rest of the gang?’

‘DID she? HAS he? They DIDN’T, She WHAT HE's still missing? GAWD, it sounds like complete chaos over there. I think I’ll cruise around a bit until you’re all present and correct. Let me know when it’s safe to land or I can join you at sea if you prefer. See you soon.’

Scarlett gazed out the window and recognised the countryside below.

‘Hey, Divine, cheer up dude, we’re flying over Staffordshire and have a bit of time on our hands. We’ll drop by sis’s place and collect Desirable. Maybe sis will come with us too. I’ll call her and tell her to put the kettle on.’
1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Fashionably Late

11111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
WELL DANG !!!!

I was standing on the House/Barge...While Everyone who just arrived was just sittin there lookin at the big blue thing...When Partylips walked up to me and said..."Dang CC you really think those Wimmin are going to ride across the ocean IN THAT !!!"

And About that time CC was hearing a heap of grumbles and stuff like... Well THIS THING IS UGLY !!
and and " I'm not riding in no FLOATIN BARN !!!!

(CC just laughs under his breath)

And just about that time.. Something went Flyin by MY HEAD !!! (Scared the stuffin out of me!!!).. I turned and there was DEB standin there pickin up another Rock of the ground....(Dang Wimmin)

I YELLED... HEY !!!! STOP DAT !!!!

Well Deb started yellin stuff at me...."CC IF YOU THINK FOR ONE MINUTE WE ARE GOING IN THAT !!!!
(She was pointing at BIG BLUE...(Dats what I named the House/barn. And with that DEB !!! Heaved another ROCK AT CC HEAD !!!!

(CC Faked right and dived left)
HOLD ON DANG IT !!!!! GAWD !!!!!....

(CC jumps up on one of them 55 gallon Barrles and yells !! HOLD ON FOLKS !!!!...HOLD ON !!!!!....I got sumfin to TELL YA !!!!!

Well everyone gathered around with upset faces and lookin like they wanted to rip ME APART !!!...Partylips looked up at me and said.."Dude this better be good cause I'll be darn if I'm gonna help you out of this ONE !!!
(CC winks at the Partyface and says..WATCH THIS !!!)
