11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: STOP tossin stuff at me !!!! LOL

choices: Dinner is served to the weary travellers
111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Okay, fire up the dockside campstove, and I'll put supper on!" Emmyloo announced. She borrowed Mel's frying pan and approached the large floating barn. She opened the door.

** Image ID #1173279 Unavailable **

Emmyloo looked at the cute sheep, and then at the frying pan. The sheep bleated, and Emmy knew she couldn't kill the poor thing.

What the heck, she figured. It's my fantasy trip too! So she closed the barn door, dialed her cell phone and ordered pizzas for everybody.

"George Clooney's Pizza Emporium, this is George speaking."

"Hi George, this is Emmyloo. Listen, I was wondering if you could bring down a few pizzas for me and my friends."

"The Emmyloo, from writing.com? Wow, this is an honor. I'm a huge fan."

Emmyloo blushed modestly. "Oh, really, thank you so much for saying so, but I'm nobody, really..."

"Not many people know this about me, but I sort of have a thing for funny women. The only thing that could possibly make you hotter is if you smelled like smoke," he confided.

"You're in luck, George," Emmy replied. "I'm hilarious, and I stink to high heaven right now."

"Looks like I'm in luck then. How about I drop off these pizzas myself?"

"Thanks, George, but I'm married."

"Not in this fantasy," he replied.

"Oh, well in that case..."

"Excuse me," interrupted Party. "But we're getting hungry here!"

Emmyloo scowled at him and put her hand over the receiver, "If you'll just be patient, Party, I'll let you use my phone to order dessert from Britney Murphy's Topless Revue and Ice Cream Shoppe!"

"Sorry about that, George," she said into the phone, "anyway, that's ten pepperoni pizzas, one deep dish with tofu and broccoli for Lauren, and one with miniature peanut butter cups for Party."
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The first meal is prepared

1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Thank goodness the terrain around here is flat. I rode for an hour and barely broke a sweat, but once I got out into the open fields, the riding got a bit rougher. I began to wonder if I’d ever find those four vagrants. My stomach was beginning to rumble – the Brussels sprouts had worn off.

I gave myself another thirty minutes of riding before I’d turn back and call off the search. Anyone who would steal a plane and fly it into a barn deserved to take his lumps, anyway. And anyone dumb enough to go with the dude – well, enough said.

I’d stopped to survey the terrain, shielding my eyes against the glare of the sun, when who should pop into my field of vision but the errant pilot himself. Though a vision, he was not. Hay sprouted from his head and britches, and lord a mercy, the man was shirtless!

I can’t bring myself to describe the sight of his bare, nekkid, unclothed torso. I’ll leave that job to Mel, if she ever has the courage for it. His tie-died Grateful Dead tee-shirt was wound tightly around his left arm and there were tear streaks of grime striping his cheeks.

“Well, Tor, I don’t know whether to be grateful to see you, or whether to throw up.”

“I’m so glad to see a familiar someone I’ve never met before,” said Tor. I put that sentence down to shock. He lifted his wrapped arm and cradled it gently.

“OK, so what happened to you, big guy? I mean, besides crashing into a barn with a stolen plane?”

“I cut myself bad. Real bad. And I was so busy keeping myself from bleeding to death I missed the atomizing transport. After all I risked getting those guys here, they up and left me behind. Oh, just you wait until I get my hands on that Planner Dan, that ungrateful sub-par hero.”

By now, Tor was punching the air with both fists, and the psychedelic tee-shirt unwound and fell to the ground.

“Let’s look at your owie, Tor, and see if we can bandage it with something else so you can put back on your shirt. I’ll be danged if I’m taking you back looking like that. Kathy Lee may just die on the spot, then you’d be in for a huge law suit. Party would never forgive you, either.

“It’s right there,” Tor said, pointing to his flimsy bicep.

“Where?”

“There! Can’t you see it? It was bleeding like all get out.”

“You talkin’ about this scratch?” I put my finger on a scratch that had already begun to disappear.

“Ouch! Don’t hurt me, woman. It’ll probably get infected and I’ll die on the high seas. I hope someone’s prepared to do a sea burial.” Tor sniffed just a little.

I swallowed my laughter and dug into my back pack. I grabbed a bottle of lavender oil and a box of Band-Aids, dripped the oil on the scratch and peeled the paper from a bandage.

“Hey, hey there,” Tor objected. “This needs a little more something than that. Use those.” He pulled from the box three butterfly bandages. “I don’t want the edges to split and have a scar when they deliver my body to Davey Jones’ locker.”

Satisfactorily bandaged and re-garbbed, Tor mounted my handlebars and sang Swing Home Sweet Chariot all the way to the dock.

I’m so glad I brought my mountain bike with dual suspension.

Mel greeted Tor with hugs and kisses, and the whole gang settled on the dock to dive into hot pizza, delivered by the hottest delivery boy I’ve ever seen. Emmy sure has conneactions. The broccoli/tofu pizza was surprisingly popular, and I ended up fighting Deb over the last slice of pepperoni. I got three bites, she got four.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Search and Rescue

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dang! Sure was a good thing that Emmy ordered those pizzas, I’m not so find of lamb…but, it is a shame she brought all that Lamburger Helper. Well, you just never know about the future. Gawd, what am I doing just standing here? George Clooney will be here soon, and I have to find a way to keep Kathy Lee out of Emmy’s world. Tough job, but somebody’s got to do it.

OMG…that was fast…Oh, just look at the way he looks at her….


Well, no time for me to sit and stare at them, gotta get everyone rounded up, as I see CC and the fantastic yacht he promised is pulling into a slip!

“YO….peoples, ducks and assorted animals..attention!” I clapped my hands loudly.

Before I could begin, the faint sound of….whaaaa? Is it someone trying to sing? It was getting closer…I listened, “ saweeeet char-i-ought..comin’ fer to caaarryyyy Me…OUCH!
Dang it woman must you hit every dang pothole…I’ll loose my masculinity at this rate..Mel will kill you!”

“Quiet down wussy boy…” The woman’s voice sounded melodic in comparison to that gawd awful attempt at singing.

“Hey, it’s my long, lost husband!” Mel broke away from the crowd eating pizzas and ran full speed towards the unlikely duo. “Oh Lauren, I knew you would find him. Honey bunch, I love you so much.”

Everyone standing around stated shaking their heads in amazement…how she could take Tor for all these years…oh well, everyone is here now, just have to wait for da Queen’s jet.


“Hey Lauren, good job, I knew I could count on you. Have some pizza George brought for us.”

Suddenly a hush fell over the crowd as we heard the distinct sound of a jet overhead. “Look, up in da sky, it’s da plane boss..” CC shouted. Sure enough there she was, about to circle for her landing…


Suddenly the airstrip/dock area was abuzz…women running around trying to find a mirror, they all knew what a style mavin Da Queen is….well, all except Emmylou..who had gone down to the barn with George…probably hiding him from Scarlett.

“Where’s my luggage?” Kathy Lee screamed.

“Where are my shoes?” Phyllis screamed.

“Where is my skillet?” Mel asked.

“Where are my pills?” Deb squealed.

“Where is my cat?” Chewie muttered.

“Where is my Mommy?” Tara wailed.

“Where is my brain? Bringing this child.” Past Voices seemed to be asking herself.

“Where is Finn?” Lauren said through a mouthful of pepperoni pizza.

“Where am I again?” Winda said, to nobody in particular.

“Where are your PASSPORTS people? Emmy.... get over here...NOW!” Nada was losing her patience a littl..

CC looked befuddled.

Party just shrugged.

Stealthman disappeared.

Ben whipped his expired passport out…”uh-oh.”

Tor…well…he was still cryin and snottin over his tiny cut.

And George...well it is evident how helpful he can truly be...sigh.

"AWWWWWWWW...isn't he adorable...and...and...helpful?" Emmy sighed.

Nottinham Bear produced all duck passports…left over from their last adventure…finally something was going right! Advilicuss, Chewie Cat, and Finn were definately exempt.

The excitement was palpable now....
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Da Plane...da plane...

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Everyone was running everywhere getting ready for da plane and da queen to land when a yellow cab drives erratically through the crowd and directly at PastVoices. A screaming woman flies out of the back of the cab, "MOTHER, I THOUGHT YOU WERE TAKING TARA TO THE ST. LOUIS ZOO, NOT YOUR ZOO OF FRIENDS."

"If I had told you we were leaving the country, you wouldn't have let her go, so I made up the story about the zoo. Please don't be mad at me!"

"Well, she is NOT going with you. Your friends get pictures all the time and they have had a few days with her, now she and I are going back to catch the next flight to St. Louis from Providence."

"Well, OK, I will get her things together. I just finished feeding her carrots and a bottle. I changed her diaper. She could probably do with a bath as the chopper was crowded and giving her a bath here on the dock wasn't smart." Hanging head and scuffing toe in the dirt, "Are you mad at me?"

"No, I am just glad I got here in time. From the looks of that barge out there, you may not make it back in time for her first Thanksgiving and Christmas and Travis would never forgive you. Now, kiss and huggle with Tara before we leave."

After helping Catherine and Tara into the cab, loading all of Tara's accoutrements, PastVoices shut the door of the cab and waved at it retreating in the distance. She turned back to the group delighted and aggravated with Tor's arrival as well as gushing over da Queen de-boarding her plane.

She had to admit as she watched Emmyloo and George walk past toward his delivery truck, that she was relieved. She had decided she was a bit jealous Tara would prevent her from having a fantasy like Emmyloo and CK.

Above her reverie, the din of Tor's admirers vs. detractors, Scarlett's plane taking off, and Emmyloo's gushing CC called, "ALL ABOARD!!
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Kidnapping Charge Averted

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Tor flexed his sore arm then rubbed his sore butt...that dang ride on the handlebars of the bike almost did him in. Well, he mused, everything turned out okay after all. They were all here in Delaware. He looked around him at the milling crowd.

There was Nada, who got this whole thing started. She was standing a few feet away from him deep in conversation with Da Queen Scarlett and CC who was looking from one to the other, his head bobbing and his tongue hanging out like a basset hound in heat....that is just sooo CC, Tor thought.

Tor did notice though that the crowd was beginning to fragment, to split off into different directions. Emmyloo and George Clooney were headed for the back of the delivery truck followed by Chewie, Lauren, Pastvoices and to Tor's dismay, Mel!

"Well I'm gonna put a stop to this right now!" he growled.

"HEY PRETTY BOY, " Tor yelled at the retreating figure of George and da wimmen. "YOU PLAN ON MAKING ANY MORE MOVIES?"

George, stopped then turned around to face Tor. He smiled his dazzling smile in Tor's direction. "Why yes, of course I am." he said rather smugly.

"Then you better get your Pizza delivering ass outta here," Tor told him in a level, stern voice. "Cause iffin you take my sweetie with you to that truck you gonna be delivering your lines out the side of your bruised up head!"

George took one look into Tor's bloodshot eyes, sashayed up into his truck and waved weakly to the disappointed women as he roared off down the road and back toward his next big movie.

Tor dusted his hands..."Well that takes care of that," he said to no one in particular.

"NOW...EVERYONE ON DA BOAT AND LET'S BLOW THIS JOINT!"

CC, always quick to see which way the wind was blowing, piped up then: "YEAH, WHAT TOR SAID". He puffed out his scrawny chest to give his words weight.....yeah right!

Everyone stood for a moment in silence....Mel looked sheepishly at her hubby: "I was only gonna get his pizza recipe," she said sweetly. Then, when Tor did not reply, she hurried over to the gangplank of the boat.

Mel was quickly followed by the rest of the group. As they trouped by the Scowling Tor he pulled first Mel, then Dan, Deb and Winda off to one side.

"He whispered to Dan/stealthman: "I want the "Texas contingent" To board last, with me, we got some talking and planning to do".

They fell in besides Tor as everyone else climbed on the boat, then they followed him up the gangplank and over to where Nada stood.

"Sorry to lose my temper Nada," Tor said quietly. "I just couldn't let that pretty boy spoil the party. You ready to go?"

"Yup," Nada nodded. " I think its about time I assigned cabins to everyone and we head to merry ole England."

Tor nodded and smiled...."Sounds like a plan to me"

As everyone gathered around Nada, a hush fell over the crowd as they waited to get their cabin assignments from the one who started this Adventure in the first place. As they waited Tor leaned over to Winda and whispered:

"Meet me in the ship's bar in a half-hour", he told her. "We need to talk".
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tor Gets them moving....

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Winda listens intently as Tor tells her to meet him in the bar in half an hour. "Cool... a little drinky poo," she thinks to herself. Maybe this is just what she needs to get her brain cells clicking again. She still had no idea how she made it from home to Maryland. "Hmmm. Did Nada give me some of her special, California grass clippings?" she wondered. "That must be some radical and potent stuff!"

She shakes her head, feeling a bit hungry (tofu pizza? don't think so) and wobbles ahead to hear who she'll be rooming with on the boat trip. "Oh man! Just my luck... oh lawd what is I gonna do?!", she screams. "Nada honey, I may need more of that yard stuffage to make it through a long trip with you-know-who. I'll pay... I got lots of gp's!!"

"Calm down Winda... sheesh! It ain't all that bad, is it?" Nada asks.

"Well... YEAH! How am I supposed to deal with that SMELL all the way across a great big pond?! Oh, lawd what is I conna do?!"

"Well, never mind right now. I got an assignation in the bar, and a great big Texas-sized margarita is calling my name!"

Winda walks in the bar, still a bit upset with the roommate situation, but bellies up next to Tor and says, "Ok, oh king of dufus. What's the plan man?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Somthin's brewing, and it ain't coffee!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I wandered the ship in search of our intrepid leader, Nada. I wanted to know what cabin I’d been assigned so I could get Finn’s filter plugged in and my bicycle polished – the handlebars were in special need of cleaning and sanitizing.

After wandering the halls I finally located the diminutive blonde in the captain’s quarters. It wasn’t too hard; all I had to do was follow the voice yelling something about the wireless internet. I finally got close enough to overhear (NOT eavesdrop) as I stood silently outside the partially opened door.

“OK, here’s the thing,” Nada was saying, while cradling her laptop. “We’re not leaving port until you assure me we’ve got a wireless connection on board and I have some promises of uninterrupted reception on our crossing. I refuse to give the go ahead for departure if I can’t watch my Africam. I’ve still got to see giraffes, and there are plenty of baboon arses I haven’t looked at yet. I don’t intend to lose opportunities to enrich my life on a ship that hasn’t entered the twenty-first century!”

I pushed open the door in time to see the captain picking her teeth with a frayed pinky nail. “The technicians say the system will be up and running within the hour.” She sucked her teeth, adjusted her captain hat, and shrugged into her captain coat before brushing past the two of us and traipsing up to the captain seat in the pilot house.

It was while Nada was consulting her clipboard that I felt warm breath on the back of my neck. I could tell it was Male breath, but it wasn’t until I heard the Male speak that I knew who it was.

“Nada, when are you going to give us our room assignments, eh?” Ben asked. Silly boy, he likes to pretend he never had any notion of his Canadian ancestry, but it shows. Yes it does. “I’d like to get settled in and see if I can find a naked mole rat or two before we set sail, eh? All this vacation time on my hands, maybe I’ll be the one to discover the secret of longevity and win one of those prizes. Eh?” There was a mildly frantic gleem in his eyes. “And I wouldn’t have to share it with anyone!”

Nada flipped through pages and announced that Ben had been given room 4E. He blanched just a little and said, “Of course,” before sulking off to find his starboard cabin and begin his scientific research, which would one day enable all of us to live long, long lives, but hopefully not naked, bucktoothed and bald.

When I got into my cabin, I set Finn’s tank on the shelf, got his filter going and surveyed the room. Nice firm bed, shiny bathroom, silk flowers in a vase gummed to the nightstand, plenty of room for all the baggage I’d packed.

A circle of light pooled on the floor, spilled there by the porthole. “Well Finn, the digs are pretty nifty, aren’t they?” He swam the length of his tank and flashed blue. “I’m thinkin’ I’ll mosey on down to the bar and see if I can find out what those Texans are plannin’. You think Tor called that meeting just for the fun of it?”

Finn flashed red. I could tell he knew a thing or two.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Wired Up and Poking Around

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Chewy (not to be confused with The Other CHEWIE) took a step back frome the periscope. Where’s that stupid woman, he wondered. Out of the corner of his eye he noticed his little brother, Jabba, was snoring… IN DA CAPTAIN’S CHAIR!

“JABBA!!!” Chewy’s voice was so loud poor Jabba fell off the chair, a mess of black and silver hair. Running his paws through his red beard he looked over at Chewy, embarrassed.

“Sorry Chewy,” he mumbled. “Just taking 40 winks.”
“No time!” Chewy barked back. “We got to get ready to leave the sub. Matti promised Stavros he’s have the submarine back before sunset. Where is Forever?”
“Saying goodbye to Matti and Indi,” mumbled Jabba. When he saw Chewy’s face he hastily added: “You know how silly she is about the dogs.”
“I’m going to get her,” snapped Chewy. “Go and fetch that blasted hedgehog she’s so potty about and let’s go.”

Chewy went into Forever’s cubicle. She was combing Matt’s hair. Knowing they promised the cheeky Greek lieutenant to have the sub back WITHOUT ANY HAIR FROM MATTI OR INDI Chewy relented, and decided not to shout at her. Not that he ever did, mind you – Forever was his whole life. Chewy sighed, gave a cute squeak that he knew she’d find irresistible and put on his beseeching eyes. Forever glanced over, smiled and stopped brushing Matti. Indi was relaxing in the corner, and came over to relieve Forever of the comb – she’s already been brushed. Forever kissed Matti and Indi on their brown noses, grabbed her denim jacket – to match those blue jeans, of course – and they walked over to the exit hatch.

Jabba had already opened it and climbed out of the grey Greek submarine. Forever followed Chewy out, and wiped away a tear as Indi closed the hatch. Jabba was carrying the hedgeholg – who was very prickly because he’d been woken up – on his back.

“Look, there’s the ship!” shouted Forever, and began waving frantically. Chewy and Jabba barked loudly, trying to catch someone’s attention.

“They’re not expecting us – I wonder if they can hear us?” said Forever. Suddenly the submarine began to submerge, and water touched their feet. Matti was taking the submarine back to Greece.

“Oh dear!” said Forever. “Can anyone see us? Help! Help! CC? Advicuss? George? Help!”

The water was rising, and covered their ankles…
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Down Periscope

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb climbed aboard the boat and dropped her bags with a loud THUD. “Where are the bellhops in this joint,” she said under her breath. “Geeze, I can tell the service is going to suck already.”

Deb grabbed a slice of pizza and unzipped her suitcase digging out her bikini. Finding her hot pink one she went off in search of a place to change. Finding the bathroom, Deb quickly changed.

“QUACK”

Deb jumped up and hit her head on the ceiling…What tha? Deb pulled back the shower curtain to see Dirk looking at her with those evil duck eyeballs. She reached in, grabbed the duck by his webbed foot and tossed him in the toilet water. “There you are you dumb duck; get in the water where ya belong.” She wondered if she should flush…nah.

Checking herself out in the mirror, Deb picked more straw out of her hair. “The plane goes up…the plane goes down…what the hell is wrong with that man?”

Deb left the bathroom in her hot pink bikini and what do you know…she ran right into a bar. WOOHOO!

She walked past Tor and Winda obviously engaged in some deep gossip and ordered her a BIG drinkypoo with an umbrella! “What, no umbrellas? Deb rolled her eyes, grabbed an olive to toss in her drink and headed out.

“Hey Deb, sit with us a minute. We have something important to talk about,” Tor said.

“Not right now Mr. can’t fly a damn plane. I need to get unstressed first,” Deb said.

Deb took her drink out to the deck and plopped down to catch some rays and a much needed buzz!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Destressing time!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
‘So how many are there on board?’ asked Princess Penelope.

‘GAWD, I don’t know,’ replied Scarlett. ‘This thing has a cast of thousands.’

Scarlett, sis and a jet load of ducks had flown in from England and surprisingly enjoyed a smooth landing. They were now relaxing with champagne in the royal cabin of the SS Whateveritscalled with a bottle of champagne.

‘You know sis, I’m real glad you came with me. I mean, I WUB all my American friends to pieces but not only do they speak in strange accents, they smell …er…spell funny too.

‘Yeah, I noticed that Emmloo gal whiffed a bit when I was speaking to her earlier. She was telling me she brought George Clooney along with her.’

‘Oh take no notice of her ramblings. It’s just a figment of her over-active imagination. We have to humour her though. Some people just can’t live in the real world can they?’

‘You know, thinking about it Scarlett, we could have brought Robbie Williams with us. He only lives down the road from me and I hear he likes to support “Help the Aged.”’

‘Nice idea, but for this trip my heart belongs to the mighty white knight, the defender of the light, master of the sturdy Advillicuss, wubber of ducky dudes and expert sailor of the seven seas. Robbie will have to wait in line. You could have brought your hero Elvis though.’

‘But sis, he’s d…’

‘Look Princess Penny, if you’re going to be accepted by this crew, you have to understand there is no logic around here and anything goes, okay? Anyway, we all know he’s alive and well and working in a chip shop in Rotherham.’

‘Talking of chips is it a formal dinner tonight?’ enquired Penny.

‘Trust you to be thinking of your belly. No idea, most of them seem to be accumulating around the bar, I guess we’d better join them and see what the plans are.’

‘It’s a beautiful sunset,’ commented Penny as she gazed out to sea through the porthole. ‘But WHO is that wading on the shore, waving frantically at us?’

‘Let me look…GAWD…It’s Forever…I’d recognise those denims anywhere. We better go find CC and send out a lifeboat.’
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: To the Rescue

choices: Is  that boat ever going to leave?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Hey I'm all for saving Forever from the waves but has anyone any idea how hard it is to keep 65 sheep under controll!!!!!!!

We've been stuck in the departure lounge at La Rochelle harbour for days now. Waiting for the Captain Dude to pick us up en route to Nottingham.

By the way for all you non French speakers "en route" is French for on the way.

"Baa baa baaaaa baa" Yes I know girls the organisation has been a bit suspect so I think we'd better get ourselves over to the U.S of A. and pick up the boat there. It looks a real smart boat too, so I want some of the action.

Now the only problem is transport. Okay Number One you're in charge while I go and find us some wings.

Esperaza leaves the lounge avoiding several sheep who were arguing about whose turn it was to go to the Baa! Outside there where children everywhere dressed up for Halloween, . Witches on broomsticks, little red Devils, Ghosties and Ghoulies plus a few Pumpkins. And there was the solution, all I needed was 67 broomsticks and a following wind and we'd be in America before they'd even managed to drag Forever from the sea.

Now if you've seen Harry Potter you know that riding a Broomstick is not a simple thing. And to watch 65 sheep and a sheepdog trying to get the hang of it will be talked about by the good people of La Rochelle for years to come. It even appeared on the 8 o'clock news. But eventually I was at the head of a Baa Plane and we headed out to sea in a westerly direction. The following wind was not a problem as sheep produce gas for a pastime, just nobody light a match as we land otherwise it will be the biggest Ram Roast you have ever seen.

So wait for us Captain Dude, the Foreign Legion is on it's way.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Esperaza is worried, where are those Yankies!!!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Stealthman (who’s really the mild mannered good-looking dude man) walked the deck of the yacht thinking CC actually did something right—pretty nifty boat, when he heard a woman’s scream.

“It’s Forever! Over on the shore! Someone’s got to get her—CC!”

Stealthman look around for a clue as to where the dunderhead CC may be. Sure enough CC was springing into action. Stealthman saw the scrawny duck lover throw open a big box with EMERGENCY written on it. He threw out a stretcher, a difibulator, a roll of masking tape. “Aha!” he exclaimed (cause he found somthin’)

CC pulls out a red plastic thingy, plops his scrawny arse on the deck and begins to blow up a plastic duck floatie. Stealthman begins to worry about him cause with all the puffing his mustache is starting to curl and his face is turning blue; and the dang thing is barely beginning to inflate.

“This could take awhile,” Stealthman reasons. “We’ll be halfway there before he gets that dang thing inflated. There’s only one thing to do—Stealthman to the rescue!”

Stealthman springs into action and reaches just above his navel for the atomizer button. He thinks, “Shoreline—Forever” and pushes it. Instantly all his stealth atoms are flung to where Forever is jumping up and down and waving.

“No need for that, darlin’” Stealthman speaks into Forevers ear.

Whips around to see only blank space. “Who said that?”

“Never fear, I’ll rescue you!”

“Not in this life you won’t! You show yourself or else…or else I’ll do somethin’”

Stealthman walks up to the fair Forever and scoops his arm around her waist, “Hold on! We’re going sailing.” He says thinking that was pretty cool.

Forever fades into thin air—invisible. However, instantly he hears growls and yips and feel pain radiate through his butt-parts as two dogs clamp onto a whole bunch of nothing. Not knowing what else to do, Stealthman thinks “Boat!” and pushes the atomizer.

On board the boat, Stealthman turns loose of Forever who materializes at CC’s feet. CC’s eyes grow big and he stops blowing. “Dayum! Wimmins keep poppin’ out of the air at my feet. Am I asleep?”

Forever jumps to her feet and screams, “Chewie, Jaba, where are you two. Come here guys!” Instantly two monster dogs materialize and run up to Forever; they have pieces of cloth that look a little like pajamas in their mouths.

Stealthman, with is pride injured and his butt parts smartin’ runs off down the deck. He ducks into the first cabin he finds and runs to the washbasin, filling it up with water and planting his injured rear-end therein.

“I’ve got to stop helping people. Seems I always get whompped.”

He looks around. This is not his cabin. Heck, he doesn’t have a cabin; he was invisible when Nada handed out the assignments. “Hmm, wonder where I am?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Hey, Give Me A Break

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Lying out in the sun Deb slurps her drink. About that time Scarlett trips over Deb.

“Hi Deb, it’s so good to see you.” Scarlett said as she tilted her drink to get the last drop. “C…Ceeeeeeeeee where the hell are you? The queen is out of booze. Where is he?”

“Ah Scarlett he was over there blowing up a rubber duck. I think someone’s drowning and CC is going to rescue them…Deb laughs hysterically who ever it is that needs saving better not wait on him….

“Oh okay well I see Stealthman…oh where did he go? This is insanity. What is wrong with this group of people?” Scarlett asked.

“I don’t know but I’m going back to the bar…want something?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Saving Forever

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Party was leaning on the deck railing, dunking peanut butter cups in his glass of Corona while he gazed admiringly at the open sea before them...and Deb in her hot pink bikini.

Suddenly, he caught site of Forever jumping up and down just off shore. Just as quickly, she disappeared. Surely she must have gone under, he thought.

There was no time to lose. He raced over and scooped Deb off of her lounge chair and rushed back to the edge of the deck. "You're dressed for a rescue! Go help Forever!" He held onto her for a few more minutes, just because he liked it, then finally threw her into the sea.

He noticed Lauren walking nearby and quickly grabbed her. "You like fish, so you'll be good at this!" Party tossed her in, too. Then he shoved Emmyloo in just for that Brittany crack, and because it was time someone took action in dealing with that smell.

After all three were in the water, he turned around and saw Forever suddenly materialize next to CC. Damn atomizers really should keep people informed! Now what? Party looked down at the three women in the water and did the only thing he could think of - he slinked inside and tried to find his cabin.

While checking for an empty room, he accidently opened a broom closet and was surprised to find Mr. Clooney standing sheepishly behind a mop, and not CC's jabby mop either.

Party sighed. "Whatever." He slammed the door and kept looking.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Fooled my the atomizer!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Great...just great," Deb said climbing back on the boat.

Deb didn't realize her bikini was at the bottom of the DANG OCEAN.

"DEB here's a towel," Scarlett said throwing a beach towel at her.

Aw it had ducks on it. How cute is that? Deb thought as she wrapped herself up and went inside to get her aqua blue bikini and another blue pill. Next stop would be the bar.

"Hi Forever," Deb said as she ran past her. Once inside she jumped into another bathing suit and headed for the bar.

"Hi Deb," Kathy Lee said as she walked past her.

"What tha? Nah it couldn't be."

"Hi Tor and Winda. What's up?" Deb said as she plopped down at their table. "Oh by the way has anyone seen Party? This boat isn't big enough for him to hide."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Party is Dead Meat

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I knew it was going to take some doing to navigate my way around this ship. I had made it to the deck, where Party shoved me overboard! All those peanut butter cups have gone to his brain, I can tell. Deb and I treaded water for a minute, then climbed back on board. Poor Deb, losing that lovely bikini.

I didn’t take time to change clothes; I wanted to get to the bar. Where in the heck was the bar?

Finding the bar would be no easy task, and my GPS was useless belowdecks, which is where I found myself looking for the gathering place. I tucked the contraption back into my backpack and resolved to find my way sans modern technology.

I ran into Mel, who was looking for her injured hubby and shortly we were joined by Teresa, walking Chewie on a lavender leash.

“Poor thing’s starting to go crazy, all cooped up,” Teresa answered Mel’s quizzical expression. “Anybody know where the bar is? I could use a belt or two!”

And so it was we three women were wandering the halls when we heard the commotion in Ben’s cabin. Shouting, followed by a thump, then silence.

“Ben!” Teresa called out. “Are you OK?”

There was no reply, only whimpering.

When we opened the door we found Ben, iron skillet in hand, standing over the prone body of the stealth dude.

“I didn’t mean to kill him, honest!” Ben said, as Chewie nibbled the dude’s ear. “I was just working away here with these naked mole rats when I heard water running in my bathroom. All I saw was a guy in pajamas with his butt hanging out the back of them, and I guess I panicked.”

“You hit him with the skillet,” Mel observed, smiling.

Ben merely nodded, entranced by the sight of Chewie nibbling on the dude’s nose.

“You brought an iron skillet with you?” Teresa was dumfounded.

“Of course. Doesn’t everyone bring one on a cruise?”

Chewie was by now purring as she padded on the dude’s soft belly.

“Well, I didn’t think to bring one,” Teresa said. “I wonder, will I need my own?”

Chewie’s tongue rasped pleasantly in the dude’s belly button, exposed by his untucked jammie top.

“Don’t worry dear, you can always borrow mine,” Mel offered.

“I may need to borrow one, too,” I said, dripping on the carpet. I’m afraid I didn’t think to pack an iron skillet, either.”

“Chewie! No nibbling there!” Teresa jerked the leash and Chewie looked up with a wounded expression before moving down to curl up between the dude’s knees.

“I doubt he’s dead,” Mel said. “He’s got a hard noggin. I’ve tested it.”

I pulled smelling salts from my backpack and wafted them under the dude’s nose while Mel drilled Ben on his personal iron skillet wielding technique.

The dude sputtered and choked; he reached unconsciously for his atomizing button, but by then Chewie was sitting on it. He propped himself on his elbows, sending Chewie rolling gracefully off her throne mound.

Wincing as he rubbed the knots on his head, the dude said, “Dang it! Why couldn’t I have picked Kathy Lee’s cabin?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Stealthman Exposed

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dan looked at the puzzled faced looking down at him and whinced as one of the dogs sniffed his crotch. This was totally unacceptible. Way too many people were learning the truth about who Stealthman was. You can't be a super hero if'n everyone knows who you are...it's in the Super-Dude Rule Book.

Dan felt in his shirt pocket. They weren't there. He looked around and saw them laying on the floor. Ben had almost stepped on them. He reached; Chewy growled.

"Hey, ah, Ben...could you hand me those shades. It's kinda bright in here.

The group looked at each other and thought, "Bright?"

"Sure," Ben shoved the glasses over to Dan who immediately picked them up and put them on. His brain raced and he thought, "OK, how did they do that in Men In Black?" He pulled out the little do-dad and held it up.

"Smile everyone!"

The group stared at the device as Dan twisted the handle...FLASH! Dan jumped up as the group shook their heads. He slipped out the door as he heard Forever say, "What's goin' on? Hi, Ben."

"Hi Forever, what you doin' in my room."

Dan smiled as he trotted off down the hall. He noticed a blue bikini truning in a room and thought, "Why not?"

When he got to the room he read "Ship's Bar" on the glass and below that "Enter." He did.

Over at the bar, perched on the bar stools he saw the blue bikini, Wind, and Tor. He approached the group.

"Hi guys!"

"It's about time." Tor grumbled.

"Hey, I been doing stuff. OK, were all here; whatcha got?"

The collective heads of the group leaned in closer to Tor...expecting.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Men in Black Flash Thingy

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
About this time Nada has a real headache. What I need is some knock-out drops…for the unruly passengers, then I’d be fine. Instead she takes some Advil, washing it down with a swig of her sliver, etched flask. Ahhh.

What the heck, do we have to wait on the Sheepherder and her gang….or can we get underway and she’ll find us at sea. After all, how difficult can it be to see a beautiful ship dragging a floating barn behind it? My mind made up, I freshened up and changed into my formal attire, a beautiful black gown of velvet, with Cinderella-like evening shoes. I was so happy to have a large wardrobe…the largest onboard, except for Da Queen’s closet...she had more shoes than Phyllis. But oh well, having the only safe onboard meant that her case of jewels would be safe. **Note, offer Da Queen a little space in the safe, for da crown jewels. Satisfied that I looked terrific, I left the suite, in search of the Motley Crew.

Up to the pool area I go, when who should appear, passed out in a lounge chair?

“DEB….woooo-hoooo…wake-up!” Clearly Deb had had one too many. Looking around the pool area, it was sooo beautiful, but empty!


Hmmm, I’ll try Scarlett’s suite, and she headed down a deck to the Queen’s sumptuous digs…knock-knock. “My Queen, are you in there? It’s Nada!” Silence, so I tried the door. I opened it a crack, revealing….

Gawd, I shouldda taken this suite, it’s really lovely! I closed the door, half sorry she wasn’t in the room. I went down another deck and as I rounded the corner I caught sight of this….

“Pssst…Nanette…may I help you?”

Gawd, I decided to go back, but first I stopped into another assigned room….

“Ben? Is that you? It’s me, Nada.”

Hmmmm, maybe he has water in his ear or something…seems to be checking out the stockmarket or something. Guess I’ll leave him be for now.

Back uptop I stepped onto the promenade deck…gawd, now who is that?

Oh, I see Forever has managed to find the ballroom dancing instructor. Gawd. This time, I head back inside, determined to have a drink…er…find the bar, where I knew the rest of them would be. I see an officer, so I stop to ask directions…”Sir, could you tell me where the elegant group of passengers are?”

And he answered me…


So, I decided to find it myself…I just followed the Karaoke Music….
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Let's get this floating asylum moving!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It’s time to dance!!!!

With the boat finally moving away from shore, Deb ran to change for the evening.

“Where the heck is my room?” Deb asked herself as she stumbled hitting the walls side to side. “Damn this boat can float.”

She tripped over her suitcases in the middle of the floor and picked them up. Dragging them behind her Deb started opening cabin doors.

“Oh dude, what is up with kissing a dog?” Deb asked and then shut the door, sicko

She continued down the hall and opened the next door only to find CC dancing with his jabby thang. OMG I am not drunk enough for this.

Finally Deb found an empty room and quickly changed AGAIN;


“QUACK”

“Oh hell no!” Deb said turning around to see Dirk kicked back drinking a bud and smoking a cigar.

“Oh what the hell…Dirk do I look fat in this dress?”

** Image ID #1156787 Unavailable **
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Ready for dancing!

choices: Dinner and dancing to die for!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was sitting at the beautifully appointed writing desk in her cabin emailing my Hubby.

Honey,

This cruise is a riot. No, seriously. A quick recap of the adventure so far. Nada (240) and all of her ducks came and she brought her friend Phyllis. She also stopped and picked up Lauren Gale (66) or Lauren as we call her and her fish Finn; then they came and got me ( Chewie Kittie (114) ) Teresa and my cat, Chewie. While we were in Montana, we picked up partyof5dj and his waders and peanut butter cups. Then it was on to pick up ~Wind in my Wings~ (124) (sorry, Winda ), emmyloo, who brought the food, and PastVoices (125) or Nanette. Nanette did bring her granddaughter, Tara, but Tara’s mother got wind of the adventure and came and picked her up while we were waiting to board the boat that ccstring and his foul-mouthed horse Advilicuss found for us. We also stopped in NYC and picked up Ŧĥē Beŋ (61) and cruise ship star Kathy Lee!

We have a Texas contingent on board, too. David McClain (173) , PlannerDan (180) or Stealthman or Dan, welkerdeb and Tor’s wife Mel who is MIGHTY handy with a frying pan. They arrived via stolen airplane which Tor crash landed in a barn. Tor and Mel brought their band of evil ducks.

Once we all got here, we waited for the Queen or Scarlett (247) and her sister the Princess Penelope and all of the Royal Ducks to fly in from England. ( I know we were going to join them, but it’s funner if they make the trip with us!) esperaza (37) and her 65 sheep and sheepdog are meeting us en route. I believe they will be arriving on broomsticks. We had a close call with Sarah (319) and Jabba and HER Chewy (both dogs) and her hedgehog - I don’t know his name - Stealthman saved them all from drowning after her sub left them high and well, rather damp.

I took Chewie out for a walk earlier on her leash, but for some reason I don’t remember bits of it. Odd that. She always looks so cute on her pink leash. I’m glad that my bunkmate, Nanette, doesn’t mind cats. Well, I’m off to dress for dinner, I believe we are having formal night. I’m glad to put those eyebrows to good use!!

and Love, Me

“Nanette! I’m done with the internet connection if you want it before dinner. I’m just going to feed Chewie before we go up to dinner.”

“Excellent. I’ll check my email really quick while you get ready and we can go up together. Two wild women out on the town!”

We giggled wildly as I rummaged through my luggage looking for the tins of cat food.

Soft squeaks could be heard coming from my luggage and I began laughing loudly as I saw the source of the sounds.

** Image ID #1172994 Unavailable **

“You didn’t think you were going on an adventure without us did you?” Dolly Duck quacked the question laughingly. The little blue stowaway was joined by her partners in crime, Chocolate the Moose, Weenie the Dachshund, and Strut the Rooster. “We wanted to come meet your WDC friends, too!”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A quick overview and Stowaways!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Everyone else gets a private cabin and I am rooming with an entire zoo. It was OK when it was Teresa and her cat, but she opened he luggage a while ago to a whole mess of angry varmints. "As usual, nothing in my AOL mail worth opening and all my WDC friends are here on this cockamaimie luxury boat with us. Please go on ahead to dinner, Teresa, I will be along shortly."

Pretending to check Internet things, PastVoices had suctioned cup a mirror to T's laptop and was working on her make-up. She had her eye on a certain lifeguard from earlier in the day, but was distracted by the sudden appearance of Forever and her dogs, wet and a little worse for wear. PastVoices didn't want anyone to get a whiff of her brain-lusting less she destroy her reputation and just in case the guy was only being nice and offering her that life-saving thingie he had in his hand. After all, I have lost 30 pounds not 130.

Teresa calms the zoo and heads out to check out the evening meal. She screams and lands on her butt in the middle of the hallway. "YIKES! I don't see anything I could have tripped on or anything I could have run into but I swear there was something there." She gets up brushes herself off, straightens her sequined gown and heads off to find dinner.

Stealthman didn't mean to run into her, he just isn't real sure where he is supposed to be. With the holes in his britches, he can't very well show himself to Nada to ask for a room assignment. For that matter, he can't risk anyone seeing him in this state. He stood over next to the wall, out of the way, making sure Teresa was able to get up, and started checking again for empty cabins.

Just as PastVoices is ready to sneak out of the room to snoop for the chest pool dude, she hears a noise coming from the bathroom. Climbing out of the cabinet under the sink with a look of fear on his face is Partydude. "What in the world are you doing hiding under our sink?"

He answers, whispering, "You haven't seen Lauren or Deb, have you?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: What is this, an Ark?

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the ethereal Nada glided past, her gown floating in the evening breeze, Forever broke her gaze from the ballroom dancing instructor’s dreamy eyes. It was difficult, but she had to tell Nada the dreadful news she’d learned since the rescue from the Greek submarine.

“Where are going?” the dreamy eyed man asked. Forever smoothed the ball gown over her jeans (can’t separate that girl from her denims!) and, managing to avoid looking into said dreamy eyes, pointed to Nada’s elegant back.
“I have to speak to Nada,” she explained. “I’ll be back.”
“I hope so,” murmured Dreamy Eyes. “Most people I teach to ballroom dance have two left feet. You, on the other hand-“
“I know, I know!” snapped Forever, making a mental note to as CC if there was a plank anywhere they could use for Dreamy Eyes to walk down. “But this is important! Top secret stuff!” Praying he couldn’t see the telltale jeans underneath the ball gown she hurried off after Nada.

She found Nada talking to a rather handsome officer – his thick graying hair brought Richard Gere to mind, but this guy was much taller. Thinking (and hoping) maybe someone had smuggled RG aboard (at least Forever wasn’t very tall!) she tapped Nada on the back. Regally Nada turned around, and greeted Forever. The ball gown looked pretty familiar, but it really didn’t fit the girl right, thought Nada. Reading her thoughts Forever had the grace to blush.

“Sorry Nada – I’ve only got jeans with me, so I raided your closet. You’ve got some great gear, by the way. It’s just a bit tight on me…” Forever wriggled uncomfortably in Nada’s exquisite Chanel dress.
“So I noticed,” Nada remarked. “That was one of my favourite dresses, BTW. You’re lucky I have such a wonderful, kind, forgiving personality. Otherwise you might find yourself on The Plank.”
“Oh, I’m so glad there’s a plank!” Forever explained, jumping up and down and stretching the gown to its tailored seams’ limits. “Nada – that dancing instructor – who employed him?”
“I’m not sure, but I can find out – why?”
“Well he’s trouble,” Forever told her. “That’s why we had to use the submarine to get here. And it’s why I had to bring Chewy, Jabba and Herman.”
“Herman? Who’s Herman?” Nada asked. She was starting to worry – perhaps all that Greek food had pickled Forever’s brain.
“Herman hedgehog,” explained Forever, touching the rather large, ugly brown brooch pinned precariously on her – sorry, NADA’s – dress. The brooch unfurled, and a pair of shining dark eyes looked out at Nada. Herman the Hedgehog was in disguise!

Making a mental note to donate the dress to Forever because Herman’s “marks” would NEVER come out, Nada jumped as Herman greeted her. At the shocked expression on her face Herman sighed.
“I suppose you thought only DUCKS could talk,” he said, accusingly.
“No… “ Nada was too surprised to say anymore. Forever interrupted her.
“That dancing instructor – you’ve got to find out what he’s doing here! And who brought him on!”
“Why?”
Forever drew a deep breath, and as the side seam in the Chanel dress finally gae way announced:
“ His name is MURPHY!!!”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Dancing Instructor!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You ever have one of those moments when you come-to after a day dream and wonder what you missed? It was the strangest thing. One minute I was standing outside Ben’s door with Teresa and Mel, the next minute I was holding out my hand, asking him if I could borrow his iron skillet.

What in the heck had I lost???

I figured it would come back to me in the middle of the night sometime. I only hope it’s not a nightmare.

It was just as I was zipping the iron skillet into my backpack that our begowned Cruise Director swept in the door.

“It’s time to get changed and hie yourselves up to the lounge, kids.” Kids??? “Da Queen’s on board and the party’s about to begin.”

“Speaking of the devil, “I said, “Do you know where Party’s at?”

“Last I saw, he was tuxed up and schmoozing Kathy Lee in the bar.”

Dag nab it. I’d missed my chance to spy on the conniving Texan contingent. Oh well, I had a bigger moose to trap.

I rushed to my room, but made a stop by Nada’s first. Think I had time to go find an evening gown before setting sail? No way. But I knew she’d have a closet full and I doubted she’d mind sharing. Even if she did, it made no difference, I was a-borrowing.

“This dress is a little short, isn’t it, Finn?” I asked my floating friend as I admired the flowing red gown. He flashed blue in agreement.

“No matter. I’ll bet Forever’s in jeans so no one’ll notice I’m showing my ankles. But dang, the shoes are gonna be a tight fit.” Next, Finn went into his travel cup and got stashed in the outside compartment of my backpack, then I headed down the hall.

And that was when luck stepped up beside me. First, I smelled the smell. It was vaguely familiar – where had I smell that smell before? Ohhhhh yeaaaa, Old Spice – my father’s fragrance. But most recently it had come at me from behind, just before I’d been tossed overboard!

Then, I heard the voices. Party saying, “Do we have to go to your room? Couldn’t we do it anywhere?”

“Oh, no. It’s much more comfy in my room. And private. And it’s got good lighting. I like to see what I’m handling,” Kathy Lee replied.

I ducked into the nearest room, only to find Forever frantically pinning the burst seam of her evening gown. I guess I’d had her wrong – she’s a real lady, after all.

“It can get kind of slippery and I always need to wash my hands after. You silly boy.” Kathy Lee was dragging Party by the hand as they turned the corner.

“Lauren, help me with this safety pin, would you?” Forever asked.

I put my finger to my mouth and whispered back, “Just a minute, I’ve got a job to do first.” I pulled the iron skillet from my backpack and laid in wait.

What a pleasant sound a noggin makes when it comes into contact with a fast moving iron skillet. The wrist flip provides a satisfactory rebound in case of the need for a second hit. No second hit was needed. Party was out cold on the floor.

“Oh, why did you go and do that?” Kathy Lee cried. He was the only one who was willing to let me make bust of him!!!!”

“I guess no one else trusts you with a glob of gooey clay,” observed Forever, who had successfully pinned herself and was now standing next to me. She cocked her head and looked Party over good. “Is that a peanut butter cup stain on his shirt front?” she wondered.

Kathy Lee stomped her foot and stuck her tongue out at Forever and me before letting herself into her room and slamming the door.

Forever and I each grabbed one of Party’s arms and heaved a mighty heave ho. The body moved not an inch, and I turned an ankle in those too-small sparkly shoes of Nada’s. Off came the shoes, then I pulled the dress up and tied it around my waist. This was serious business, requiring girded loins.

“Hey, nice undies,” Forever said. “Are those Victoria Secret? They are so hard to find in Turkey.”

“Come on, Forever, tie up your dress and let’s get this guy moved before he wakes up.”

To my astonishment I discovered I’d had Forever figured right all along. The lady wears blue jeans under her evening gown. I have to admit though, such an arrangement of layers made it easy for her to tuck in her dress.

“Is this going to take long?” Forever asked. “I’ve go to get back upstairs and get Murphy off the boat.”

Murphy? Who the heck was Murphy? No time to get into that now, though.

With a fair amount of grunting and groaning, we two wimmins managed to drag Party to Deb’s cabin. Her look of glee when she saw the prostrate miscreant was a delight to see. I almost pitied the poor man. He was in for it.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Murphus Interruptus

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb was handed a folded piece of paper while dancing with Clooney. The words on the outside read “TOP SECRET” and she knew the hit had been made.

“Excuse me Mr. Clooney but I have very important business to attend to. Shall we hook up later?” Deb asked but didn’t stick around for the answer. She swiftly made her way out of the bar and to her room.

Deb opened her door and her eyeballs almost popped out of her head. “Lauren, what in the world is up with that dress? Didn’t you read DRY CLEAN ONLY before throwing it in the dryer? Then she did a double take at Forever. What the hell is SHE wearing? “Forever, tell me you are not wearing blue jeans under that gown. Girls we need to talk about fashion ethics…” Deb was interrupted by the groans of Party.

There he was all tied up and so pitiful looking. Oh poor thing and for a moment Deb felt a little sympathy for him. Oh hell no she didn’t.

“Well well well…what’s up party?”

“Deb help me. Lauren has gone mad. She hit me over the head for NO reason and I don’t know how I got in your room.”

“Lauren…Forever…I got it from here,” Deb said and the girls left laughing hysterically.

“Okay Party let’s talk shall we?”

“Sure Deb, but could you untie me,” Party said squirming around.

“Uh no. Now listen to me; you threw me into the ocean and I lost my hot pink bikini and now I’m a little ticked off,” Deb said as she sat down and poured herself a glass of bubbly.

“Ah Deb you had another bikini. What’s the big deal?”

“You also threw my buddies into the ocean too.”

“Oh come on. Can’t you ladies take a joke?” Party said while ducking to miss being hit with a flying champagne glass.

“No and now I shall seek justice. You know Party if you would have just VALIDATED my feelings I might have let you off the hook.” Deb got up and went over to the DVD player and inserted a DVD.

“Oh we gonna watch some porn,” Party asked excitedly.

Whack

“Ouch what ya do that for,” Party said rubbing his lumpy head.

“Now listen up…here is how this going to go down…The movie is a two hour instructional tape on how to treat a woman. It is narrated by a metro male type and he will teach you how to validate a woman’s feelings, talk to a woman, LISTEN to a woman, etc. As a bonus he will also transform you into a metro male yourself. You will learn about all the new products out there to smooth your skin, tone that tummy, hair removal, etc.”

“Yeah okay Deb.” Party said sarcastically. “I’m a little sleepy so I’ll try and stay awake to watch your little movie.”

“DIRK get out here.”

“Quack quack,” Dirk came out of the bathroom still smoking his Cuban cigar.

“What? Oh hell no, you aren’t leaving me in here with this duck are you?” Party started to get panicky.

“Dirk here is going to see to it you don’t get sleepy and miss the instructional video. When it’s over he is going to restart it until you are begging for mercy. Dirk is relentless and a horny little duck so DON’T FALL ASLEEP.” Deb said as she left the room.

Deb heard Party’s scream for help right before Dirk slapped tape on his mouth. That’ll teach him to not ever throw women in the ocean and then not validate their feelings, she thought to herself with a big smile on her face.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Sweet Revenge

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Party sighed and leaned against the edge of the bed. His head hurt a little, but fortunately he was a man and his skull was thick. A bizarre-looking man appeared on the television screen. A metro male, he presumed.

“Women are like onions, gentlemen. When you peel them, you cry,” the man on the screen began.

“Oh, brother,” Party moaned. “Hey, Dirk. You listening to this crap? You do want to be a metro duck, don’t you? Better pay attention, my little fowl-smelling kidnapper.”

“Shut up and watch!” Dirk yelled.

Party glanced back at the strange man on the television and mumbled, “Validate my butt. Once I get out of here I’ll validate that woman, but good!”

Party was a mountain boy and one thing a mountain boy never does without is his pocketknife. He engaged Dirk in some conversation as he worked his hand into his back pocket.

“So, Dirk, you seeing anyone these days?” he asked.

Dirk just rolled his eyes and shook his head.

“Ooo, touchy subject, huh? Sorry,” Party said. He had the blade nearly through the rope, but he had to get Dirk to focus elsewhere. “Hey, you know what might take the edge off your loneliness? This ship has satellite – why don’t you try to pick up some Daisy Duck on that tv. She’s pretty hot, huh?”

Dirk looked at the television. “They’ve got satellite?”

“Yeah! Go ahead, give it a shot,” Party said as he cut through the final strands of rope.

“Well…maybe,” Dirk said as he reached for the remote.

Party quickly jumped up and grabbed the champagne bucket, then slammed it down on top of Dirk. He grabbed a five gallon bucket of orange pills that Deb had left on the nightstand and set it on top of the bucket.

“What the…” Dirk’s muffled squawks made Party laugh.

“Have fun in there fantasizing about Daisy, buddy!” he yelled as he bolted out the door. “I’ll show Miss Metro some validation.”

As he hurried down the hall he suddenly remembered Emmyloo. He hadn’t seen her since he shoved her in the ocean. Oh well, he was certain she’d show up eventually.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Validation my butt!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
'So, are you quite happy with your room Scarlett?' asked CC.

'Oh, it's beautiful thank you. The walk in wardrobe full of new gowns and matching shoes is out of this world. The private gym and pool are amazing and the plasma screen television, state of the art computer and music system to die for. And I've never seen such a well-stocked bar...hic...I really can't thank you enough.' Scarlett smiled sweetly at CC who really was the handsomest, hunkiest man she'd ever clapped eyes on. So eloquently spoken too. (Hey, I didn't know I could write fantasy so well)

'And how is the Princess Penelope settling in?'

'Oh great. A little hungry, but then she usually is. She's all ready for dinner so I left her surfing the net to take her mind off food for a while. She's found an interactive story on some writing site and chuckling away to herself as we speak. Small things amuse small minds as we well know.'

'What do you think of the passengers from WDC then? Are they living up to your expectations?'

'Oh yes, they're all as weird...erm...wonderful as I'd imagined and such an insane ...erm...interesting bunch of people. All the wimmins are great but I haven't seen much of Partydude yet...Still there's time yet and who knows what may happen?'

CC shuddered. ' That's what worries me Scarlett. Have you noticed any strange goings on out there?'

'Not really, nothing you wouldn't expect from such a bunch of nutcases...erm...nice people. Although I am a little suspicious of the Texan contingent.'

'Tell me your concerns, my dear. One of them in particular has been known to cause a few problems in the past.'

'Well, every time I go in the bar, which is quite frequently...hic...they seem to have their heads together, whispering and smirking. It seems as if they're almost plotting something.'

'Oh, I wouldn't be surprised if one of them is, but he'll have a hard job convincing the others to join his wicked schemes.'

'That's just what I thought CC. I mean Winda is such a lovely lady and she does write the Spiritual Newsletter after all. And we all know Stealthman is really Dan who is well known for his wise philosophies on life.'

'Yes, and I hear he's been performing hairbrained erm...heroic deeds on board too although I do wish he'd get one of the wimmins to repair his pyjamas. Enough to put me off my rump steak seeing that. So what about Deb?'

'Well, I don't think she's involved either really. She just seems to want to get drunk erm... a nice tan but I have noticed that revolting, evil Dirk is trailing after her wherever she goes. Maybe he just fancies her or maybe he's been set up to report on her movements.'

'Sounds to me like I need to keep an eye on someone, not mentioning any names.' CC winked at Scarlett, causing her heart to flutter. She wondered if it would be forward of her to ask him for a first dance later on. Normally, she was quite a shy, retiring character but being away from domestic bondage was boosting her confidence no end. Maybe she ought to ask the dance instructor to help her brush up on her tango. But then she remembered.

'Oh, I nearly forgot, CC. Forever has discovered the dance instructor is really MURPHY in disguise and we all know what that means. Trouble with a capital T. Do you think he may have be connected with the dark side in some way?'

'I must investigate immediately,' replied the Captain. 'There'll be no mutiny on MY ship.'

OR WILL THERE?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Secret Discussion

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
