1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Fire her up

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“WHAT??? You mean Murphy is the dance instructor? Gawd, I thought I left him at home to wreak havok with Hubby. Scarlett….wait, I gotta go, I hear a commotion…but I’m glad you like your room….and…what? Yes, I think it would be entirely wonderful if you asked CC to dance first…after all, you are Da Queen of Hearts. Aren’t you? Ok, so maybe it’s just a fantasy, but as long as you are here, why not live it out!”

Knock..knock..”Errr Scarlett, someone is at my door…see you soon sweety.”

I opened the door to the oddest sight…Dirk on steroids I think….he was dragging some kind of bucket, trailing pills!

“What’s up Dirk? And put down that damn cigar, I’ve just quit smoking! Cough-cough!”

“Look Nada, after what I have been through lately I deserve a cigar… or a medal.” He pushed me aside and limped into my cabin.

“Nice digs…whadja have to do to get a room like this? Much nicer that that damn boat to Hawaii…which brings up a question…where is your old partner in crime, Phyllis?” He poured himself a drink and sat down on MY bed. Good damn question…where is she?

Listen Dirkie boy…make yourself comfy for awhile, I need to go find out what’s happened around here…I feel trouble is on the way.

“Nada…Oh yoooo-hoooo…” It was Lauren and Finn.

“Oh good, it’s you. I’m half-afraid of some of these…nuts…errr friends aboard. What’s happening…and WHAT is up with your..errr…….dare I say … My Chanel...and gawd, look at the foot spillage over my gorgeous shoes. Come with me…Finn, you look great in Red.” I pull Lauren into my cabin…"Now go into the dressing room, I’ll find you something…that comes closer to fitting…” I run next door and rummage through Emmyloo’s suitcase….ahhh, perfect. Where is Emmylou? I heard a strange clanging noise so…I poked my head out of her porthole and saw……

“GEORGE? Is that you?…For goodness sakes, have you no shame man?”

“Glub-sputter…”

“Try the bar.” I slammed the porthole shut.

“Who was that?” Lauren yells…oh dang…lemme get these clothes to her…I ran next door and threw them into the dressing room. “Get dressed, quick, something weird is going on…hey…STOP!” I yelled. I could have sworn I saw Scotty chasing ChewieKitty down the hall…..whoa…as I see the Skipper running after Princess Penelope…followed by a friggin Dolphin in a PANK bikini, and Party with his pocket fisherman!

“OOOOH, this is perfect, if a little too warm.” Lauren exclaimed as she emerged from the dressing room, dressed in a snowsuit and cute furry boots.

“Yeah well, here, have a drink…where’s Dirk?”

“I dunno…wait…there he is,…and on my BICYCLE, the little thief…” and off Lauren went in hot persuit of Dirk.

Sigh. Ring…”Hello.”

“”Nada, you heard anything from the shepherd lady?” It was CC.

“Hi CC…”

“What’s da matter hon? You sound wore out.”

“Big trouble CC. We need some law and order. You seen Stealthman?”

“Hon, nobody actually ‘sees” Stealthman... lessin he wants to be eyeballed.”

“Oh yeah. What about Mel and Tor?”

“Naw, was just about to ask you…any sight of Ben, or Winda?”

“OMG…Winda, she must be keeping Forever steady…sailing isn’t that easy for her…but maybe Chewie and Jabba can help out.”

“Ben though….I have a feeling he and Kathy Lee are being used by that Texas contingent.” I sighed, all I wanted was dinner.

“Ok, thanks hon, I gotta go check on Advilicuss, before he figures out what is going on wif da unstable-stable…and if we are expecting…well…you know.” Click.

“Phyllis…hang on,” I yelled as she too flew by my door, her evening gown flapping…”your hair is a MESS..let’s find Deb..if she’s sober, she can fix it.” Nada closed the door behind her.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Knock-knock...

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Emmy came out of the shower, thankful to finally have that stinky smoke smell gone and the saltwater washed out of her hair. She put on a fluffy robe and went into her cabin.

Suddenly, she heard a clinking sound at her window. When she looked out, she saw George Clooney snorkeling outside.

"Emmyloo! Please let me back inside! I love you!"

"You should have thought about that before you danced with Deb!" Emmy replied, then slammed the porthole shut. "Damn fool thinks Party's the only one who knows how to knock people overboard," she grumbled.

George knocked again. Emmy rolled her eyes, but relented. "Okay, George. You can make it up to me by taking over cooking duties. Now swim on over to the galley. There are a lot of folks upstairs getting sauced, and they're going to need some dinner to soak up that alcohol!"

Emmy slammed the window again and went to her bed. She wondered by her suitcase was open, but noticed the only thing missing was a pair of flannel pajamas. She shrugged, then selected a stunning blue evening gown. It hugged her size 6 figure to perfection, and emphasized her rather fabulous chest.

"Wow, you can't even tell I popped out three kids in the last few years," she said. "I am digging this fantasy thing."

She finished getting ready, and went into the hall, where she was almost knocked over by a rather rough looking Partydude.

"Emmy, help! Deb's after me!"

"Well," Emmy considered, "normally, I'd be mad at you too, Party, but Deb did steal Clooney from me. Plus, I have a feeling those Texans are up to something. Shall we go up to the bar and see what we can find out?"

Party crooked his arm. Emmy couldn't help but notice that in this light he looked sort of like Brad Pitt, but with a better body. They headed up to the bar...
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Preparing for dinner

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Plans had been laid, everything was ready and Tor knew he had done all he could do for the time being. He had dismissed the meeting of the Texas contingent with some disgust; Deb had kept running out and then Dirk went missing...well that couldn't be helped. Now that the ship was sailing out over the open ocean, it was time to put things into motion.

Tor made his way up to the ship's bridge where he found his old buddy CC who was trying to show the Queen, Scarlett how to steer the ship....at least Tor thought that was what he was doing....

"Hey Scarlett," he yelled as he entered the Bridge. "That ain't the ships wheel you are holding on to!"

Embarrassed, Scarlett jumped away..."Well, I never..." she sputtered.

"Yeah, well at that rate you will soon," Tor retorted.

Turning away from Scarlett, Tor stared at CC. "Buddy, so far this party is NOT very organized. Two days and we are just now out of the harbor and headed to England. What you got to say for yourself?"

(BLINK) (BLINK)

(GULP)

(THUD)

Tor shook his head in disgust as CC crumpled to the floor of the Bridge.

"He always does that when someone puts some pressure on him," Tor laughed. "When he comes to tell him he needs to announce formal dinner, since its almost midnight and none of us have eaten....Deb needs food or she never will sober up."

Scarlett nodded stiffly and watched as Tor ambled out of the bridge and continued on into the night.

Once clear of the bridge, Tor chuckled...Just as I figured, he thought, now for phase two of DA PLAN!"

********************************


{wide shot} camera is pulled back to show the entire ship cutting through heavy seas of the Atlantic. It is past midnight and the stars are shining and the ship is awash in light. Slowly the camera pans in tight upon the Ledo Deck and focuses on two figures, clutched together and dancing the Tango to a hot Latin tune coming over the loud speaker.
As the camera tightens in on the two figures we see GEORGE CLOONEY dancing with the dance instructor, Murphy.

"Oh George," Murphy sighed heavily. "You have made me the happiest boy on this cruise. I never knew you...."

"Hush, sweetie," George told the highly excited man in his arms. "There's lots of stuff people don't know about me and you just remember, that dang EmmyLoo and Deb don't mean nothing to me". He twirled Murphy around in a tight pirouette then pulled him roughly back into his embrace as they danced across the deck.

"Listen," Murphy said and he stopped dancing. "What is that sound?"

George cocked his head to one side and listened for a moment. "I don't know." he looked up in the night sky, "but its coming from up above us, I think."

Suddenly the sound became louder: "BAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!"

Murphy visibly blanched. "Oh my God, it sounds like falling shee...............!!"

(THUD)(THUD) (WAP) (WAP)

The sounds of sixty five sheep bodies striking the two dancers from a height of a thousand feet was sickening!

**********************************


{exterior shot}{early morning} Camera is pulled back once again and we can see the entire ship as it sails through the water. Hey, don't blame me. I wanted to practice writing like this in case someone buys the movie rights, okay?.

Slowly the camera zooms in and we see a large group of people standing roughly in a circle staring at the bloody mess on the Ledo Deck. Blood is everywhere and so are sixty five dead sheep and two dead men dressed in tuxes and grasping each other as if they had been dancing.

"Oh My God," CC exclaims. "That there is that George Clooney, the actor feller who has been chasing all the girls on dis boat."

"Yeah," Tor laughs. "Looks like his interests was just a bit broader than wimmen, CC."

Party scans the mayhem, his face is a lovely shade of green at the sight of all the blood and sheep insides, not to mention the two dead dudes. "You think the sheep killed them when they fell outta the sky?"

"Naw," the empty space next to Tor spoke up...Stealthman was there. "The sheep didn't kill em, look closer."

With that, Nada steeled herself and bent down. She grabbed the dead Clooney by the shoulder and turned him on his side....Murphy's body moved with him...they were pinned together!

"Look at that," Lauren yelled, "Can you believe it. THERE'S A LONG, SHARP, POINTY THING STUCK RIGHT THROUGH BOTH OF EM!"

Tor looked thoughtful for a moment. He scratched his chin then he spoke in a very self-satisfied voice.

"And who, fellow travelers, do we know that has his very own sharp, pointy thing of which he is so very proud of?"

Slowly all eyes swivel toward a now very frightened CC who had turned as pale as a ghost.

"Well, "Deb demanded hotly. "What the hell have you got to say for yourself CC?"







Tor stared at the once more fainted Buckethead and grinned his biggest grin. "Yup, you can always count on CC to wilt under pressure".
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Murder by Mutton Bomb!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb runs into her room and finds Party and Dirk gone.

OMG look at my orange pills all over the floor would ya. Where is the maid service in this joint? Deb picks one of the orange pills off the floor and washes it down with a swig of the champagne bottle.

“Whoa this is a trip.” Deb said as she fell over the chair trying to get to the bathroom.

After freshening her makeup and hair Deb went back to the bar. Seeing all the commotion going on outside she grabbed a beer from the bar and went outside.

“OMG what is up with Clooney and who the hell is that stuck to him?” Deb asked Tor.

“Well that there is Murphy and it seems someone stuck them together like shish-ka-bobs.” Tor replied.

“Eww that’s gross. Was old George dancing with Murphy? I knew he was off but damn.”

Deb saw Party out of the corner of her eye and could feel his glaring mountain climbing pocket carrying self shooting evil eyes at her.

Everyone was standing and staring at the corpses like they just couldn’t believe this was happening. It would turn into a regular “who done it” deal. Deb was no rocket scientist but one look at the jabby thing told her CC was behind it all. Who else could it be? Duh!!!

“Okay it’s time to settle things with Party.” Deb thought. He is on my last NERVE. So she went back into the bar and grabbed another drinkypoo with an olive and sat down by Tor to discuss how to deal with a certain troublemaker.

“You know Tor I think we should blow him up with a lot of hot air and send him flying up to Venus. Oh if I could be a fly on a planet."

Deb takes a shot of tequilla.

“Hey Scarlett you have a cigarette?” Deb asked as Scarlett tripped and fell to the ground.

“Uh sure Deb,” hiccup said Scarlett.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: I need Validation

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Nada happened onto the deck just in time. Her hand flew up to her forehead...she felt faint, ok? My gawd, WTF went on in the last 20 minutes....she exhaled... a quick yard clipping necessity...fighting doing her own “THUD” right there where everyone would notice. Nah, too dramatic..even for me.

Pulling out a sparkly compact from her sparkly evening bag, (none other than the famous Diamante..., she checked her gloss...satisfied she put it away and walked to get a bottle of champagne, an order of appetizers and then a little surprise. Guess who was going to get a knock on their door.


BEN...heh-heh...here I come, ready or not. To hell with the mess on the deck...somebody else could clean up...for once!

Of course she had to step over Scarlett...but she was careful not to hurt her.....she would already be hurting in the morning. She would check on her then.

The corridors were empty...everybody standing around the pile of baaaas, and the movie star and Murphy, now inseperable, piled up in a surprisingly neat pile. Life is good. Hmmmm..Ben’s cabin number...

She smiled and knocked.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Time out!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Things are just not going the way Tor said they would. Everybody is either drunk, throwing folks overboard, playing tennis with a skillet for a racket and a head for a ball, or living out some perverted fantasy love life! Geez, you'd think these half baked clams were writers with vivid imaginations or something! Sheesh!!

Now, surely everyone can see that the sharp jabby thingy of CC's is nothing more than circumstantial evidence. Who'd be able to provide an alibi for the dufus? AHA! The Queen and CC have been on each other like white on rice ever since she arrived. Scarlett, you got some 'splaining to do! And would somebody pick this boy up off the deck?! I've heard of fainting goats, but this is ridiculous!!

And where was Stealthman during all this ruckus? You can't see him, but he's supposed to be this super hero dude and able to leap tall buildings in a single bound... oh, wait. Wrong super dude. But where WAS he? Hmmmmm?

And what about Winda? Where the heck has she been? I'll tell ya where. TRYING TO FIND HER ROOM! Would somebody kindly point her in the right direction? She's a little slow on the uptake, you know what I mean? And for Pete's sake, keep her the heck outta the bar!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: What a mess!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
WELL DATS THE LAST OF UM !!!!!!

I turned back around just to make sure all of them poor puffy sheep had been takin care of and YET AGAIN my loverly teak wood decks were in ship shape.
DANG !!!(CC looks up)
I still can't figure HOW IN DA HECK those things fell out of the sky like DAT. AND..AND DAT !!!!
(CC looks over at the two chalked out body marks)

Who is da HECK took my dang Jabby thing and JABBED STUFF !!! (CC kicks Da Dirt) OH !! (I mean Kicked Da Deck)

(CC looks up)
GOOD MORNING MY QUEEN !!!! (CC bows)

Hi CC How are you this morning? Scarlett says.

Oh...I guess I'm ok. It was a rough night gettin all that mess cleaned up..and..and. Along with DAT SKANKY SMELLY LORD OF DARKNESS tryin to Pin dat double Killin thing on me...Well...All that kinda hurt my fellings...I mean...DANG !!!... Havin folks look at me like that with revenge spattered all over thier faces....Well...I got the feelin they wanted to hang me off da yard arm and stuff..

And Ya know Scarlett Hon... All this Dang Fallin over I've been doing...Well you know It's got nuffin to do with ANY DANG PRESSURE LIKE TOR says.. I thought maybe it was just his BAD BREATH !!! dat knocks me out...Cause seems like the only time I fall over is when he's standin right infront of me Yellin some INSANE SNOTTIN CRYIN TYPE HUNK OF FERTILIZER STUFF !!!
Ya think it's his Breath Scarlett ?

Scarlett says "Well granted CC He could use a good FACE SCRUBBIN !!! but I've never heard of breath knockin a person out.

(CC shakes his head)
Yeah... But I can't be fallin all over the place..I mean DANG !!! I fall off Advilicuss enough already..If I keep this up I just as well lay down now and save me the TRIP DOWN !!!!

I swear Hon... Something is going on here...And It's more than just two dudes gettin turned into a shishkebob thang. HEY !!! Ya don't think I've been DRUGGED DO YA !!!! Or maybe I'm SICK !!! Or Maybe I got a bad case of head Stuffage and I'm just wobbly.

The Loverly Queen just grabs ahold of CC's Arm and says...Lets go get somthing to eat my Knoble Defender of the Light. I think things are not as they seem. And maybe we will see Nada at Breakfast and We can sit down and figure out just who would gain from such a fowl deed as we saw yesterday.

CC felt better already and said ... Yeah Your right I've been so busy gettin this dang boat ready that I fear I've not kept a close enough eye On YOU KNOW WHO !!! and Da Stinky Skank has had WAY TO MUCH TIME talkin and planin and sceamin with folks. DA JERK

(CC talks in a snottin cryin girly Tor voice)

OH CC DID IT !!!!
OH LOOK CC FELL OVER !!!
OH MUST A BEEN CC !!!!
IT WAS HIS JABBY THING !!!!

YEAH RIGHT !!! Dang it Scarlett.. Someone is tryin to turn our Boat trip into a... DANG FREAKSHOW !!!!

(Scarlett Says in her Loverly Calm Queenish Voice)

Take it easy CC...We will figure this out.
Let get you a nice Cheese Omelet and see if we can find out anything from the others.

(CC sighs and both head to Da Egg Flinger Dude)

This chapter fades out
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Everything is fallin

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The sun was just peeping over the horizon when I finally stepped out on deck. Dang that Nada, dressing me in a snow suit. Well, to be honest, I kinda like wearing it out on deck, as it’s mighty cold when the ship’s a sailin’. I could almost wish I had a balaclava, too ‘cause my nose freezes numb.

But a snow suit is no attire for a party lounge. Even if I could have found the dance instructor, I wouldn’t have been able to manage any grace. Still, I’d wanted to snuggle up to the hottie, so I’d kept a lookout for him while drinking a few Bud Lights.

Now I want to know who spiked my drink. Just before I passed out on the floor with sweat dripping into my eyes and wondering when we’d make it to the Watering Hole, I watched Nanette tap dancing on the bar. Who woulda known? Still waters run deep, they say.

By the time I awoke and joined the crowd on the deck, I felt quite refreshed. Sometimes all one needs is a good knock-out.

I may have been refreshed, but I wasn’t prepared for the sight of that bloody deck and two MURDERED bodies. No wonder I couldn’t get a dance lesson. I want my money back.

A few sheep still milled around, their coats bearing rusty stains. I reached into my backpack and pulled out a bottle of Woolite, which I handed Esperanza.

Then I dragged out an American Flag, a couple of cement blocks, and a coil of rope.

“Well, Tor,” I said, “looks like you’re gonna get your sea burial, after all.”

I kicked CC in the ribs until he came-to and dropped the bricks and flag on his belly. “I guess as self-appointed captain of this ship, you gotta be responsible for the burials.” To his credit, CC did a fine job and the two unfortunates were dispatched to the briny blue with only a modicum of fanfare.

The Jabby Thing was kept as evidence.

“CC couldn’t have done such a poking job,” I said to Finn. He flashed red.

“You know, we haven’t seen hide or hair of that tooth suckin’ captain that came with the boat – that lady who set up Nada’s wireless. And the Skipper seems to have vanished, too,” I whispered to my companion. You think they might have something to do with this?”

Finn flashed blue.

“And are those Texans finished cooking up mischief?” I wondered outloud.

Finn flashed red.

Then we went to find Emmy. A whole bunch of folks were wantin’ breakfast.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Detection Begins

choices: Poor Mel moves to a different cabin
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Emmy tucked the last sprig of parsley into the trayful of delicate pastries. She wiped her hands off on her "Kiss the Cook" apron, and then stood back as the WDCers gathered around the beautiful buffet. She enjoyed their gasps of delight as they took in the mounds of fresh scrambled eggs, crisp bacon and fresh fruit.

"Emmy, when on earth did you have time to make an ice sculpture of CC astride Advillicious?" asked Nanette.

Emmy blushed. "Oh, really, it was nothing. It took far longer to make all those radish rosettes. Now dig in!"

Everybody formed a line and started to pile their plates high.

"And just what do you think you're doing, Tor?" asked Emmyloo.

Tor looked up from his plateful of biscuits and gravy. "Um... getting breakfast?"

"Oh, that breakfast isn't for you, Tor! I made something special for you, since you're the one who left poor George back on shore, and then killed him off!"

"But it was CC who killed him!" yelled Tor. "And I'm hungry!"

Emmy sniffed. "If you think I believe that dear man would hurt my George, you're sadly mistaken!" She winked at CC, who was happily feeding Scarlett chocolate-covered strawberries.

"But don't worry Tor, I made a special breakfast just for you!" Emmy lifted the lid off a huge vat. "It's my special Michigan 43-bean chili!"

Tor blanched. "Nooooo!"

"Oh brother!" said Nada. "Poor Mel is in for it tonight!"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tor gets beaned in the head

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
What a Night!

Nada sent Tor over to eat his “specially prepared” breakfast, grabbed some coffee and a muffin and surveyed the room. She saw CC and Scarlett having a rather “cozy” breakfast of chocolate dipped strawberries, Mel was helping the disgruntled Tor to a seat, wiping the tears and snot off of his hang-dog face, Lauren and Finn were seated with Esperanza, doing her best to console her about the carnage of her flock which I do believe Emmy would be featuring on tonight's menu, Nanette had saved a place for poor Winda. Speaking of Winda, last night after Ben failed to open the door Nada had gone back to her room, where she found Winda curled up in the hallway, luggage and all. Apparently Winda couldn’t find her room, or had failed to check the room assignments, whatever….anyway I led her to her suite, which had been George’s until his untimely demise with Murphy. Chewie seemed happy to be with Scotty and the Skipper…but HEY…who was driving this boat? Gawd, must I do everything?

Going to the bridge, Nada was very surprised to find Lauren enjoying the brisk morning air with Finn those two really get around...then at the bridge who should be there but... Deb and Partylips, seemingly over their spat of earlier and looking quite pleased with themselves…they were playing with the joystick and laughing out loud. Oh great….these two were left in charge of the boat….but, everything seems to be running ok…considering.

Nada turned to leave, but ran into Ben and Phyllis. “Hey…hi!” Both of them were a tad sweaty, which Nada understood immediately, indicating they had been playing an early game of tennis. She eyeballed them for signs of any hanky-panky, but seeing none, greeted them with a stand-off-ish, “Hi.”

“What’s wrong buddy?” Phyllis asked.

“Oh, what could possibly be wrong…two humans died, no real suspects…” She was cut off by Ben.

“No suspects? What about Princess Penny? Nobody has seen her for awhile you know. It was kinda funny that Scarlett brought her since we were not expecting her.


“Hey, what about Kathy Lee?” Phyllis chimed in.

“No, I happen to know that she was in the showroom most of yesterday, rehearsing for her show tonight.” Nada replied. “But…Penny…well, she could definitely be a suspect.”

Party disengaged from the joystick and chimed in, “What about Stealthman? Who has seen him lately…or Dirk for that matter.”

“Well, I see only one thing to do at this point. I gotta go make a call, and you two keep this dang boat on course!”

Nada returned to her stateroom, sat down and flipped through her address book. You know, sometimes that Hollywood stint has it’s advantages…”Ahhh, yes, here it is.” She whipped out her international cell phone and slowly put in the 45 digit phone number. Good, it was ringing.

“Allo, Inspector Clouseau ” The familiar voice answered.

“Oh… Oui, Inspector, so very nice to hear your voice after all these years.”

“Ahhhh, ziz is zee lovely Nada I presume.”

“Oui, bon! Como vous”…oh crap, I can’t speak French! How are you my friend?”

“Very good Nada, but you used my ‘special’ number, is zere somzing wrong?”

Well, I cannot share the intimate details of my call, but the wonderful Inspector had given me a few ideas, things to investigate, and I think I may need some help…hmmmm, who do I trust? I know, I need to find Forever..she and those two wonderful dogs can help me out! Dang, I am smart!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Who ya going to call?

choices: A cheese Danish, a finger print, and a shoe print
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
When I got to the dining room last night, I found my "pool boy" dancing with the steward from the Ledo deck, so I drowned my sorrows in a pitcher of Margaritas. Last I remember before waking this morning was doing a Coyote Ugly routine on the bar. Regardless of my bad luck at the hook-up thing, I awoke feeling confident and free for the first time in a long time.

It was odd that my roommate hadn't returned to our room, but she was on her own after my fourth Margarita. I pulled my winter-white wool pants and pale blue shell and sweater set and showered. Just as I finish dressing, there is a tap on my cabin door.

I open to find Nada, with Forever's Chewie and Jabba in tow. "Good Morning, Nada. I was coming to breakfast and I am in a good frame of mind in spite of my disappointment."

"I am so glad to hear that dear, but that isn't why I am here. Didn't you mention in your blog that you were a cop?"

Oh, Nada, that was almost thirty years ago and it was only a year before I moved to dispatching."

"It's all right, with your research skills, I am sure you were a fair investigator in that year and I need some help."

"Do tell. Well, you know about the murder on the Ledo deck?"

"No! Is it the steward and the pool boy? I had a feeling that Murphy wasn't happy with the steward dancing with his guy."

"Well, actually, no. It seems that George and Murphy were dancing on the Ledo Deck and someone ran them through with CC's jabby, sharp, stick thingie. We buried them at sea, but we have to find out who is trying to frame our dear, sweet CC. Are you in?"

"Of course, you know I think there are a few people missing too."

"What makes you say that?"

"Teresa's bed hasn't been slept in and her cat Chewie's bed only has tufts of hair in it."

"Hmmm. Well, one thing at a time. We have to clear CC. Oh, by the way, we will be having Lamb for quite a few meals here. Esperanza's sheep had a tragic landing and none survived, Emmyloo had them dragged to the freezer."

"Oh NO! You know my story about the trip to Canada. What will I eat? I don't do lamb. I am so glad I won't have to see the carnage."

"We will take care of that later too. Right now we have to help CC."

"I can't understand why anyone would ever want to hurt that dear, sweet, good-looking man! Scarlett is one lucky lady! Do we have any clues at all?"

"No one has seen the gnarly-nailed captain lady CC replaced, so she is the most usual suspect with a motive, but then Tor and Dirk have been acting pretty "Get Smartish" ever since they boarded."

"Well, that is better than nothing. WAIT! You said George is DEAD? Oh no, how is Emmyloo?"

"She is taking it very well, in fact you will see the breakfast spread is quite the effort!"


"Let's go!"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: When you have a quasi-professional use them

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Party was in a daze. It was either the thick, salty air of sea level, Deb's pills, or possibly Engineer Scotty beaming people all over creation, but something wasn't right.

One moment he was striding arm in arm with the stunning Emmyloo, trying to decide if her eyes were bluer than her evening gown but not really caring because he was getting a headache from trying to sneak peeks at her fabulous chest, then the next he was laughing it up with Deb on the bridge while they played with joysticks.

Party would like to remind the rest of the crew at this point to get their minds out of the gutter.

Murph and Clooney were dead, but Party cared little. Less competition, he figured. Now the sheep, that was a little sad. Still, he knew CC couldn't be responsible. He had a royal alibi in Queen Scarlett, and his fingerprints were all over her to prove it.

Party excused himself from the bridge, but promised Deb they'd play with the joysticks later. As he walked by Emmyloo's cabin, he thought he'd check in and see how she was holding up in the wake of Cooney's death.

Just as he knocked on her door, he heard her unmistakable giggle and what sounded like other male voices. Before he could run and hide, Emmy opened the door, her hair a mess and wearing a captain's hat.

"Oh, hello, Party," she slurred.

"Uh, everything okay in here?" Party asked.

She leaned her back against the door to open it completely and reveal the source of the other voices.





** Image ID #1174876 Unavailable **




"Whatever," Party said as he walked away. Just great, more suspects.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Party's getting dizzy

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Oh My Gawd! The real Scotty! I thought rapturously. And I got to spend the whole night talking dilithium crystals with him! Hubby will be soooo jealous. And the Skipper is such a funny guy!

As I glided into the dining room still in my sequined gown, I spotted CC and Scarlett feeding each other strawberries over near the buffet table.

"Oh, ho! Somebody didn't go home last night!" Scarlett crowed while CC giggled wildly.

"Keep your minds out of the gutter! I was given a thorough tour of the ship by the Skipper and Scotty and had a fascinating night of Trekkie discussion with them. Did you know that the Skipper is almost as big a fan as me?"

"Did you hear about what happened with my Jabby thing?" CC asked with a woebegone expression.

The two then proceeded to fill me in on the night's activities. I felt a little off my breakfast when CC covered some of the more gory cleanup details.

"Hmmmm...an old fashioned Agatha Christie-type English Manor murder mystery, huh? Well, surely we can figure this out!" I patted CC on the shoulder.
"Don't worry, buddy, I believe you are innocent. You are just too.....sweet to have actually jabbed somebody with your jabby thing."

I left them talking and set out for my room to change into some real detecting clothes. Looks like it's time to set some of my little critters to watching some of the shadier individuals on this boat. Like, where is that disappearing Texan. Hmmmmmmm?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Trekkies and Breakfast

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Nade finally caught up with The Ben to enlist his help.

"Hmm,eh?" thought the Ben out loud as he chewed on a slice of neverending pizza.

"Just hmm???" said Nada. You haven't stuck your nose in the story all week! You just let everyone do the work of writing your character."

"This whole murder mystery thing is nuts. I used to be a federal investigator. I ought to be able to suss something out. Of course that all had to do with corporate tax evasion, but since this is amateur hour anyway, why not go blundering into it all? I did play a detective in a crappy student movie."

"Yes, blunder away. Wait, is that a naked mole rat in your pocket or..."

"It is and he's glad to see you. Come with me. There's no time to lose."

They ran off to interview CC but ran into Kathy Lee sloshed to the gills.

"There's nothing more fun than a vacation at sea," said Kathy Lee, slipping into a Carnival t-shirt. She had a little trouble with the shirt at the end when Dirk popped up between her bosoms.

Still following the old script, Kathy Lee said, "Richard, what are doing here?"

Dirk said, "Having the time of my life."

Nada and Ben shrugged and moved on.

"CC, there you are," said Nada using a ship's prybar to separate him from da Queen so we could chat for a minute.

"Oh, you know me, flingin wimmens and stuffage!!!!" said CC, crowding the deck with exclamation points.

"CC," said The Ben, "we want to help you. We need to know more."

"Tell you 'bout myself woowee turn ons ladies and ship cruise, man, skinny dippin, fast times at Ridgemont man, turn-offs uhuh wimmen electricians man love that Janis Jopin and her what'd she say about buyin a MERCEDES BENZ!!!! boxer briefs, man myself yup dang ol' bee stings in life are free. Yup go see it all on CC The Movie one day!!!!"

"That's more than we needed to know or could ever in a million years, understand," said Nada.

"I like him because I never understood a word he said," added Scarlett with a sigh.

"CC," Ben tried to focus him. "When did you last see your jabby thing?"

"Oh dang ol jabby jobby? Last time I saw that I lent it to dang ol GILLIGAN MAN right over there!!!!"

** Image ID #1174900 Unavailable **


"Now it all makes sense. But why didn't you tell anyone before? Were you just going to wait until they executed you?"

(THUD)
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Another Suspect

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
'What exactly were you doing at the time of the murder?' asked Nada.

'Well,' replied Scarlett. 'Without going into too much detail, I was busy with CC.'

The Ben coughed in an attempt to avoid smirking.

'It's nice to meet you Ben and I'm pleased to hear you're helping out with investigations, but please understand CC and I go back a long way and I swear on my duck's lives, there is no way on earth that man would hurt a fly, let alone commit murder.'

'So, what were you and CC actually doing at the time?' asked The Ben.

'We were comparing Merit Circles, if you must know.'

'Well that wouldn't take long,' cut in Nada. 'But I guess it's enough to give you both an alibi. Did CC have his jabby thing with him can you remember?'

'Come to think of it I did notice it wasn't about his person, but then it's not his jabby thing I'm really interested in.'

The Ben coughed even louder.

'You should see the ship's doctor about that cough.' Scarlett said. 'Anyway, I can vouch for CC so you'll have to look elsewhere for your murderer.'

'What about the Princess Penny? Where was she when you and CC were otherwise engaged?'

'In the royal cabin glued to the computer screen. Since she started reading this interactive story on some writing site, I just can't get her away from the damn thing. I know, sad person isn't she? She should get a life.'

'Well, I guess that rules her out too,' concluded Nada.

'One last question,' The Ben continued. 'Did you see anything suspicious on the bridge yesterday?'

'Well far be it from me to snitch, but I did notice someone lurking in the dark and there was a distinct scent of chili/chilli (sans beans) in the air.

'Okay, thanks for your help Scarlett. Have 5000000 gift points and an awardicon for your trouble.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Narrowing Down the Suspects.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Who's WHATS ????

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was sick and tired of sweating in the snowsuit, but reluctant to waste a moment in returning to my room for a change. So, I ducked into the lounge by the back door and hid behind the bar to slip into some jeans and a tee-shirt, which I had in my backpack.

It turned out to be an ideal vantage point to overhear Scarlett and CC whispering their nothings to each other. I can’t bring myself to repeat what I heard; just the thought makes me nauseous. And what I saw when I peeked my head around the corner of the bar was worse.

CC, sitting in Scarlett’s lap giggling quietly as she tickled him was a sight to be missed, that’s for sure, but what startled me was the pair of legs hanging from the near barstool. At the bottom of those legs were a couple of feet, and on those feet were shoes, whose soles were stained with dried blood.

“Did you see that, Finn?” I whispered.

He flashed blue.

I had no time to consider all the implications of what I’d just seen because in tromped Nada and Ben, intent on interviewing the couple. Well, Ben was intent; Nada quickly disengaged herself from the inquiry and accosted the owner of the legs.

“Gilligan! I told you to keep out of sight. What the heck are you doing in here?” she whispered harshly.

“Ah, Nada, come on. I got sick of eating that canned chili. Can’t a guy get decent food? Like fried coconut with seaweed?” His voice took on a wistful tone. I felt like throwing up.

“Listen here, bub. You were brought on board for one reason only, and the agreement was that you’d stay out of sight.”

“Yea, well I did my job already. Can’t I come out now?”

“No way. There may be more to do, and I want you working behind the scenes. Your reputation for fouling things up is pretty big.”

“But I did that job OK, didn’t I?”

“Only because you had CC’s instructions. Even with that, I’m amazed you pulled it off. Oh my gosh, I can’t imagine the mess I’d have on my hands if you were wandering the ship with these kooks.” I thought I heard Nada slap her hand to her forehead. Or maybe it was the bar her forehead hit.

“And look, you dope. You didn’t even wash the blood off your deck shoes. Now get your behind out of here and back belowdecks with Scotty.”

“Nada, what are you doing over there?” Ben called. CC’s cleared things up here. I think we better go question Tor, if we can find him.”

“I’m sure CC cleared things up real good.” I said to Finn. More like muddied the waters, I’ll bet.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: From Behind the Bar

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Nada turns to Ben and says, “Something smells fishy here.” Poor Ben coughed and sputtered…and tried to keep a straight face. “Ya know Ben, something else is weird here.”

“Oh really,” he said dryly, “and what would that be?”

“Well, tell me if I’m wrong here sweety, but have you noticed that all these folks have absolutely no sense of humor? I mean, that in, and of itself has me scratching my head.”

“Hmmm. That does seem strange doesn’t it? I mean people like CC, Emmyloo and Partydude are so…well serious. Heck, I used to laugh at them all the time on WDC…now they all seem so…preoccupied.”

“Maybe it’s all of the celebrities aboard. You know I think we should take a long hard look at the passenger manifest…make sure there are no more surprises.” Ben turned to Nada for her thoughts. “Nada?”

“Oh..yes Ben?”

“You seem lost in thought.”

Nada smiled and winked, “I’m sorry, I was thinking about Lauren and Finn.”

Ben shot her a glance which said it all.

“Hi Lauren, afternoon Mr. Finn. Whatcha been up to?” Gawd, those two were sneaky. More than once Nada had seen those two nosing around. Something was up, any woman who changed clothes as much as she did, and supposedly out of her backpack…well, on second thought, her shoes told the story…hiking boots. You can take the girl out of the country, but…”What?”

“I was just in the bar and saw something…well..something I can’t talk about, but another I think you two should know about.” Nada’s eyebrow shot up.

“What?”

Lauren pulled them both aside and whispered, ”Gilligan had blood on his feet.”

Ben said, “Oh that. Thanks, but we already know that. Lauren, be a luv and go print some announcements up and deliver them to each cabin for us. An announcement calling for everyone to gather in the showroom at precisely 16 hundred hours, no excuses accepted.”

“Uh, well, sure if that’s what needs to be done. But...what time is that?"”

“Oh…” Nada interrupted, “and make sure Bo-Peep, Teresa and Nanette get their first. It's 4 o'clock.” Sigh.

Lauren and Finn saluted and left the two of them alone. She has such a good attitude.

“Finally, “ Ben said, “some time alone with you.”

Nada wasn’t going to remind him she’d come to his cabin with appetizers and champagne already. “Ben?” She said softly.

“Ummm, yeah?” He winked.

“Would you do me a favor?”

“Anything.”

“Take the naked mole out of your pocket and send him underground …he can find out stuff we can’t.”

“Oh.” Ben did as she asked, and whispered something to him and he was off in a flash.

“Good. We have a couple of hours until the meeting, so I say we do a little undercover work….if you know what I mean.” Wink.

“Ohhhhhh I think I can handle that. Say, wanna see MY Merit Circles?” He smiled shyly.

“You betcha, meet you in your room?” Nada did want to freshen up first…she had this little number she’d been dying to put on. It is called Chanel Number 5.

“I’ll be there...neither Hell nor High Water nor…” Nada interrupted, “Ben?”

“What?”

“I get it. Time’s a wastin!”

He was gone by the time she'd gotten the words out. Nada sauntered out, anticipation rising with her temperature. A nooner!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Nooner on a Schooner...

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb and Party were driving the boat and believe it or not they had called a truce. They couldn’t keep the boat a floatin if they were trying to kill each other, besides Deb didn’t have a clue how to drive a boat.

The midnight sky was gorgeous and Deb was reminded of the movie “Titanic” and she got all emotional. The tears were streaming down her face and she began to sing the theme song out of tune of course. Ah what a beautiful moment Deb thought.

“DEB WATCH OUT!” Party screamed bringing Deb back to reality.

“What are you hollering at me for?”

“You leaned against the steering thing and now we are turning to the right too hard.” Party said trying to stop the boat from leaving skid marks in the ocean.

“Well you don’t have to holler so loud; I’m not blind you know.”

“Damn you’re an idiot.” Party said before realizing he had said the “I” word. oh crap what is that red stuff coming out of Debs’ eyes?

Party took off running and Deb grabbed the first thing she saw; a hot branding iron with the letters N-A-D-A. What tha,” Deb thought.

“Hi CC. Bye CC,” Deb said as she ran past him. She lost sight of Party and headed for her room. Once inside she grabbed her cell phone.

Ring Ring

“Hello,” the voice said.

“How far are you away from the ship?” Deb asked.

“Pulling up now as a matter of fact.”

“Great I’m on my way,” Deb said hanging up the phone. I have to find Tor Deb said to herself.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Who would have suspected

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Emmy's stateroom door slammed open. Party stood there, gasping for breath.

"Boys, it looks like Party needs to talk. Be good and go get Emmy a mimosa, would you?"

Party stared, mouth agape, as three Tiger's pitchers filed past him and out the door. "Emmy! What is wrong with you?! You always seemed so sweet and innocent!"

"Will you get your mind out of the gutter, Party? We were just discussing strategy for next year!"

Party was too upset to care whether she had the entire starting line-up in her cabin. He started to babble. "Deck. Boat. Brand. Nada. Oh the horror!"

Emmy stopped him. "Deb again?"

"Yep," answered Party.

"Okay, listen, this has gone on long enough. We have to figure out what these darn Texans have planned. I think we need to go undercover."

Party looked hopefully at the bed.

"Sorry, Party, my days as Ship Tramp are over. I have a plan. We need to dress up as people who would fit in on a cruise ship. Do you know the words to "Muskrat Love"?

"Of course! It's one of my favorites. But why?"

Emmy smiled and got out her make-up kit. Thirty minutes later, two very different looking people left Emmy's cabin:

** Image ID #1174928 Unavailable **
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Love Will Keep Us Together... Won't it?

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As Nada hotfooted her way to star in Cabin Fever, she ran into the hapless Kathy Lee again. The cruise star was having difficulty dislodging her unwanted visitor.

"Could you, mmf, lend a hand?" she entreated.

"No problem."

Nada had to plant her two dainty feet on Kathy Lee and grab hold of Dirk's webbed feet for a good yank.

All the while, Dirk was shouting, "Leggo. I'm Richard Simmons. I'm harmless!"

After a healthy struggle, Dirk came free of Kathy Lee's bosom with a "POP," Nada flung him she-knew-not-where. Over her shoulder she heard, "Hello, I'm Duck, James --Wakk @#$%^&."

"Oh, sorry," she said.

A still sweaty and grunty Kathy Lee piped up, "Nada, that was...good."

Nada looked into her eyes and said, "You know, this may be just Ben's fantasy talking, and I disclaim all responsibility, but it was good for me too. Meet me in Ben's cabin right NOW."




A while later, as the three of them sat on Ben's bed snacking on caviar and wine, Ben said, "Guys, I think we may have overdone it a bit."

"What do you mean?" said the girl with the duck imprint on her topside.

"I mean, we shook the boat something fierce, and I think we shoved it way over to the right."

Nada said, "No worries. Deb and Party will just think they did it."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Duck-In-The-Wardrobe Malfunction

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Why do I look like Sonny Bono with a captain’s hat?” asked Party. “No one’s gonna buy this.”

“Shut up and focus, Party!” Emmy snapped.

Party sulked a little behind Emmy, but then suddenly skipped up next to her. “Hey, can I do the muskrat parts?”

WHACK! Emmy’s purse made a lovely sound on the back of Party’s head.

“Ow…what the…I’m bleeding. Am I bleeding? I’ll bet I am! Oh my God, I think I’m bleeding!” he cried.

“The Texans, Party! Help me out here, would you?”

Party kept rubbing the back of his head. “Well, what do YOU think they’re up to, Einstein?” he asked.

“Oh, for Pete’s sake, it’s not bleeding, you idiot!” she yelled. “I think they’re all in this together. All of them. And don’t forget, Deb and Stealthman are Texans, too.”

“Can we sing ‘Top of the World’, too?” Party asked excitedly.

WHACK

“That’s the Carpenters, you idiot!” Emmy growled. “Good Lord, will you pay attention for one second?”

“Ow! Oh, now it’s bleeding for sure. Ow, ow, ow…I think you broke an artery this time. Oh great, I’m gonna die! Am I gonna die? I know I’m gonna die!” Party cried as he hopped down the hall, holding his head with both hands.

Suddenly they heard people approaching from up around the corner. “Get over here, Party!” Emmy called. Party hopped over and gritted the best smile he could muster as he and Emmy put their arms around each other and walked calmly together.

CC & Scarlett rounded the corner and smiled and nodded as they walked past. Scarlett whispered to CC, “I didn’t Sonny & Cher were on this cruise.”

“HA!” Party snapped at Emmy. “I told you!”

Emmy lowered her hand from Party’s waist, grabbed a hunk of his underwear and yanked as hard as she could.

“Yaaa!” Party screamed. “What the hell are you doing?” He grabbed the back of her bra strap and pulled it as far as he could, then let it snap violently against her back.

“OUCH!” Emmy’s blue eyes turned an ugly shade of red as she grabbed Party by the hair and pulled him to the the hall floor, then jumped on top of him. They wrestled for a few minutes before Nada appeared, confused.

“Uh, aren’t you two the entertainment for the evening?” she asked.

Emmy and Party quickly stood up and tried to smooth their clothes and straighten their hair. “Uh, yes we are,” Emmy said. “Is it time for the show?”

“Duh!” Nada yelled. “Would you please hurry?” Nada rolled her eyes and headed back to the lounge….uh, I mean Ben’s cabin.

“We’ll be right there,” Party assured her.

“Okay, dimwit,” Emmy whispered, “this is our chance to find some clues. Pay attention this time.”

“Can we sing ‘I got you babe’?” he asked.

WHACK!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Searching for clues

choices: Will Stealthman cure what ails these folks?!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The Great Windini, that wanna be femme fatale, super duper hero with the gaping hole that is her mouth, has spent the majority of her time on board this sex orgy on wheels... er, um... water, playing dumb, or lurking the decks in shadow, or holding Stealthman's hand while under the influence of his powers.

What a stealthy hunk of man he is! Uh oh... now I'm starting to sound like the rest of these insatiable boobs on board! Note self: KNOCK IT OFF!!!

To tell you the truth, The GW is scared out of her wits... what with being menopausal and all, this plethora of longing and yearning, and and and smoochin' and strawberry feedin', and clothes changin' and sheep killin', and and and overall general fantasy makin' cruise is a bit much for the wanna be dudette. After all, she is just a shy, intoverted, sweet, cheese eatin', Packer lovin' kind of gal. Her fragile hormone system just can't take much more!

Maybe this is why she likes holding hands with the stealthy one... he seems to be the only one, besides herself, that still has a grasp on reality.

All of a sudden, her main hand squeeze lets go and instantly she finds herself visible! Whew... there doesn't seem to be anyone around... where can I hide?

And then, just as suddenly has he'd disappeared, Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy ~~~there you go again, I said KNOCK IT OFF~~~ takes hold of her hand. POOF! Invisible again, but he's not alone. Lo and behold, he's brought along Max, SUPER DOG! Oh, there's going to be trouble now!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Another Super Hero boards ship.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
C.L.Hanna~Writer For Hire, who has been hanging on the side of this vessel since it left the dock - she was just a little late and didn't quite make the spectacular jump she attempted - finally manages to pull her weary bones up and over and onto the deck.

"Whew! I can't believe I held onto this huge silver tray that entire time and STILL managed to hold onto the side of this ship!"

The Great Windini, the wanna be femme fatal, turned to see what looked like a large clump of seaweed, holding a huge silver tray.

"What is that?" cries Windini, as Max, SUPER DOG, takes off toward the 'lump' to investigate.

Max Super Dog was all over the newly deposited lump with the huge silver tray, before Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy and The Great Windini could stop him.

C.L.Hanna~Writer For Hire, realizes that she is about to be mauled by a very determined, out of control, mongrel. At the moment Max Super Dog reaches her side, she screams, "Tea, anyone?"

Max Super Dog, confused and distracted upon hearing the loud voice, promptly sits as Windini and Sexy Jammie Guy approach.

"Oh, my goodness!" exclaimed Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy, with a lisp that Windini had never noticed before, "It's not a lump of seaweed with a huge silver tray...it's...it's...what are you?" he finally asks in resignation.

The Great Windini can't believe she never heard that definite lisp before, but shakes her head to clear that thought and focus on the lump before her.

"Of course, I'm not a lump of seaweed! I am C.L.Hanna ~ Writer For Hire."

"Sorry, I didn't recognize you," offered Windini.

C.L.Hanna rights herself and begins picking off the debris she accumulated while hanging onto the side of the boat. Making herself as presentable as possible and putting on her biggest smile, she asks in her most hospitable voice, "Would you care for any tea?"

"I'd love some!" lisps Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy, with a little giggle of delight.

Windini shudders. She can take no more of this.

Where is Stealthman? This ship is going down fast without Stealthman's help.

"Cream or sugar?" C.L.Hanna asks.

"Listen! I don't think there is time for tea, right now," Windini advises, " And Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy...you gotta go."

Windini picks up Max Super Dog and hands him to Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy who receives the mutt with a puzzled look.

"You just aren't what I need right now...sorry. This entire ship is going down if someone doesn't rescue us - FAST - and, Honey, you might look good in those P.J.s...but we need a real man to save us!"

*Poof!* Mr. Sexy Jammie Guy and the dog disappeared.

C.L.Hanna~Writer For Hire found her mouth hanging open in disbelief as she asked, "How did you do that?"

"The Great Windini can do anything when she makes up her mind to do it!" declared Windini, a new-found strength over her fragile hormone system arising within her.

"What's with that huge silver tray?"

"Oh, this?" C.L. pulls another string of sea-weed from her hair, "It's part of the new job I got just as the ship was about to leave dock. I love adventure and thought I could do both...you know, the job and the cruise - but, I almost missed the boat at the last minute."

Windini sighed, "Well, you are here now...do you think you could help us?"

C.L.Hanna grinned, "I love to help people! I am really good at Customer Service! That's how I got the new job."

"This is a little bit more complicated than the routine customer service job, C.L."

"Have you ever worked for an airline?" C.L. stated, knowingly.

"Really? You have worked for an airline?"

"Oh yeah...and let me tell you...I've had the worst of the worst - in my face, yelling and screaming...threatening me," C.L. dropped the tone of her friendly voice to a serious and authoritative level, " I can handle whatever you've got!"

"Great! Come on...follow me!" cried The Great Windini, "We've got a boat load of craziness to rescue!"

Suddenly, an earth-shattering voice declared,

"Go and know that I am still holding your hand!
I will be your strength...until you reach land.
No waves will overtake you,
That I can not command.
Go, and know that I will help you,
For, I am Stealthman!"


Reassured, and confident with the purpose set before them, the two girls knew that this ship would not go down, but would sail on to it's port of destination, full of inspiration from it's voyage, allowing it's cargo of Writers to write on...and on...and on...into the setting sun.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tea Time?

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the ship made its erratic way across the Atlantic a hurried meeting was taking place at the very back most space on the stern of the deck far away from all the other whackos onboard.

The Texas Contingent had finally gotten together! Six people plus assorted ducks and one Black Lab stood in a circle talking quietly.

Tor: "Well its about time you guys showed up. Now, we need to get down to business. I want to start by welcoming our newcomers. Some of you might not know it but Chewie and Winda here are Texan expatriates who have the misfortune of living now in different parts of the country."

Chewie and Winda waved to the others.

Tor: "And I have to say, I am very glad that Deb finally ditched the Montana Moose-Muffin and saw fit to join us here."

Deb waved sheepishly.

Empty space next to Winda: “Well I don’t know what we can do, the ship seems to be going crazy without our help”.

Everyone looked around to see where the disembodied voice was coming from. Tor calmly reached out, beside Winda and pulled Stealthman’s wire to his battery pack loose. Stealthman suddenly materialized next to Winda with an irritated look on his face.

Stealthman: “I really wish you would STOP doing that!”

Tor ignored his buddy and spoke to the group.

Tor: “Look guys, I know things have not gone COMPLETELY as planned on this trip but what can you expect when you’re dealing with a bunch of Yankees”.

TWANG!

Mel’s iron frying pan made a meaty sound as it bounced off Tor’s head. Tor grimaced and rubbed his sore noggin.

Tor: “Sorry hon, present company excluded on that ’Yankee’ comment of course.”

Mel: “Oh that’s okay sweetie, that was just a practice swing after all”.

Everyone snickered.

Deb: “Well now that we are all together, what is it exactly you want us to do and while we are at it...DID you kill Clooney and Murphy?”

Tor: “Of course I didn’t kill those guys...whatever. Anyway as to what we are going to do...well listen closely”.

Tor: “As you may or may not know, early tomorrow morning we will be making port in England and when daylight comes I want the FIRST surprise to hit the others. After that, when we are on land, the rest of the plan will be revealed. Chewie, the first surprise is in your hands.”

Tor hands her the scuba gear...the tank and mask and a very sharp knife.

Tor: "You know what to do.”

Chewie nodded and grinned. Then, slipping on the gear and taking the knife she slipped over the side of the ship and disappeared into the dark waters.

Tor turned to the rest of the group...

Tor: “Now the rest of you mix with the passengers and find out what they know and what they suspect then we will all meet up onshore tomorrow.”

The group scattered and headed back to the front of the boat. Each one knew that tomorrow morning would bring ONE big surprise for the rest of the passengers.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Texans Meet...

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
My mother taught me to be polite, which is why I waited out of sight, hidden behind the life boat, while the Texas Contingent had their little pow wow. Party crashing is not polite.

I’d dragged along Party and Emmy, who were disguised as a seventies pop duo and who’d been wandering the halls peering through a magnifying glass. Sharing seemed hard for them; Party had a distinctly round imprint on his forehead.

Their disguises lacked a certain something…… his nose and her eyes gave them away. That is, unless you were Nada, with a mind full of Ben. I’d pulled out of my back pack a pair of brown contact lenses for Emmy, and a pair of black glasses, complete with attached nose and mustache, for Party.

“Well, you don’t look exactly like The Captain,” I told Party, “but at least you don’t look like you.” Then I thought of one more, final touch. “Here, Party, add these.”

With the artificial teeth in place, the effect was finished.

“Doesn’t he look better now?” I asked. Finn flashed blue, and Emmy gave Party an agreeing thump on the back of the head. Then, we headed topside to check out the crime scene, and see if Gilligan foot prints might be found there.

They pondered the significance of the sparkling clean starboard deck while I stumbled on the secret Texan meeting.

“Well, Finn, there’s only one thing I can imagine Chewie can be doing. Do you think she’s up to it?” He flashed blue. I’d been afraid of that. “Is there any way of stopping her?” Finn flashed red. I’d been afraid of that, too.

“Then, the only thing to do is prepare ourselves and stay alert.”

When we met back up with The Captain and Tennile they were flush with excitement.

“Lookie here!” Emmy said. “We’ve found fibers! These red ones, and some blue ones. And there’s more! Look at these curly brunette hairs.”

The evidence was stuck to the deck by a glob of dried blood, missed in the cleaning.

“Do you guys know what this means?” I could barely get out the words, I could hardly believe what I was seeing. I looked into vacant eyes, and continued.

“Gilligan and Nanette!”

Even with all the knocking around he’d had, Party needed no further explanation. He clicked his fake teeth and reached for a peanut butter cup while I said, “And let me tell you what Chewie’s up to…..”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Red, Blue and Black

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As I slipped over the side of the luxury yacht into the cold Atlantic, I giggled in glee. The rest of those WDCers seemed to have forgotten that I was a Texan, too!

Brandishing the sharp Bowie knife, I quickly began sawing through the large rope that held the Blue Barn to the back of the yacht.

Hee Hee! We'll get to England and there'll be no Advilicuss for CC!! That scaredy horse will be adrift in the cold sea for weeks until some oil tanker happens upon him! I laughed and bubbles floated out and up into the sea above me.

Just a few more seconds...got it!

I rose out of the sea and watched as the barn slid away into the distance. Quickly I grabbed onto the trailing rope and pulled myself back to the yacht.

Chewie was standing guard for me as I pulled myself dripping over the side.

"Mwrow?"

"It went off without a hitch, sweetie! Let me get dressed in something warm and then we'll go report back to Tor and the others that Phase I is complete."

Chewie purred loudly and rubbed her little head against my shivering shins. "Have you heard from Chocolate? I sent him to watch Party. I wanted to have that report to give the others, last he said, Party was running in terror from Deb. And Dolly said Nada and Ben were being really friendly."

Stealthman appeared silently beside me carrying Weenie.

"This little one says that Lauren and Finn saw us earlier! We've got to be more careful around her."

"Dang. Well, go back and watch her some more, Weenie, and keep reporting to the Stealthman. Hey, Dan, keep Lottie from getting suspicious would you. It's almost time for Phase II."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Phase I complete...Hee!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Dang that Tor!” Dan mumbled to himself as he worked on repairing the wire on his stealth utility belt, “Someday the buckethead’s gonna’ pull the wrong wire and atomize all of us into oblivion!”

The utlity belt sparked and then began a steady low hum, which brought a smile to Dan’s face as he adjusted the repaired stealth belt. At about that time he felt a warm sensation on his leg and looked down, where the stealth-dog Max was standing with his hind leg raised and generously peeing. Dan jerked away.

“Dang it dog!”

To this Max just looked at him with those big brown Lab eyes that said, “Hey, I don’t know how I got on this blasted boat. But there ain’t a tree or blade of grass anywhere. What the heck do you expect me to do—hold it?”

Dan pulled the table cloth off an adjoining table and relented, “I guess you’re right. And, Yeah! How the heck DID you get here?...Oh well, since you’re here we might as well make the best of it.”

Dan looped the stealth-leash around the magnificent animals neck and pushed the stealth button. Instantly they faded into nothingness (which is a little strange cause how do you instantly fade?) Stealthman and his stealth-dog trotted up the deck heading for the bridge or the driving place or the big room on top of the ship. Standing outside the door Stealthman waited and listened with his keenly tuned stealth-hearing. He heard voices from inside the room.

“OK Party, you pervert, CC said that’s Scotland over there. All you gotta do is keep the boat on this course and we will be ready to disembark tomorrow. That’s all you gotta do.” Emmy pleaded.

“Dang it! When are we gonna sing “I Got You, Babe”? Party sniffled.

Stealthman opened the door and stepped in with his dog wonder. Party and Emmy both turned to the open door and then looked at each other as the spoke in unison, “How’d that do that?”

Stealthman walked up real close and personal to the two, and more personal to Emmy than Party so that he could peer down and see the girls. He sighed and thought, “Oh well, can’t tarry here; I’ve got work to do.”

He reached into his stealth-belt and pulled out a tube of stealth-vasoline, and with a decisive lunge he emptied the contents on the large stearing wheel. Immidiatley Party began loosing his grip. The wheel spun out of control. Party’s attempt to grip it only worsened the sitiation.

“You Dolt!” Screamed Emmy, “Look where you’re going! We’re headed straight for the rocks. Do something!”

“OK!” Returned Party and then shoved Emmy aside and ran for the door screaming, “We’re headed for the rocks! Every man, woman, queen, dog, sheep, shepherd, actress, captain, etc. for themselves!!!”

Chewie had done her job. The animal barge was safe. Stealthman hit the atomizer button and he and the stealthdog atomized over to where Chewie waited. Together they would watch the yacht as it headed for the rocks.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heading for a Rough Landing

choices: Ok, so Bo-Peep lost her sheep...but where is she?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Nada had had enough of the Kathy Lee-Ben duo. A woman who liked her men…alone, this fantasy of Ben’s had gotten out of hand, and after bumping into the Captain and Tennille look-alike act for the evening show, she made a mad dash to find some…well, trustworthy people.

Having been born to a Texan, lived in Texas, she knew if there was one person she could trust to help her, it would have to be a non-Texan. All she had to do to find one was ask for chili recipes, but she wasn’t up for that.

Ok, the manifest list I’ll do alone. (Damn that Ben…we would have made a great team.)

What the heck? Is that Scottish Folk Music coming over the intercom? Oh gawd, what now? Nada raced to the Officer’s quarters in search of CC, the sometimes with it, sometimes with HER captain. In the hallway she ran smack dab into CC…he had a couple of newly minted Merit Circles in one pocket, a few scattered on the floor no doubt why…so he could find his way back here, in one hand was a wad of Q-tips, ya learn not to ask, and the other a aeresol can of bug spray. “Whoa Mr. Captain man…where you off to in such a hurry?

“UMMMM….a bumergency Nada.”

“STOP right there. What kind of emergency is going to require Merit Circles, Q-tips and bugspray?”

BLINK-BLINK.

“CC…you gotta tell me.”

He looked down, kicked the carpet and I barely heard him say, “Scottland.”

OMG…he said Scottland…now I understood the bug spray at least…those clouds of dang near invisible thangs called Midges…biting and…ewwwww, the mere thought.

“Carry on …I assume you’re going to protect Da Queen then?”

He turned RED…”Uhhh, well…you know ya can’t turn Da Queen down.” He fled in the direction of he suite.

“Oh CC…is the guest manifest in there?”

“HUH?” Blink-Blink.

“Nevermind…go tend to Scarlett, before she beheads all of us!”

“Tea?” C.L. Hanna asked .

Nada whipped around…”Huh? Where did you come from?” Amazed to see another new face aboard, it merely strengthened her resolve to find that manifest.

“Oh, I work here, just got hung up earlier.” C.L. says with a straight face.

“No tea, thanks. Well, happy to see you aboard…I think. You seen anyone else?”

Gulp. C.L. looked guilty as heck, but said, “Nope, you’re the first.” Heh-heh…just The Great Windini, Stealthman, Max and Chewie…soaking wet. Weird.

“Ok….do me a favor though…would you go to Ben’s suite and tell Kathy Lee she’ll be debarking in Scottland in oh…an hour.”

“Sure, right away Nada.” C.L. wondered who died and left Nada in charge…oh well, someone should be.

Ahhh, here’s the manifest…flip-flip….whoa…who are these people? Weenie, Chocolate, Dolly?? My gawd, things are much worse than I thought. Nada slammed the book down and took off to find…….her thought was cut off mid sentence as the boat lurched, knocking Nada to the carpet…gawd…how to explain these rug-burns???

“Oh crappola, those dang Texans have done something, I just know it. I suppose they forgot that Nada had Texan blood in her….just wait til I…..”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Manifesto..

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the dufus Dan and his WonderMutt, Max dissappeard and left the boat headed toward the rocks, Tor jumped into the the Bridge.

EmmyLoo had just regained her feet only to be knocked to the floor again by Tor who rushed over to the slippery wheel.

"Don't worry Emmy," he said confidently. "I will save the day!"

With that, Tor whipped out a rag from his back pocket and quickly wiped the wheel clean, then he calmly righted the boat's nose so that it once again pointed toward England (NOT SCOTLAND, YA DUMMY!).

Having staved off disaster, Tor leaned over and helped the disheveled EmmyLoo to her feet and after a few moments of admiring the scenery of her heaving cleaveage, his eyes traveled up to her face.

TWANG!

ALRIGHT, ALRIGHT...geeze, sorry Mel! He forgot she had come in with him.

"Emmy, hon, now run along and find CC," Tor told her. "When you find him, bring him up here to take over the wheel and be sure to tell him how TOR SAVED THE DAY!"

As Emmy bounced out of the Bridge Tor turned to Mel who was eyeing him sharply and had the frying pan ready.

"You see sweetie, just like I told you. StealthGoober heads us to the rocks then I save the boat...just watch, I'm gonna be a hero now and no one will suspect what we are really up to".

TWANG!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tor Saves the Day, not to mention the Boat!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Chewie and Stealthman give hearty high-fives as Tor makes the course correction. They move to the side as an excited Emmyloo comes rushing down the deck exclaiming, “Party scewed up and sent us towards the rock! Then the dunderhead abandoned the bridge! If’n it wasn’t for Tor we’d all be up to our navels in water by now! Tor saved us. He’s a hero!”

Dan popped into view and asked, “But, where was CC when we needed him?”

By this time a crowd had gathered, “Yeah, where is CC?” Voices chimed in. Heads looked around for the missing White Knight. “Where is CC?” The murmur passed from one voice to another.

Dan glanced at Chewie and grinned. She returned his grin. Max peed on a deck chair. Everything was going as planned.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The chimes tingled over the loudspeakers on the ship, “NOW HEAR THIS”, the announcement began...”ALL PASSENGERS ARE TO REPORT TO THE SHOWROOM......NOW! Those not present for the roll call, will immediately be escorted to the BRIG!”

Nada clicked off the microphone. My gawd, this cruise is “the Ship of Fools”, or worse. After narrowly escaping the demise of the cruise, she had had it up to her eyeballs with this group. Of all the cruises she had taken before, this one had to be...hmmm...one of the whackiest ever.

People must have thought the ship’s name was the SS ASYLUM instead of the SS RunAround...not that there wasn’t a good deal of that happening. Nada took the manifest and headed to the showroom.

She took the back way, let herself in the back entrance to the stage and waited, her head stuck through the heavy stage curtains peering at the passengers now filing in. As sure as she was standing here she knew not everyone would show up, but dang it she had to try and pull this bunch of whackos together, before someone else got hurt. She hoped that Ben hadn’t been too hurt when she made Kathy Lee board the dingy to shore. Desperate times call for desperate measures after all.

Emmy and Party and Deb all arrived together...and they seemed sort of normal, for them, no more disguises, Vaseline not apparent..this is good, next Phyllis arrived with Dirk he still was all “pumped up” from the steroids and it seemed Phyllis had gotten rid of his cigar too, replacing it with a healthier thing, a tennis racquet,then she saw Tor and Mel come in, Tor with his chest all pumped up and Mel with a good heavy skillet in hasnd good to see someone had some control over him, Nanette came in with freshly washed hair and had changed into a lovely dark pantsuit, Chewie had a Chesshire grin on her face, Forever was escorted by Chewy and Jabba, C.L. was filing in, taking her place next to Mel, then Bo-Peep what had SHE been up to?, the Great Windini entered and looked askance at ....hmmm, must have been Stealthman since I could not see anything, Scotty looked drunk, hanging off of Gilligan’s arm, The Skipper looked confused, then the trumpets blared...the drama, and in strode Princess Penny, followed by the Queen herself, Scarlett...looking like some royal Merit Circle (but very cute shoes), next, Lauren and Finn rode in on her bicycle...poor Finn didn’t look well, and then she felt the anchor being lowered. That could only mean one thing, CC would be coming soon. Nada surveyed the group...where is Ben? Her heart fluttered when at that very moment he strode in. Hmmm, he didn’t look very sad...in fact he looked happy...oh wait, it was that dang naked mole rat back in his pocket...hmmmpphh.

Nada stepped onto the stage and adjusted the microphone, confident that CC would appear...and he did, running in all gangly and BLINK-BLINKING.

“May I have your attention.....please!” She clapped her hands together. Ahhh, quiet blanketed the room, finally.

“I want to thank you all for being so prompt. I have called you all here together to let you know that despite all of the shenanigans...” Nada heard mumbling and assorted giggles, “we are nearly to South Hampton or wherever it is we dock.”

“Hip-hip-hooray” yelled someone from the darkness.

“Yes, I know, we are all anxious to get off this ship and let Queen Scarlett take us to Nottingham. Her graciousness in getting everything ready will be very much appreciated.” And not a moment too soon either!

And with this, THUD, Nada fainted on the stage, overcome by exhaustion.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Now Hear This!
