1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Geez... what is the deal with all this fainting? First those poor little old goats, then CC, and now the loverly Nada!

"Ben! Get your fickle buns up there boy, and help her. This is partly your fault you know! And don't even think about giving me any lip or slip, or I'll sick Max the Wonder Dog on your arse!!! See how you like having a bare tailend section flapping in the sea breeze!"

The Great Windini's big mouth does come in handy after all.

"AND YOU!" Wind folds her arms, taps her foot and gives CC the evil eye. "Where have you been, and what have you got to say for yourself? If'n this is your ship, and if'n you're the captain, why are we in this mess? Hmmmm? I'm waiting!"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Hmmmm?  Well???

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Now If Captain Dude interrupts this Chapter, then I really will get cross. And you don't want a cross Shepherd on board." [Or should that be Cross Dresser]

Esperaza [Bo Peep] or whatever you want to call her strides onto the stage. She glances down at the prostrate form of poor Nada and pulls some smelling salts from her Medical bag. Well even sheep have been known to faint in times of stress.

" Ok stand back give the lady some air. I think it's time the Brits came to the rescue, someone's gotta take charge of this floating disaster. The Queen is now in home waters so she is the Sovereign power here.

Whan this boat docks I'm calling in Scotland Yard to find out who killed all my little fluffy friends"

Loud sobs fill the air, followed by the sound of sirens getting closer. Nada moans quietly from her place on the floor as the Queen enters followed by several Page boys. Oh aren't they sweet.

Actually they are really Ducks in disguise but hey who cares.

"now no-one is to leave this room until the Boys in Blue arrive to take controll of this mess"

Esperaza just hopes that she manages to post this before anyone else. You leave this story for five minutes and further mayhem ensues. Still it will be good to add Chapter 100 . Fingers crossed.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Bo Peep to the Rescue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb sat and listened as Nada tried oh so very hard tried to get control of this floating box of fruit loops. Yeah right, Deb thought. Oh would you look at that; Nada fainted! And people want to know why we don’t have women presidents.

“Yes my people of such great stupidity, we are raising your taxes because we feel like it,” President Nada states rummaging through her new Bloomingdale catalogue.

The people protest and shout obscenities. President Nada faints.

Having a woman president would go over like a fart in church.

“Ouch!” Deb said looking over to Party. “Why did you pinch me?”

“Pay attention Deb, you’re off in la la land somewhere and Bo Peep is telling us we could be facing some serious jail time.”

Deb pinched Party back causing him to scream like a sissy girl.

“STOP pinching my guy,” Emmy warned Deb.

“Listen up Emmylooloo impersonating Donnie and Marie is wrong on so many levels. I always knew them two got it on.” Deb said as she thumped Party on the head as she stood up to leave.

Party thumped Emmy on the head, “I TOLD you we should have dressed up like Donnie and Marie but NO you….

WHACK

Deb went back to her cabin for a jello shot and a quick change of clothes. The man she had snuck on board the night before was waking up. He had been somewhat tired from rowing the rubber boat to the ship. He had disguised himself as Tom Hanks, you know the fellow in “Cast Away.”

“Hey how did you sleep?” Deb asked Prince Andrew.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Texans RULE

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
'YES CC,' yelled Scarlett. 'YES YES YES, that was AMAZING. Can we do it again?'

'I guess so. It was over a bit fast wasn't it? Let's just have a smoke first though...'

'Ready now?'

'Yes, let's DO it and this time I'm gonna come first.'

CC and Scarlett wound up their yellow rubber dudes in preparation for another ducky race in the massive Royal bathtub. Just as they placed the duck butts on the starting line an announcement came over the ship's intercom.

'All passenger's are to report to the showroom...NOW.' Nada sounded tense and tired. This had been quite the adventure for her and not exactly how she'd imagined it would turn out.

'Awww, just when we were having so much fun,' complained CC. 'We better go though or they'll all be wondering what we've been doing and we must be getting close to ducking...er...docking now.'

'I guess so and no doubt there'll be lots more fun and games and merit circles once we're back in England. Oh and thanks for the detour my dearest white knight. Much as I live in England I've never been to Scotland, so it was great to see the Scottish coastline.'

'And we did have to get rid of that Kathy Lee anyway and cold, misty Scotland seemed the ideal place. Couldn't have her upsetting da lovely Nada - with a bit of luck she'll fall in Loch Ness.'

'And now they've seen lots of castles too so they won't be 'Geeeeing' and 'OMGodding' so much when they arrive in Nottingham.'

After Nada'a announcement it was revealed a police investigation was to take place on board before passengers could leave. Seeing as Scarlett was already cleared she decided to take Princess Penny in the Royal Police helicopter to prepare Nottingham Castle for the arrival of the crackpots crowd.

'I'll miss you CC, but you know what they say about absence and the heart.'

'Yes and we'll soon be reunited my dear. See you soon and I'll send you a Merit Circle so you know I'm okay. Au Revoir...'

Scarlett and Princess Penny relaxed aboard the helicopter with a glass of wine.

'Now we've escaped the whackos, you can show me that interactive story you've been reading on the laptop. I could do with something to restore my sanity.'
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Happy Landings

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The Ben stood in the crowd and wondered what he had done wrong. Being a man, he had no idea. Women just got angry every so often, he figured.

He paused to catch up on the last few chapters, and said, "Oh, I get it now. No, wait, I still don't." If it was anyone's fault at all, he thought, it was that damned Kathy Lee. She didn't know how to satisfy a woman. Yeah, that had to be the problem. He slipped Dirk in her bag before she departed. Let him have her!

Ben heard Winda's voice say something sharp, then a moan from the fainted Nada. When he heard Nada say, "Something, something...NOW," he he snapped out of his daydreaming the rest of the way and jumped to her rescue.

As Nada stood directing the crowd, he swooped in to give her mouth-to-mouth resussitation. He had a time of it with her being in a standing position--the rarest kind of fainting.

Nada said, "Hey, what? Stop that. Lemme go," and other delerium-induced phrases.

He pinched her nose, and tilted her head back because he had heard that if you don't do that, you will just be blowing air into the victim's stomach.

"You dolt," she managed to sputter, "you're too l--" He managed to get her on her back. Ben knew that time was of the essence. They locked lips just in time before anoxia set in. She flipped over him so that she was on top. He flipped her back and shared life-giving air. Nada signaled her return to life with something that in other circumstances might have been mistaken for a slap.

No one else could say what happened after that, as they cleared out to give the two some privacy.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Swooping

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dan held tight to the leash as he hit the stealth button; immediately he and Max faded to nothing and became Stealthman and Stealthdog. While havoc had rained rampant on the ship, Stealthman had been busy researching the demise of the legions of lambs and the unfortunate expiration of the two dudes. He had an idea; all he needed was to bounce it off of the legal authorities.

He watched the contingent from Scotland Yard walk into the assembly room. They flashed their badges briefly and immediately got to business interviewing the passengers and crew. Stealthman walked over to the chief inspector or top dude or whatever they call them in merry Old England.

“Hey, inspector dude,” Stealthman whispered into his ear.

The inspector jumped around craning his neck to and fro looking for the source of the voice—a real Monty Python moment.

He cut his eyes back and forth and spoke softly, “Who said that?”

“Never fear, I am a champion of the law, a doer of good, a righter of wrongs, and a warrior of justice--invisible to the masses but every vigilant and opposed to evil.”

“Oh, you must be Superman!”

“No!”

“Batman?”

“No!”

“The Phantom?”

“No!”

“Flash?”

“No!”

“Wonder Woman?”

“Enough! Don’t you Brits keep up with Super Heroes? I’m Stealthman and that yellow stream collecting around your shoe comes from my hero-dog Max. You must have been walking through grass ‘cause the stains on your shoes set him off.”

“Oh yes! By Jove, Stealthman…good show old man! I always wanted to work with a super hero. I guess you’ll have to do in a pinch…oh yes, bloody good!”

“OK, let’s cut to the chase! I’ve got some theories about what came down on this caper. I need you to check it out.”

“Glad to do so, old man; what have you got?”

Stealthman began to lay out his theories. The inspector nodded yes and periodically called the home office on his radio to have the research confirmed. Shortly the inspector could be seen patting an invisible back and shaking hands; quite an amusing image. The inspector walked to the center of the room and addressed the crowd.

“OK! Attention people! Can I have your attention?”

Party responded, “Why, ain’t you got one of your own? What’d you need with mine?”

The inspector glared at Party but continued, “Listen up! We will not be detaining any of you any longer. The Case has been solved. With the help of the magnificent and brilliant Stealthman we know what has happened on this ship. No crime has been committed. You are all free to go.”

“But what about my dead sheep?” Bo Peep exclaimed.

“Ah, the sheep. It appear that a sub-tropical analytical vortex wind sheer collided with the sheep during their flight over here. Since they were flying on the Harry Potter brooms and were not cleared for such vehicle, the violence of the occurrence was just too much for them. They just happened to be circling the boat when it occurred—unfortunate indeed.”

“Yeah!” blink…blink, “That don’t splain my sharp jabby thingy stickin’ through those two dudes!” CC squealed. “Yeah! What about my jabby thingy?”

“Elementary my dear man,” the inspector grinned at the simple mined Yankee dude. “That was a matter of a double suicide. It appears the only misconduct was the owner of the instrument of suicide was negligent in leaving it lying around. The two lovers, distressed at being trapped on the ship with the odd assortment of personalities were just too much for them. Stealman found a note waded up in the corner of the deck—yes, suicide. So, there you have it. You are all free to enter England now. The question is, Is England ready for you.”

Immediately the crowd began to make made dashes to their cabins to gather their possessions. It would be unfortunate indeed if anyone would stand in way of the gangplank.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Enough Of This!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Finally headed for Nottingham, everyone was intent on getting their possessions together when a blood-curdling scream was hear coming from the back of the boat. Nanette was still on deck on her way to her compartment and went running to find CC staring into the water and crying. "Advilacuss, that sorry excuse for a horse my beloved Nada gave me, oh no!"

"CC, what is the problem?" Coming up on the rail, "Oh my goodness, what happened to the barn?" She looked down to see a frayed rope trailing behind the ship. "CC, I see why you are so upset, how could this have happened? I don't see that blue barn anywhere."

"I don't got no idea where my barn and my horse are but I am sure those Texans are behind it. We may be leaving the ship but something doesn't mean they are done withun the rest of us yet! First my jabby thingie is part of a police investigation and now my stupid er, loyal mount has been set adrift, lost at sea!"

"CC, Scarlett has gone on the castle by way of helicopter and everyone else is gathering up to leave the ship to go to the castle. Is there anything I can do for you?"

"No, no, BUT I'M GONNA GET THAT TOR AND HIS GROUP, THIS IS THE LAST STRAW!"

"By now he is probably leaving the ship, we should get to the castle and work on this mystery. Are you gonna be OK CC?"

"The luvverly Nada gave me Advilacuss, what am I gonna tell her? I shoulda used chain instead of heavy ropes. What am I gonna tell Nada?"

"Oh, CC, she won't blame this on you. She knows how out of hand these Texas people are. In fact, she might have ideas, let's go to the castle and convene everybody, maybe get one of those investigator dudes to go with us. I watch those forensic shows, I bet there is some fingerprint or DNA on that rope from the perpetrator. Let's get to the castle CC."

CC hangs his head with his hands shoved deep into his pockets, Nanette puts her arm through his and leads him away from the rail.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The barn escapade discovered

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Dang it, Tor! These cockamamie Scotland Yard dudes are making me nervous."

Teresa was talking to Tor during the limo ride up to the castle. The Texas Contingent had all piled into one of the giant cars by unspoken consent.

"I mean, there's little evidence of your's and Stealthman's so-called crimes, but if they ever find out it was me who cut that stupid barn loose, I'll wind up in whatever kind of hoosegow they've got over here."

"I'm pretty sure it's the Tower of London for messing with the Defender of Light's steed," Deb cracked as she poured herself a drink from the built in bar.

"Yeah...THANKS for the vote of confidence."

"Don't get all upset, you and Stealthman disposed of all the evidence that could tie you to it, didn't you?" Mel patted me encouragingly on the arm. I think she wasn't thrilled to be in with this little band of hooligans, but hey....what can I say, she'd married the ringleader.

Tor reached over to a seemingly empty spot across from he and Mel and jerked Stealthman's cable loose causing the pajamaed hero and his Wonder Dog to suddenly materialize in the seat next to Deb.

"Would you quit that!" Stealthman fumbled with his battery pack. "You are gonna cause a dang short! Yes, we dumped all the scuba gear overboard after tying it to those heavy tanks. Even the gloves and the knife she used. There's nothing left to prove it was her. Those Scotland Yard goobers will probably decide it was just a frayed rope. That barn never did look too stable." He waggled his eyebrows in appreciation of his own pun.

Clank!

Mel whacked him out of reflex with the frying pan. "Sorry, Dan."

Tor winced in sympathy for his poor battered friend.

"Well, Chewie, there you are. Nothing to tie you to it. No fingerprints, no DNA, nada. You are Scot-Free!"

Clang!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Scot-Free

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After Nada’s recuperation, courtesy of Ben’s suave technique, she walked around the ship. She saw a distraught CC, but he was being comforted by Nanette. You could always count on her to be a friend. Her curiosity was peaked, but knowing CC was in more than capable hands was enough.

Everyone else had gone ashore by now, it seemed Stealthman and Max had cleared things up with Scotland Yard. That was a huge relief, but still, she felt somewhat uneasy.

The cruise had been unlike any she had been on before, and with any luck, would be on again. She made a mental note not to undertake such an endeavor without HubbySpeaks along to ….to what? Oh well, he would have found the lack of velvet Smoking Jackets woefully inadequate for his refined taste. Some how, torn jammies, bluejeans under gowns, snowsuits, tennis outfits and old television stars would not have held the same fascination for him….although she was sure he would have liked to have seen just one naked molerat and maybe Clooney and Murphy stuck together like a toothpick through a pig-in-the-blanket. She was pretty sure he would have enjoyed the food though, lamb being a favorite of his.

There was just one thing left to do now, find her way to Nottingham Castle where the lovely Queen would be waiting with new maps showing the “hood” where Robin and his merry gangstas were know to hang. She couldn’t remember why this was important, but she supposed that forgetfulness was just symptomatic of something else she couldn’t quite remember either.

Going down the gangplank she was surprised to see Ben, Party and Emmyloo waiting for her. Awww, isn’t that sweet of them. “Hey, thanks for waiting.” It was an unlikely trio, but a welcome one. She’s one bright lady, that Emmyloo, though she had gotten kind of googly-eyed since she and Party had hooked up, that Partydude sure was a handful. Nada was happy he was in Emmy’s capabable hands.

“Hey Nada, thought we’d share a car with you, Da Loverly Scarlett had them waiting for us, she’s sooo thoughtful.”

“Great. Yeah, remind me to send her a couple of Merit Circles.” They got into the old English car, a Bentley, which made Nada feel right at home.

Partydude started yapping right away, “Ya know, I was thinkin’.”

Uh-oh, this could mean trouble. “Really! About?”

“Well, it’s great that we made it here and all, but exactly why are we going to look for this Robin guy anyway?”

Nada shot a look at Emmyloo, who promptly responded with a knuckle upside his head, “THWUNK”.

“Dang wimmin…err…Sweetheart, what was that for?”

“I’m not sure, but Nada gave me the go-ahead, so I did.” Emmyloo purred back to him.

“How about I explain it over our dinner at Nottingham Castle, when everyone is gathered, I so hate repeating myself. Let’s just enjoy the beautiful countryside.”

“Geez woman, it’s raining and cold, we may as well have gone to Seattle.” Ben said.

“Awww, how romantic Ben.” Nada cooed.

“CR-RACK!”

“Oooh, good one Partydude.” Nada could see Partydude cracking his knuckles and starting to relax now, so she lay back and fantasized about….seriously, you don’t think I’m going to tell ya’ll do ya?

SCREECH….SQUEAL…all three were thrown against the front seat. “What the…..”

“Gawd, driver what’s wrong?” Nada asked.

“BLOODY ‘ELL….some arse in in the road, coulda been killed if I didn’t stop!” He threw his hands into the air!

All three rubbed the fogged up windows off and peered out into the rain. In unison they uttered these words, “ADVILICUSS?” They realized then the driver had said horse, not arse.

“It’s ok, we know this arse,” Partydude blurted out. “Wait, I’d better get him, CC will be lost without him.” With that Partydude got out of the car.

“Wait sweetcakes, I’ll help.” Emmyloo now climbed over me and joined Partydude. They tried to mount him, quite unsuccessfully, as Advilicuss smelled peanut butter and he hated the stuff. Partydude slung a rope around his neck and Advilicuss just laughed it off.Thankfully we no longer had that foul smell to contend with.

I heard Ben say to the driver, “Don’t wait, get outta here now! Take us to HARRODS!” Waving “bye-bye” we left Partydude, Emmyloo and Advilicuss by the side of the road. Only the sounds of Advilicuss' griping could be heard, “You are NOT %^#* A*%ª¶•….”

“Ben…” Nada turned to him, “what are we going to do at Harrods?”

“I hear they have everything a woman could possibly desire there. Do you really care?”

“Awwww, how sweet you are, not really.” Visions of cashmere briefly filled her head. And to think, I could have been stuck in the car with any number of errrr....ummmm... people. She giggled and put her head on Ben’s strong, warm shoulder as they listened to Elvis on the radio singing, "Lord Almighty.... I feel the temperature risin'".
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Switch in plans...

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
(This Chapter fades in just after Nanette had left CC in his cabin on the floor with his legs cross in a pair of Defender Undies...MOANIN !!!!!!
( And And... A few trickles of sweat drip down his face as he is very deep in Mental Re-Structure.)

Over in the Corner Lays his Hunk-a-Hunk of burnin Love Captains Suit. Gone now are the braids and insignia's...Gone..Are... His iron-on anchor tatoo's
and His pocket Life raft.

ALL DA DANG SUDDEN !!! CC's chest heaves and his head flings back and a HUGE GULPIN OF AIR IS HEARD !!!

Slowly his head comes back down and he grits his jaws tighter...Slower still, CC's eye's flutter then open bit by bit....BLUE STEEL...YEAH...DATS IT !!!

BLUE STEEL !!!! eye's he wore...He look over to where DA SWORD OF LIGHT LAY !!!!...He then Gazed to were his fine DEFENDER OF THE LIGHT OUTFIT WAS !!!!
With that is raised himself and begain the outward transformation from Sea Captain into....into.
WELL INTO DA FENDER OF DA LIGHT !!!!! (come on you Folks know this already !!!!)

While CC adjust his gear and straps on all his cool Knight STuff...He think outload to himself.(kinda talkin to himself) (again)

ENGLAND !!!!! I'm In ENGLAND !!!! And And..I'm going to the Queen DA DANG QUEEN !!!!! OH LAWD !!! I can't beleive IT !!!!. Just the thought of riding up thru those gates on my Decked out hunk of Horse flesh...Sittin high in da saddle lookin all....well...Lets just hope I don't fall off...Or drop dat Long Jabby thing...Or....STOP IT !!!...JUST DON'T THINK ABOUT IT !!!! With that CC reached for the Sword of light and bared it to the SKY... (Crash !!! went the ceiling light fixture as it fell to the floor)

Well CC marched right up to the biggest dude and came to a stop not far from his face and Jabbed his long Jabby thing not a half inch from his big toe with such force 5 inches burried in the hard packet ground.......BLUE STEEL EYES !!!!! Glared down at this man...and CC said.
Please Point me in the Direction of DA QUEEN..

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Horseless in Seattle (or England) kinda.

Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahaaaa.

STEEL BLUE EYES !!!!! Cut a path to these folks.. And he knew no matter what underhanded things come to him by the hand of these Whacko's... He'd not give up or give in...Or let such actions turn his Honor from his soul.

CC walked on....walked on...With hope in his heart..That he'd...He'd

Partylips and Emmy appeared not one bloack ahead of CC and just the sight of his beast heaved a Sigh and CC just stood a shook his head.

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: FOUND !!!!!!!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Lottie came to...looking around she realized that she was still holding her huge silver tray.

"Thank goodness!" she sighed.

She couldn't help notice that the lighting was not very good. Party looked like a Goose...or Duck...or something. Nada looked like a ...

"Wait a minute!" Lottie cried out. At the same she moment she noticed the extremely foul odor of..."Animal DUNG!!!"

Lottie was laying in a huge pile of the stuff. No wonder her silver tray wasn't shiny.

Just then, Nada bleated.

Jumping to her feet and squinting, Lottie could see that she was not in the presence of Party and Nada...she was surrounded by sheep!

"Where am I?"

Lottie made her way through the herd, noticing there were feathers stuck to the feces, here and there. She stumbled to the nearest doorway and feeling dizzy and a bit sick to her stomach, could not believe what her eyes told her was true.

She was afloat on a barn! And the ship she had managed to board earlier, was nowhere in sight!

Another noise came from within the drifting barnyard, just then. The sound of an animal in distress.

Lottie turned to see that it was no animal...it was...no, it couldn't be...

"Kathy Lee?" Lottie ventured.

"What of it?" snarled the feces-coated Diva. "Those idiots thought that they could just ship me off and get rid of me!" She continued, pulling a piece of straw out of her nose, "Well...they are in for the surprise of their lives! Nada has NOT seen the last of ME!"

Lottie made a defensive action with her huge silver tray, asking, "Would you like some tea?"

Kathy Lee shoved past Lottie and declared, "We are going to get this ugly blue barn to shore!"

Turning to look at Lottie, Kathy Lee seemed confused, "Who are you, anyway?"

Lottie lowered her eyes and sighed. It was the story of her life.

"I'm C.L.Hanna~Writer For Hire", she replied, quietly, "But...my friends call me Lottie."

"Well...C.L. - you are going to help me get this floating barnyard on course. Got it?" Kathy Lee demanded.

"But...but...how?"

Kathy Lee just grinned and wiped the sheep dung from her around her mouth.

"Oh there is a way, C.L. There IS a way!"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Blue Lottie...

choices: Will they make it to shore?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Just then, as Kathy Lee and Lottie looked toward shore, The Great Windini arrived in a swirl of effervesence.... um, that would be in a blaze of, beauty, light and goodness. ~~~TGW smiles demurely~~~

"Calm down Kathy Lee... good gawd girl, things could be worse. Course, I'll have to admit that being covered in sheep doo-doo is pretty bad. Speaking of which, here... have a wet wipe or six and a bottle of eau de terlet. It's a special blend of CC's, and though is may be a tad on the awful side, anything is better than THAT smell!!!"

"Oh, thank you, thank you!" Kathy Lee gushed. "My hero come to save me!!!"

Lottie rolls her eyes, and holds her stomach. "This is disgusting, not to mention unbelievable!"

TGW just smiles demurely, but winks in Lottie's direction as if to say, "Take my lead - we'll be out of this mess and on our way to the castle very soon."

"Kathy Lee, while you're cleaning up your act (yeah, that'll be the day), you and Lottie hold on tight. The gaping hole that is my mouth will save the day!"

With that TGW jumps overboard, and begins mouth flappage the likes of which have never been seen before. Those waves parted and the bow of the barnyard ship raises toward shore, and off they go!

"YEEHAWWWWW!"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Great Windini to the rescue!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The rain had fallen all night, but Nada was enjoying her nice, down covered bed. She assumed it was goose down, thus ok’d by Da Queen.

When she and Ben had finally found their way to Nottingham Castle, they had been amazed at the warm hospitality of the Queen’s staff. The castle was gorgeous, set in the lovely green wet grounds. Queen Scarlett had thought of everything, tea and crumpets, assorted Wellies for our use...as well as a huge bin of umbrellas.

Led to their rooms down a very long hallway with portraits of the Queen’s handsome family members, Nada’s mouth was agape...which Ben interpreted to be some sort of problem requiring another nose-pinch remedy.

“Hey...” Nada said with a nasal voice, “I’m not going to faint again!

Ben let go of her nose, disappointment crossing his face.

“Sir?” The footman said, “this would be your room.” He gestured to the magnificent door on the left.

“Ahh, thank you my good man.” Ben opened the door to find a canopied bed, gilded in silver and gold. “WOW...look at this will ya naked mole rat?” He withdrew the now soaked and shivering rodent from his pocket. The rat hopped out of his hand and scurried in, Ben followed. “G’night Nada, and thanks for the Kilt, I’m sure I’ll get some opportunity to wear it.”

“Good night Ben. You two sleep tight. See you in the morning.” She winked at him.

“And Madam, your room is down the hall a bit further, follow me.” As they passed doorways she heard the distinct sound of Deb’s blow dryer and a martini being shaken, Emmy was sneezing, Party’s room emitted the smell of chocolate and peanut butter, Esperansa was sobbing, Tor and Mel’s room couldn’t conceal the sound of metal on bone, “THWACK...and don’t tell me you weren’t thinking about...muffle....muffle..”, Dan’s room was obvious, a cord was winding out from under the door and plugged into...nothing he didn’t have a converter with him, CC had left a parcel of Merit Circles outside of his, with a scribbled note; TAKE A GET OUT OF JAIL FOR FREE MERIT CIRCLE, then she smelled a really foul odor and asked the footman who was there.

“Oh madam, three women came in here, one with a silver tray and the other, well...” he whispered in my ear, “some woman who claimed to be a celebrity...I believe she said her name was ...Kathy Lee?”

Nada’s eyes bugged out. “Surely you jest!”

“No Madam, that’s what she said.” Nada grumped and told him to “Carry on then.”

About the time she felt as though she couldn’t walk another step ...”Your room is here madam.”

“Thank you err...um...” she read his engraved nametag, “Uh..Jeeves.” Then she had to ask, “Jeeves, have you seen The Defender of Light and his trusty steed Advilicuss?”

“Oh madam...yes, they rode up just before you arrived. You know them?”

“Yes Jeeves, he is a very special man...he has the Queen’s favor you know?”

“Really...” his monocle fell off his eyebrows has raised so high.

“Indeed he does. I hope that you made them comfortable.”

“Yes I did Madam...would you like to peek in at them?”

“Could I? If it wouldn’t be too much trouble for you.”

“Not at all madam, they are right next door to you.” He cracked their door open and sure enough, there snuggled in was CC and Advilicuss, both of them obviously exhausted as they snored in unison, “ZZZZZZZ-PHEEEEEEWWWW....”

“Very well Jeeves, just one more thing...”

“Yes, how may I serve you.”

“No.....Nada blushed a deep crimson, can you tell me where the Great Windini is?”

“Ahhh, TGW, what a lovely lady. She went to take in a breath of fresh air I believe.”

“Excellent. Goodnight Jeeves.” Dang it, where was Lauren and Finn, and Nanette and Chewie? Guess I'll find out in the morning.

It was then, once behind her closed door she pulled out her cellphone and dialed a number in NY.” She waited as it rang.....


A sleepy voice answered.

“Hello...is this Cody?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At Last, Nottingham Castle

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Nanette and I walked down the hallway, following the footman. We both dripped on the hand-loomed rugs, and she was kneading her behind. I was sorry my handlebars weren’t more comfortable. Our entrée into the castle certainly wasn’t the most dignified, to be sure, but we’d made it – even through the rain.

Never mind we’d been left behind by the limos. Water under the bridge. I’ll not bring up the subject again. Never mind it was the middle of the night when we finally were led to our rooms. No matter. Who needs sleep?

Evidently, I didn’t need sleep, because after bedding Finn down in his tank (thoughtfully set up in my room), drying off and slipping into my flannel jimmies and snuggly Uggs, I was restless. The siren call of an empty castle was too hard to resist, so off I went to explore.

What I found was that I wasn’t the only one still awake. As I scuffed down one of the halls I detected the distinct, but faint, sound of singing. More accurately, an attempt at singing.

I followed the pseudo music to the library where I found Tor, reclining in a wing-back chair, twirling the ends of his silver mustache and singing Row-Row-Row Your Boat. But the lyrics were a bit unique:

All those lives were saved
By the mighty Tor
Who woulda thought? A hero is he
No bodies washed ashore!

Everybody come
And celebrate the Tor!
Don’t you think that surely he
Deserves some big reward?!!

“Oh, give me a break, Tor!” I said. The poor man screamed.

“Where did you come from? You shouldn’t sneak up on a fellow like that. In the middle of the night.”

“Well, to answer your question, I came from the harbor, like the rest of you. But, unlike all you Texans I didn’t get a limo. Recall, if you will, the ride you took on my handlebars. Pretend you’re Nanette. Add cold and rain, and you’ll get the picture.” I raised my hands, and addressing the embers glowing in the fireplace said, “But that’s water under the bridge. I’ll not bring up the subject again.”

I had the feeling Tor wasn’t giving me his full attention. I could hear him humming.

“Tor! Are you listening to me?”

“Sure I am. But listen, woman, I want what you’ve got in your backpack.”

“What are you talking about?”

“Oh, I think you know exactly what I’m talking about. I’m gonna need the goods tomorrow morning, when my buddies sing my song at breakfast.”

“You mean that ditty you were shrieking just a few minutes ago? Please do NOT tell me you’re going to inflict that on anyone with two good ears.”

“Well, not me, exactly. The Texans are gonna sing it as I walk into the dining hall at breakfast time.”

“Can’t you give it up? I mean really, man. Show some dignity!”

He stood and walked over to me, pointing at my backpack. “Come on, Lauren. Hand ‘em over.”

Well, I figured there was at least some good entertainment in the offering, and took comfort in the knowledge that Mel still had her iron skillet. So, I opened my backpack and pulled out the silver-plated crown, encrusted with plenty of bling-bling. Tor held it up and admired the twinkles. “This is so much better than Nada’s furry red thing.”

“I think you’re referring to Lance’s crown.” I corrected.

“All I remember is seeing it on Nada. And if I recall, that’s all she was wearing! Anyway, this one is much better.” He seated the crown firmly on his head.

“Gimme the rest,” he demanded. I reached one more time into my pack and retrieved the silver chalice. They were a matched set. The bling-bling glittered as Tor held the cup against the light. “Oh, yes. Scarlett is no longer the only royalty around here. I’ve earned a place right next to her at the head table. And it WILL be mine!”

Head held high, Tor turned toward the door, swiveling on his heels. It was a lovely move, or would have been if he hadn’t gotten his legs tangled. A self-appointed king is a sad sight, sitting on his bum in the floor with his crown rolling into the shadows.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Royalty

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb walked into the castle and dropped to her knees kissing the floor, “Oh thank you thank you. My nerves are SHOT. What a hell of a ride.”

She got up and immediately came face to face with a man whom she assumed was the manager of this hotel.

“Madam may I show you to your room.”

“Uh sure Mr. uh…

“Jeeves.” The guy who looked like a funeral directed said.

“Well Mr. Jeeves my name is Deb..Deb W,” she said shaking his hand.

Mr. Jeeves eyeballed her standing there and wondered what the hell happened to her hair.

You see Deb has curly hair that when it gets wet it gets kinky curly and she has this aintcha mime-a look going on. Dressed in jeans and a t-shirt that read, “I did Andrew and all I got was this crappy t-shirt,” Mr. Jeeves knew this girl wasn’t quite right. He would have to keep an eye on her.

One the way to her room they ran into Nada and Ben. “Howdy folks!!!! Long time no see. Ben, why are you holding Nadas nose? You stink or something?”

“Deb girl what is up with that hair?” Nada asked.

“Don’t ask. Hey, where is everyone?” Deb said. “And what is that noise?”

“That’s CC and his horse snoring.”

“No way, hey Mr. Jeeves, yall got any nose breath right strips in this joint?”

Mr. Jeeves was thinking he should be given a raise about right now.

“Okay Nada I’m going to get this hair done and I’ll hook up with yall later,” Deb said after realizing she was getting on Jeeves last nerve.


Deb followed Mr. Jeeves to her room and once inside she asked, “Hey Jeeves when does happy hour start?”

“Happy hour madam?”

“H-a-p-p-y h-o-u-r,” Deb spelled out for him. “You know, drink all the booze ya can in the allotted time.”

“Ah I see. Your room is stocked with all you need to make your stay comfortable madam.”

“Oh yeah, this is my kind of hotel! Hey Jeeves want to have a drink?”

“No thank you madam, it is not the appropriate time for entertaining.” Mr. Jeeves said.

“Oh yes it is. It’s five o-clock somewhere. Come on Jeeves, live a little.” Deb said checking out the room.

Mr. Jeeves turned to leave and said, “You know madam in this country persons who drink excessively are considered alcoholics.”

“Yo Jeeves, in my country it works a little differently; Persons are not an alcoholic unless they go to meetings,” Deb said mixing her a martini.

Jeeves rolled his eyes and thought to himself, “This one is trouble.”

The folks they past did smile and wave at both of these two as the cloppin of the Horses hooves made a heck of a racket which turned everyones head to gape at the pair.

CC looked up at Advilicuss cause the Horse was shakin...Not a scared shakin thing more like a twitchin...CC walked around to look into his eyes and say a kind word to calm the Horse....But lookin into the Horses eye's the words Stuck in CC's throat..
The Horses Eye filled themselves with something CC hadn't seen ever... Advilicuss seemed to puff up and his muscles setteled into a mass of fine lookin readyness....

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dancin....WHAT?????

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Sometime after colecting the bling from Lauren Tor was lucky enough to have a ring side seat (a tower window facing the front of the castle)to see the arrival of CC and his war-pony.

Tor could not stop grinning as CC and the nag made their way into the castle, the horse doing his fancy steps.

"Dang," Tor said aloud. "Who knew the horse could do the two-step. I wonder iffin he can do the 'Cotton-eyed-Joe'?"

The Texan rushed downstairs and evesdropped on CC as he met up with the Queen. Tor had to hold both hands over his mouth to stiffle the laughs. It would not do to get caught evesdropping, he thought.

Listening to CC's little speech and watching that idiot refugee from a glue factory go through his act, Tor was suddenly reminded of one of his favorite movies.

"This is just like that there movie, Ivanhoe," He mused to himself. "Well it would be iffin the part of Ivanhoe was played by Peter Sellers".

That almost did him in for he collapsed into a fit of laughter at the image that had sprung into his head.

Coming to himself quickly, the nimble Tor scurried off down the wide corridor before the Queen's guard could discover him.

Later that evening, after going through a rehersal of his Song with the Texas Posse, as the Texans were now proudly calling themselves, Tor slipped away once again. This time he made his way to where CC and the Nag was roomed.

Very quietly, he eased open the door and quickly shot three Polorid pictures of the bed area of the room.

Each flash of the camera highlighted a different portion of horse and man, both flinging about in the bed, startled and surprised.

"Ewwww," Tor gasped, "Now that was just nasty, but I should be able to cause some damage with these pic".

As he ran away down the hall, Tor was quickly calculating in his head how much he would make selling the pictures to The National Inquirer.

Boy I bet breakfast is gonna be fun, he thought as he quickly flung open his door to his room and jumped into the bed to pretend to be asleep.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words...And maybe a

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
*WHACK*

"That's what you get for running around this castle at all hours of the night. I have been sitting here waiting for you and read an entire Harlequin," the luvverly Mel said as she raised the skillet to come down on the varmint's head again.

Mel flipped on the light as the skillet had made a metal on metal sound. She had missed Tor's head and saw in the hand that was swelling tangled metal and sparkleys that resembled a crown. "Now just what are you and your Texan houligans up to now?"

"Do ya thank we could get some ice for my hand here?"

"Do not change the subject, give me your plans or your hand can swell up like the Wizard's balloon!"

"Just a little ole ceremony, nothing over the top." Whining, "can I have some ice for my hand now?"

Sure that he is lying to her, but feeling badly about smashing his hand, she heads out the door to find the castle kitchen and ice. She gets and idea and stops and taps on Nada's door when she gets to it.

"Who's there?"

"Nada, it's Mel, I think we need to talk, I think I can help."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Yankee in the Posse

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dan reached down and unhooked the leash from Max the stealth-dog. Max shook real good walked in a couple of circles and lay down on the bearskin rung next to the large four-poster bed. In just a moment the dog was making dog sounds while he slept; it had been a long hard day.

Dan flipped the lock on the bedroom door and unbuckled the stealth-belt and flung it on the bed. He walked to the adjoining bathroom and was amazed at the size of that thing. In the middle was a huge Jacuzzi tub with bubbles sploshing and gurgling. Someone had the right idea. He began shucking his stealth jimmies and by the time he was at the tub he was ready. In he went. He sat back and tried to order the events of the day.

“OK” he mumbled out loud to himself, “Tor seems to think there is work for the Texan’s to do in this place. Dang if I know what it is? One thing I do know, we’re gonna half to watch CC close.”

Dan reached to the side of the tub and pushed a button. The water began to swirl. He continued his contemplation, “That was the most disgusting display of nonsense I’ve ever seen. Geeze, CC was prancin’ around with that stumblin’ horse in the pantry where Scartlett was instructing the wait-staff. He acted like it was some sort of royal assembly. Geeze there were three cooks, a maid, the chauffer, and the gardener. I’m gonna have to keep my eye on that delusional Yankee.”

Dan’s concentration was interrupted as Tor burst into the bathroom, wheezing and mumbling.

“Geeze, Tor! What the heck you doin’ in here? Can’t you see I’m in the middle of somethin’?”

“What? You’re just sittin’ in a big tub of bubbles. What you in the middle of?”

“Dang it, you buckethead! That’s what I’m in the middle of. I’m bubble sittin’” Dan shot back at the redneck irritated. “Give me a little privacy here! How the heck did you get in here anyway; I locked that door”

“Tor patted the Bowie knife stuck in his pants, grinned and said, “Oh, that little thing. That ain’t no chore for ole Betsy here.”

“Tor, we need to find the ice machine,” Mel blurted out as she followed Tor into the bathroom. “Oh, hi Dan.”

“Dang it, Mel,” Dan protested as he guided the bubbles strategically. “Don’t you think you got someplace else to be?”

“Nope, not really.” Mel replied shaking her head and peering into the Jaccuzi. “I see you been in here a little while; stuff is beginning to shrivel up a tad.”

“Yeah,” nodded Tor in agreement. “When I sit in the tub too long my fingers get all wrinkled and stuff. Funny how that does that. Don’t ya think that’s funny like that?”

“Good Gawd! Can’t you give a fella a little privacy? Both of you get on out of here!”

“Oh, lands sake! Don’t get yourself all worked up; you’ll have a heart attack or somethin’. Heck there ain’t anything in here that I haven’t seen before.” Mel grinned at the mortified super-hero. “Anyway, we gotta find the ice machine; Tor wants some frozen margaritas.”

“Dayum! I forgot about those.” Tor exclaimed after being reminded. Then he turned to Dan and spoke in a solemn voice. “But we have important work to do. Since you’re a little busy right now we can talk about it later. But, we have to act quickly. That weirdo, CC, can’t be contained much longer. Tomorrow!” With that Tor turned and followed Mel out the door. Max lifted his eyes, snorted, and went back to sleep. Dan sunk a little lower in the bubbles…..thinking.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Bubbles, Bubbles Everywhere

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Very early in the morning before breakfast Princess Penelope and Scarlett sat in the grounds of Nottingham Castle studying the photograph album from yesterday.

Invalid Photo #1006001

'Wasn't it lovely to see the Castle Gatehouse once more?' Penny sighed.

'Yes, such a relief after all that madness on board SS Runaround. But I had a feeling the peace wouldn't last long.'

Invalid Photo #1006000

'The grounds are looking lovely aren't they?' continued Penny. '

'Stunning,' agreed Scarlett. 'And not a cloud in sight. Nada had a shock when she arrived - she seems to think it's always raining here. As IF. '

Invalid Photo #1006013

'I'm so pleased we got the castle looking so good for the arrival of our goons guests,' smiled Scarlett.

'Yes, although Jeeves was rather confused over room allocations. Couldn't figure out who was sleeping with who or what.'

'Oh well, we might be thought of as prissy in England but our gates are open to all and we won't judge people by their bed-partners.'

Scarlett turned the page.

Invalid Photo #1006002

'Wasn't it exciting when our first guests arrived? Emmyloo and Party sure looked comfortable in that Rolls Royce we sent out for them as a reward for helping find Advillicuss.'

Invalid Photo #1006003

'And trust Nada to have to take a detour via Harrods. Never can resist a shopping trip can she?'

Invalid Photo #1006009

'Oh typical yes, but look at the set of cashmere sweaters she bought for me. Always so thoughtful is Nada.'

Invalid Photo #1006004

'And here's the photo I took of her and Ben arriving in the Bentley.'

'And from what I could see,' commented Penny. ' It wasn't just her nose Ben was pinching.'

Invalid Photo #1006008

'Such a shame some had to bring the tone down. Who was it in this heap of junk?'

'I'm not sure but I could distinctly hear yelps of 'YEEEEEHAAAA' coming from it.'

Invalid Photo #1006016

'And WHO the hell is this?'

'Oh, that's just Dan. He has delusions of being a superhero but how can you take anyone in PANK jammies seriously?'

Scarlett turned another page.

Invalid Photo #1006015

'AWWWWW...' sighed Penny and Scarlett together. 'Ain't he the sweetest thang on horseback you ever saw?'

'Oh it was wonderful to see all the guards stand to attention and hear the fanfare as he arrived.'

'He's certainly a very noble knight.' Scarlett smiled remembering how those steely blue eyes had melted with the warmth of his smile. 'He has the best jabby thing I've ever come across and as for his merit circles...'

'Oh yes, he's our hero, our defender of the light, the protector of the castle and all quacky things but I'm not sure about that horse of his,' Penny commented.

'Oh don't worry about Advillicuss. I've promised him extra carrots and a merit badge for good manners if he behaves like a regal steed. He's also agreed to move into his own private stable to quell these nasty rumours regarding his and CC's relationship.'

Scarlett showed Penny the photo of the crowd screaming to get into the grounds.

Invalid Photo #1006011

'Well I guess they're all here now.'

Scarlett turned to the next page.

Invalid Photo #1006005

'But do we tell them about the dark caves under the castle and what lurks in there?' Scarlett asked.

'Yes, I think we need to establish our authority here. Already I've overheard plans to take over the Royal seat. That blinking Bling King needs warning what may happen if he gets too big for his pointy boots.' Penny suggested.

Invalid Photo #1006010

'Okay,' agreed Scarlett. 'Let's send a message to Sherwood Forest and forewarn the merry men they may be needed here.'

'Here, you'd better send this too, so Robin can see just what weird characters are skulking around the castle grounds.'

Invalid Photo #1006006

Scarlett and Penny wandered back to the castle hoping Jeeves had coped with getting breakfast ready for such a large gathering.

'I hope Debs has sorted out her hair this morning,' Penny mused.

'I wonder if CC likes his eggs sunny side up?' Scarlett pondered.

But unbeknown to them that was the least of their worries. Little did they know what the day would bring.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Castle Conversations

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb wake up, the voice said.

“Go away.”

Deb wake up NOW!

Deb fell out of the bed. “Damn, what tha?”

She adjusted her eyes in the darkness and saw a man standing at the foot of the bed.

“Who are you?” Deb asked the funny dressed man. Geeze people over here dress funny.

“I am Richard I and I want to show you something.”

“Oh no you don’t you pervert. I’ve seen all the hoo hoos I care to see in this lifetime, thank you very much.” Deb said getting up off the floor.

“LISTEN TO ME,” Richard said in a stern voice. “You are all in danger. My brother John was a bad bad man and he is still roaming the castle. Oh and King David is still in the dungeon waiting to be let out. The castle has been disturbed by you strange people. What the hell is wrong with you people anyway?

“Okay dude, you listen to me. I am in no mood for ghosts tonight. You just go back to where ever it is ghosts hang out or better yet go talk to Nada; she will take care of it. If you get no satisfaction there then speak to Scarlett.”

“Deb I am haunting you because I believe my brother John will listen to a brunette in Joe Boxers and big fluffy blue slippers.”

“Oh you like them…HEY wait a second…I don’t fall for flattery you thousand some odd year old spook.”

“COME WITH ME NOW OR I’LL…

Deb grabbed a bottle of tequila, “okay you don’t have to get all huffy. Lead the way.”

Deb followed casper dude down the long hallway passing Nadas room. There was a sign on the door that read, “Don’t disturb and NO- Ben is not in here.”

The next room Deb could here someone talking…”Oh my queen, submit to the king and his bling bling” WHACK “You’re sleeping on the floor you son of a bling bling.”

Moving right along Deb runs right into…What tha? Deb felt around and could tell it’s was a person…a man…oh yeah it’s definitely a man…”oh sorry” Deb said…”HEY WAIT A DAMN SECOND…WHO’S THERE?”

“Shhh Deb it’s me Stealthman. I was sneaking around trying to get incriminating pictures for us Texans to sell to the Enquirer.”

“Oh okay, carry on.” Deb said continuing down the hall.

And if the night couldn’t get any worse Deb ran into Jeeves.

“Madam are you looking for something?” Jeeves asked.

“Uh no Jeeves, I’m just walking around in the middle of the night with a bottle of tequila because I am an idiot and don’t have anything better to do. No really Jeeves I am following this ghost named Richard I. He wants me to kick his brother’s butt and release some guy named King David from a dungeon. Oh I gotta run…” Deb quickly went through a door but little did she know it lead to some underground caves.

“NO Deb you can’t go down there…oh mercy,” said Jeeves. “The wine cellar is down there and if Deb finds it we won’t have beverages for tomorrow’s supper. Queen Scarlett will have my head.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Is she dreaming?

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Stealthman stopped in his tracks. His stealth-dog, Max bumped into him, “Woof, damnit!” It’s hard to see the stealth hero stop when he’s invisible.

“Hush, Max! What good is it to be invisible if’n you go around barking?”

“Whimper”

“That’s OK boy; it’s just that we gotta watch ourselves or we will be detected. Now, I think we need to change our plans. Let Tor get his own pictures. I got a better idea. Let’s tail Deb. That’s a much better plan.”

Max whimpered a near silent acknowledgment. The duo ditched the Polaroid provided by Tor. Who the heck uses a Polaroid anymore anyway? They hurried down the hallway just in time to see Deb duck into an ancient open door. Stealthman shoved his foot in the doorway before the door closed and the two slipped in behind Deb’s behind.

It was good that Stealthman and Stealth-dog were following the silly woman. Who the heck goes traipsin’ off with a ghost in the middle of the night? Hasn’t she seen enough of those B-rated horror movies? Some dang silly woman always goes trailing down some trail in spite of the whole dang audience yelling, “DON’T GO THERE!!!!” Well Stealthman was determined to keep this damsel safe…cause that’s what super-heroes do.

The group, both seen and unseen and both living and dead, descended down an ancient staircase. As the apparition walked past the ancient torches hanging on the wall the burst into flames, illuminating the next dozen steps or so.

“Hey, neat trick, Casper!” Deb exclaimed. “Huh, where you takin’ me, anyway?”

The ghost turned and grinned at Deb, “We are going deep into the bowels of the castle where no living person has been in eight-hundred years. It is there I will reveal the task I have for you. Do you dare follow, mortal?”

“Heck yes!” Deb replied. “Float on, Casper.”

“Whimper!”

“What was that?” Deb questioned turning to gaze behind her. “I thought I heard somethin’.”

There was no sound. Nothing except the process of rotting decay and milding mildew, whatever that is. The air grew cold around the seemingly solitary woman. Had she made a mistake following this ghost. She shrugged and moved on down the staircase. Stealthman and Stealtdog followed close behind unobserved. Deb looked behind her up the staircase. What she saw chilled her to the bone. Each torch extinguished itself as they passed a short distance. To turn back now meant she would have to negotiate the slippery ancient stairs in pitch darkness. She had no choice but to proceed.

On she walked following the floating apparition, for what seemed an eternity they descended into the depths of the castle. Surely by this time they were deep within the caves of the earth. What evil lay before them? What purpose lay in store for them? Soon they would know for they reached the last step. To the left and right was a decayed and unused passageway. Against the far wall were a number of iron doors with padlocks on each latch. Could she hear stirrings behind the doors or was it her imagination?

The ghost who called himself Richard stopped at an ancient door. The padlock fell from the latch and it moved with a rusty screech. Slowly the door began to open and stopped a quarter of the way. Deb stepped up to the door and pushed; it did not move. She placed her shoulder against the door and shoved. It moved slightly. She tried again. Except this time Stealthman leaned upon the door next to her and put his super strength into it. Slowly the door opened until it revealed a wide and dank opening.

Deb blinked, trying to get her eyes to adjust. Slowly she began to make out shapes and forms in the darkness. Her heart jumped a beat! Did she see movement? Was something coming towards her? Stealthman stood with his back to the wall. Stealthdog stood outside the door ready to head up the stairs in an instant.

Out of the blackness a raspy voice spoke. “Who are you mortal?”

Deb’s voice quivered, “You first, who the heck are you?”

“I am John. Brother of Richard. I am bad; I am big. They call me Big Bad John. For eight-hundred years I have been held in this room, unable to leave even when the door is opened. I am cursed to stay here until someone with real ‘you know whats’ will free me. For my freedom I will give all the desires of your heart. Do you have the courage to do this, mortal?”

“Hmmm, sounds like a pretty good deal. What do I have to do?”

“I am destined to remain here until someone will bring the flowing tail of a noble steed, the golden arrow of Robin Hood, and an iron skillet Holy Grail type thingy.”

“I think I can manage that Big Bad John. How long do I have?”

“Take as much time as you like. But first I must seal the deal with a kiss.” Big Bad walked out of the shadows towards Deb. Hair and rot hung from his face, his teeth were black and jagged. And to make things worse, he was naked, with his hoo hoo out front and center. “A kiss” he said as he approached.

“I don’t believe so!” exclaimed Deb. The iron door slammed shut. Big Bad advanced. Deb backed up against the wall right into Stealthman. Saliva dripped from the mouth of the gruesome advancing Big Bad. Deb squealed. Stealthman placed his arms around Deb and pushed his atomizer. Just as Big Bad reached out for her they atomized through space, out of the dungeon room. Max beat it up the stairs in the dark, cause black dogs can run real fast in blackness.

Deb and Stealthman reatomized in Dan’s room. They were standing in the middle of the bubble bath, but that did not bother either one of them.

“Oh my gawd!” panted Deb.

“Mine too.” Stealthman agreed.

“I’m so glad you were there!” Deb blurted out.

Stealthdog ran in the room and under the bed. Stealthman continued, “Glad to be there. But, Deb, what are you gonna do now? Are you going to accept the challenge? I get the kiss thing was just a cheap shot. You gonna get the things Big Bad wanted?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Ghosties and Bad Guys

choices: Where's the exit sign on this place?
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Teresa heard noises for the first time in hours.

"Hello!?" She shouted in vain into the dark shadows gathered around her. Only silence greeted her.

"Stupid, stuffy, pompus English butlers," she muttered to Chewie who was tucked gently under one arm. "'The Princess Penelope is allergic to cats, Modom. We will be making alternate arrangements for your stay with us.' I'll alternately arrange HIS ass." She continued to grumble steadily to the gently purring cat. "Stuff me in a damn dungeon will ya, buddy. Just you wait til I find my way out of here!" She shook the torch she had found in her "room" at the damp glistening ceiling.

"Mrwow?"

"Yes, baby, I know. It's too cold and damp down here. But look on the bright side, maybe there are some mice down here for you."

"Mrwow!"

Their room had consisted of a damp cell in the dark dungeon. The floor had been strewn with moldy bits of straw. In one corner was a grated hole, Teresa hadn't looked too closely at it, but the intervening years didn't cut the smell oozing up from it. The guttering torches jammed in the rusting iron holders on the damp walls had illuminated a rickety cot and some threadbare, motheaten, nasty smelling old wool blankets. Teresa's luggage had been tossed unceremoniously in a heap in another corner.

While she calmed Chewie after the trip and tried to sort things out, Jeeves had beat a hasty retreat, leaving her and Chewie alone in the dark where they had been wandering for hours trying to find a way out. Teresa would be talking to the Queen about this outrage.

"Heads will ROLL, Chewie. I didn't sail halfway around the ding-dang world to be stuffed in some moldy dungeon like some twelefth century criminal!"

Chewie privately hoped she got to see Jeeves get this ass-eating. When a Texas redhead gets pissy, all hell breaks loose.

But all she said was, "Merwow!"

Grimly, they pressed on.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heads will roll

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Thoroughly lost in the maze of the castle, I turned the corner of the hall and saw Deb step through a door, which almost closed behind her, then opened again of its own volition. A vague memory passed fleetingly through my thoughts – pink jammies filled with someone familiar who was putting on sunglasses and holding up a black maglight type thingy. But the dank air that whisked by me when the door closed blew away the image.

I wondered where Deb was going, and wondered if I should follow, but those questions came word-by-word so slowly that by the time I’d thought them out fully, I’d forgotten why I was wondering about Deb. One foot in front of the other I stepped laboriously down the hall, past the closed door. Each step couldn’t have been more difficult to take if I’d been slogging through knee-deep mud.

If I’d had any sense, I might have felt alarmed at my entanglement in an invisible force impeding my thoughts and movement, but I’ve never been known for having any sense.

It mattered little, since once I was well past the mysterious door, I was set free and found my way to the wing housing my fellow travel-mates. My soft bed was calling to me, the smooth sheets and warm blankets were beckoning. I picked up my pace, and sprinted down the hall to my room.

But I never got there.

A half wet Deb bolted out of Dan’s room and ploughed me down.

“My gosh, Deb,” I said as we struggled to disentangle ourselves. “You smell like death warmed over. You and Dan been burning some creepy incense?”

“No way! But he does have a cool hot tub in there – all bubbly and everything.”

“So, did I dream that whole thing, where I saw you disappear through a door three left turns and two right turns past the end of our hallway?”

“No, you didn’t dream it, but I don’t have time to explain to you now. Listen, I need your help.”

She grabbed my hand and pulled me behind her as she made her way to the door of Tor’s room. “I’ve got to get something from inside here. Mel’s not going to give it up willingly, so we’ve got to steal it.”

“Steal, what?”

But Deb didn’t answer, she’d already opened the door and snuck in, then she pulled me in behind her.

The room was dark, but far from silent. Tor and Mel snored in a two part harmony so lovely I stopped to tap my toe to the beat of their unconscious rendition of Frere Jaques.

Tor laid on top of the covers, his Sponge Bob Square Pants jockey shorts glowing in the dark. In one arm he cradled his bling bling chalice and his other hand gripped tightly the bling bling crown.

I began humming along with the snoring, and Deb whacked me upside the head.

“Keep focused here, girl. We got work to do.”

“OK, but what are we here to steal?”

“That!” Deb pointed to the iron skillet Mel hugged to her chest like a teddy bear.

“The iron skillet?”

“You betcha.”

“But, Deb…”

“What in tarnation are you two wimmin doing in my room?” bellowed Tor, now sitting up and bouncing on the bed in rhythm to Mel’s continued concerto. He put the bling bling crown on his head and threatened us with the bling bling chalice. OUT!

You never saw two ladies fly thorough a bedroom door as quickly as we. But before it slammed behind us, we heard Tor once again harmonizing with Mel, only now they were snoring Row-Row-Row Your Boat.

“Dang it!” said Deb. “I need that skillet.”

“But Deb, I tried to tell you.” I reached into my backpack and retrieved the iron skillet I’d borrowed from Ben. “Here,” I offered. “You want this one?”

Deb took the skillet, turned to look at CC’s door and asked, “You got any scissors in that thing?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Pre Dawn Thievery

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
To Tor there is nothing worse than getting woke up in the middle of the night, nothing that is except getting awakened in the middle of the night by two WOMEN in his room. Try explaining that one to the little lady the next morning!

Suffice it to say that Tor was in no mood to jack around when he staggered out of his bed at the crack of dawn. While Mel grumbled and groused about midnight visitors, Tor yanked on his pants and grabbed a fresh shirt.

Note to previous author: Who the hell told you about my Sponge-bob-SquarePants underware?

"I'll be back in time for breakfast, honey bun," he called over his shoulder as he hurried out the door.

"I'm going to find Nada," she yelled at his disappearing form. "I'll see you at the Royal Dining Hall, or whatever they call the eating joint around here".

Tor stormed down the hall yelling at the top of his lungs: "I WANT THE TEXAS POSSE OUT HERE ASAP!"

He kept repeating that call until finally, one after another sleepy-headed Texans began to gather around him in the great hall. After everyone, including the invisible Stealthman was standing around him, he began by looking hard at Deb.

"Well, little missy," he growled. "It looks like you have had a busy night. What other rooms have you broken into besides MINE?"

Deb looked around nervously. "Well, uh....gee, boss it wasn't just me you know".

Tor crossed his arms and continued to glare at her.

Deb took a deep breath..."Well I guess I might have been in CC's room," she told him as she tried to hide something behind her back.

"YO, Tor," a voice sounded in an empty space next to Deb." Check out what she has behind her back".

"Dang it Dan if you don't turn off that suit, I'm gonna cut the wires," Tor snapped at him. Dan quickly popped into view as Deb stuck her tongue out at him. Tor just as quickly,. reached around Deb and grabbed the object she held hidden.

"Ewwww," Tor exclaimed. "What the heck are you doing with a horse's tail?"

Deb reddened and replied. "That is one of the objects I had to retrieve for the ghost".

"Ghost?" Tor looked like he was going to burst a blood vessel.

"Yeah, the one that wanted my help down in the basement.

Tor closed his eyes and let out a long sigh. "You want to start at the beginning here?"

So Deb told Tor about her venture down into the Castle dungeon and about Stealthman rescuing her from the kissing ghost.

"So," Tor mused. "What you are saying is that all we have to do is bring that horse-tail, the frying pan and Robin Hood's golden arrow to this ghost and he will make all our dreams come true?"

Dan and Deb nodded in unison. "Yup," Dan agreed. "That's all we gotta do".

Teresa chimed in then. "Well all we have left to get is that arrow, I guess since Lauren gave her the frying pan and she cut off the nag's tail".

Tor grinned then. "Well hell then I say we get busy. Go hide all this stuff and act innocent and stuff. We will wait for Queeny to take us on the tour to find this Hood guy then we will strike!"

Everyone agreed then scattered to their respective room to either get ready for breakfast or hide the evidence....which ever came first!
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tor Catches up to the Posse

choices: The Day's Plans Are Laid Out
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The British sure know how to lay out a breakfast spread, let me tell you. Roast beef, scrambled eggs with Wisconsin cheddar, beanless chili, boiled spinach and potatoes, tuna salad with celery and red onion, toast and strawberry jam.

Everyone filled their plates and shuttled the food into ravenous bellies. Of course, the fanfare involving Tor, the bling and the badly rehearsed song almost put the crowd off their meal, but in the end, even the sight of him sitting next to an uncomfortable Queen Scarlett at the royal head table couldn’t keep us from eating.

Except for CC, that is. He laid his head on his plate and wept into the pewter, crying for the loss of his noble steed’s dignity.

“How’m I ever gonna be a respectable knight now? (blink blink) My Advillicuss has LOST HIS TAIL! When’s there EVER been a knight on a TAILESS HORSE???????” He stood on the table, kicking over the salt and pepper shakers as he stormed up and down declaring, “I WILL BE AVENGED!!! I mean WE will be avenged!!!” He punctuated each syllable with a thrust of his jabby thingy. As he stomped up and down the length of the table we each lifted our plates away from his grimy bare feet, presenting a perfectly choreographed plate wave.

“Is that toe jam?” C.L. Hanna asked. “EEEWWWW! I think I need more tea.”

“OK CC, that’s enough!” To shouted. “It’s a horrible thing, what happened to your horse, but you got to pull yourself together, man. Go get some shoes on and stop grossing everybody out.” As CC left the breakfast hall, dragging his jabby thingy along the marble floor, Tor sucked milk out of his mustache, raised his chalice and bid us all to continue eating.

Queen Scarlett choked on her eggs.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Breakfast Drama

choices: In Search of the Golden Arrow
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The Texas Posse split for breakfast. Dan took his place in line, visible for once. He was wearing his best Batman PJs—pretty spiffy. Max walked patiently beside him as they surveyed the buffet line.

Dan leaned across the buffet table and spoke to the attendant, “Where’s the grits?”

“The what?”

“You know, the hominy grits…grits?”

The attendant elevated his nose and spoke condescendingly, “The oatmeal, sugar, and milk are at the end of the table.”

Dan shuttered, “Oatmeal, what do I look like? I don’t want no oats. You think I’m a horse?”

“Woof, grrrrr!” Max agreed, and he don’t even like grits.

The attendant leaned in close over the table and whispered, “Sir, I would not use that word if I were you.”

“What? Oatmeal?”

“No sir, horse. It’s sort of a touchy subject.” With that the attendant motioned out the window.

Dan looked outside in the fine morning and saw Sir Dufus on his embarrassed horse that was sorta bare assed. “Hey, that horse ain’t got no tail!!” Dan pointed out the window. Heads turned toward the window. Slowly one chuckle emerged, and then another and another. Soon the whole room was laughing at the tailless horse.

** Image ID #1177415 Unavailable **


“Hey CC!” someone yelled. “What’s you’re horse’s name…..Stubby?”

Another voice blurted out, “Hey, it’s Sir Bare Ass and his horse Stubby.”

The room was in an uproar, holding their sides, pointing at the stubbed-butted horse. Dan walked down the buffet line loading his plate, dropping sausages on the floor where they were eagerly gobbled up by Max.

He chuckled to himself, “That’s one stubby horse. How does he hold the armor on his butt without a tail? [chuckle] I betcha it’s secured with duct tape. [chuckle]”

He sat down at a vacant table. He put the image of the embarrassed horse out of his mind and turned to the issue at hand. There was a golden arrow to retrieve. This would certainly require the super stealthy abilities of Stealthman and Stealthdog. There was much to think about.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Horse Named Stubby

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
CC STORMED OUT OF THE HALL !!!!!!!

BLUE STEEL EYES ABLAZE !!!!

As CC came to the Huge Front Doors Jeeves Stood with his eyes cast down as he opened them up. As CC passed thru Jeeves said in a muted tone.

This Deed was Evil Sir CC...A thing such as this has not happend here in three life times.

CC stoped and took a deep breath.. He placed a hand on Jeeves shoulder and said... From the things I've seen this morning dude....Evil is here is force and it's seems I HAD A HAND IN BRINGIN IT !!!!!
(CC let out a long sigh)

This I tell you good man....(Jeeves looked up at CC)
I'll Have my day with these heap of Horse Hackers.
TO THINK !!!!! TOR would place himself of the THRONE !!!! THE DANG THRONE !!!!. (CC head sank to his chest).

Are you going out CC....Jeeves asked.

Yes Jeeves... I'm going to the Stables to get Advilicuss and together... We will go into SHERWOOD and breath the Air of the Noble trees...And Rid ourselves of the These Dark Evil Deeds.

BE WELL CC... You go to the right place...I think you will find what you seek in the wood.

May the Light be with you Jeeves..And Please let the Queen and the others that I am well and will return before the sun falls from the sky.

The Queen will hear your words Sir.

With that CC headed out the door and before him stood Advilicuss at the ready...The horse just gazed at CC and dipped his head in greeting.
CC jumped to the Saddle and in a soft firm voice said.
TO THE WOODS MY STEED TO THE WOOD.

As Horse and Knight Left the Castle.. CC heard Laughin and words that made his blood run COLD.. He turned to see a Man pointing at them...(CC mumbled)
Laugh Hard DAN !!!! You and Your Heap of SKANK TOR DARK LORD SUCK-UPS !!!!! LAUGH YE WELL !!!!!
(CC thought to himself)...Only Tor would have such a thing in PANK PJ'S back him in such as this.

(CC and Horse when out of sight without a word)


(After a hour or two of riding)

The Horse Came to da STOP !!!!

By a stream of running water. Niether the Horse or knight had spoken as CC dropped down to the ground.

CC gathered the reins and pulled them over the horses head and said in a soft voice.

I've cost you much Advilicuss.. And I've not been CLOSE to the Knight you deserve. (CC drops his head) I can't even start to think of all the things that now I wish I could take back from either thinkin or outright sayin to your face.

Advilicuss say in a even tone.... I hear you CC.. And I think not of my Bald Arse when I say.. WELL I'D LIKE TO SEE THESE EVIL THINGS !!!!!

CC dove left in a tuck and rolled across the ground until he sprang to his feet with the SWORD OF LIGHT ABLAZE and at the ready.

Well the man let go of the horse and turned to CC with this huge smile and said...."Do you still have all your toes Sir ?"

CC stood and looked this man deep in the eye and said.." I have what I came with but I intend to leave here with all that came brought with me"

My Knight...Hold fast to your flappage...This man is of which you dare not fool with. Hold that heapin hunk of mouth you have shut... or you might find yourself left here to find your own way.

HORSE !!!! from my ears I think you have placed me here...Am i to think that after what I have just told you...You would have me takin by such as HIM !!!!

This man turns back to Advilicuss and laughs then says... You brought with you a fellow that kinda flies off the handle at things haven't you. Aduss.

(CC blinks) ADUSS !!!! ADUSS !!! OMG !!!!!

I HAVE BEEN SET UP AGAIN !!!!! BUY MY OWN HORSE !!

The man says to ADUSS..He gives up kinda quick don't ya think ?.....The Horse shakes his head and says... That man hasn't givin up.. He thinks that you will be dumb enough to come close so he can take a swipe at you before he dies.
