ADVILICUSS !!!!! YOU HEAP OF DIRT !!!! I can't beleive you would also turn to be as EVIL AS THAT SKANK WHO SITS NOW ON THE THRONE !!!!!!

With that this man tilts his head back and laughs a mighty laugh....EVIL AM I HE SAYS !!!!!!

ADUSS shakes his head and says...... CC you know not who stands before you Sir....I think when I tell you I'll next have to come over a lift you from the ground AGAIN !!!!!.

THIS TREE JUMPER SAYS TO ME !!!!!!!!

Sir CC... Evil has been in the place before..A Dark Man long ago thought he would take that Castle...It was said back then that a Man of my Faimly line held him at bay.... I think the time has brought us a NEW PLAY-TOY...

I want to see THIS SELF KING !!!!!

I want to !!!!!!!
(He turns to look at the horses BuTT)

ADUSS !!!!! Your Tail has Left you WHERE ?????

The horse just said.... All is well Robin..What we will take from them will NOT GROW BACK ANYTIME SOON !!

(In fit of chokin CC tried to say)

Ro

Rob

RA

ROBIN !!!!!!!! HA HA HOO HO !!!! SPLAT THUD !!!!!

(Advilicuss turns to Robin and says)

Don't worry Robin..You'll see him do that alot I'm afraid.


*** this chapter fades out with...well...with me on the ground again.

Robin says....Lets talk of this Evil Bunch Adcuss.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Tailess in Tailsection

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Jeeves, my good man, a word with you." The Queen looked put out that she was having to do this.

Teresa looked like she'd been drug through a knot-hole backwards.

Chewie padded around Teresa's feet purring in unholy glee. Now that skanky butler would get his!

"My guest from across the pond tells me that you put her and her....kittie...in the dungeon."

Jeeves' squinty little eyes grew squintier, if that was possible. "Yes, your Highness. I know of Princess Penelope's allergies. We can't have her Highness sneezing during the entire stay." He sniffed rudely at Chewie.

"Here, you jumped up toad. Give the Princess these until we leave. She'll be right as rain." Teresa slapped a bottle of allergy meds into his hand. "And you and some of your lackeys go get our stuff out of that maze of a dungeon you stuck us in last night. I'm exhausted. I need a nap! We wandered around for hours in the dark down there before we finally found the out hole. Hell of a place you got here, Scarlett."

"Yes, well.... If this is straightened out....I'm going to go see if my knight needs me....er, in his time of need. Maybe a Merit Circle will help his steed."

"Un huh. You do that. I'm gonna take a nap. Hey, did you know there's a torture chamber under this joint?"

Scarlett blushed furiously and wandered off in search of her knight in need.

"Point me to my room....my REAL room, Jeevesy. No funny business this time, or I'll sick King Tor on you! He and I are tight, you know. You Brits aren't the only ones with royalty around. We brung our own."

Once in her room, Teresa wandered around searching through cabinets and poking into cupboards. She had said she wanted a nap, but now she was just too restless to sleep. Jumping people out got her blood up and it wasn't conducive to sleeping. She was admiring a particularly nice wall sconce when suddenly it slipped off to one side. She was afraid it was going to fall off the wall. In her haste to catch it she fell against the wall panel in front of her. To her surprise, not only did the sconce not fall, the panel gave with her weight and she fell down a short flight of stairs, landing heavily on her side. Chewie slipped into the secret passage just as it closed seamlessly leaving them once again in the dark.

"Son of a..."

"Teresa?" Sudden light flared about ten feet from her.

"Merwow!!" Chewie started several feet into the air.

"Nanette? What are you doing in here?" Teresa asked as she got slowly to her feet dusting herself off. "And where is here?"

Nanette giggled. "Here is the motherlode. This is part of a series of secret passages that run throughout this castle. I've been exploring them since we got here. Well, when I wasn't...nevermind." Nanette blushed furiously.

"How did you find them?"

"I wasn't a cop for nothing! These old places always had secret passages built into them. You see it all the time in old books and movies." She grinned wildly. "You wouldn't believe what everyone was up to last night!"

"So....I gotta ask. Have you been watching the Texans meet?" Teresa bit her lip. Could they have a convert?

Nanette nodded, her eyes shining in the lamp light.

"Ok, I gotta know. Are you with us or agin us?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: New Digs

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Nada awoke with a jolt! Sitting up in the bed she realized that it was hard knocking at her door which had awaken her from a nightmare. “Huh?”

Getting up, she rubbed her backside, aware that something had been poking her back all night, but alas, she was so tired she couldn’t be bothered to look. She reached the massive door, “All right already,” and swung the door open to be face to face with….Mel and some faintly familiar, dark-haired woman dressed up in a white zip-up suit a silver F emblazoned across the chest, a silver cape, and completing the outfit were with gleaming silver boots. There was an aura of ….what…silver glitter….that swirled around her essence. She held in her outstretched hands a silver box.

“Hi Mel. Who is this woman with you?

“Awww Nada honey, don’t you recognize her? Look closely.” Mel smiled.

Nada studied the face, yes, vaguely famiiar, in an odd sort of way, but still, no clue. She shook her head.

The woman took a step towards her, she had…well, what could best be described as a halting gait, yet fluid and strong. Nada stepped back and then BOING, her eyes popped out as she recognized the woman…”FOREVER? Is that you?”

The vision in silver and white smiled and nodded.

”Well, get in here wimmins…what’s up?” She hugged Mel, then Forever, still stunned by the transformation.

Forever spoke first. “Hey Nada. Look, I never let anyone know before, but I have been given SUPERPOWERS. Actually, when I lost my leg, they replaced it, and a whole lot more too. I am sort of …well, bionic now.”

“Well I’ll be…” Mell interrupted, “Isn’t this the greatest thing since…well…the discovery of Stealthman?”

“Oh, much better, so much more appropriately dressed too.” Mel commented.

“ Did you make your costume?” I knew she sewed well, but damn, I gotta get her to whip me up a few gowns!

“Nada, yes, but never-mind my costume, I’ve transformed for a reason, that’s why we are here.”

“Yep, shall I tell her or do you want to?” Mel said.

“You.” Forever said.

“No, you.” Mel answered.

“Wait a damn minute…somebody tell me what’s going on…I need to check something out, so spill, NOW!”

Nada went to the bed and struggled to lift the mattress, dying to know what had pained her back. “OOOOMPH…UGHHHH…UUUUUHHHH….”, the mattress was so heavy.

“Forever took one finger and threw the mattress up off of the bed. Nada was stunned, speechless at the strength.

“Cool.” Mel cheered.

“Ahhh-haaa…I see the culprit…it’s a …a….a dang golden arrow! What the f….?”

“I knew it.” Mel said.

“Well, somebody fill me in….. please?”

“You better have a seat, this has not been a good night.” Both Mel and Forever nodded in unison, and then, like a overflowing terlet the words came out in a torrent…”And then….and then…..and of course Theresa..and…then…crown….Deb….Nanette…Stealthman…
Jeeves….my head swelled-husband Tor…and….skillett…then……Advilicuss….polaroids…ghosts….”, and so it went for twenty minutes, words swirling, Mel interrupting Forever, then Forever interruptin Mel. Finally, I could take no more and I asked, “What are WE going to do about it?”

Forever shoved the silver box at me, “The answer is inside.”

Slowly I lifted the lid, not knowing what to expect. Inside was a small scroll, tied up with a silver ribbon and a few Merit Circles dropped out, each one had a letter in the center. “Whaaaaa?” Nada gathered the Circles and untied the scroll. It read, “PUT THE LETTERS TOGETHER TO FORM A WORD FROM YOUR SAVIOR.”

“Hmmmm, can I get some help?”

The wimmins placed them on the floor, standing back to analyze them, hoping they would be like the answers on “Wheel of Fortune”, revealing the puzzle.

“Gawd, we need Vanna White to turn the letters over….” Nada scratched her head.

“Hey….how about if we get Ben to put on his Kilt?” Mel said excitedly.

“Hmmmm. Okay, I’ll be right back.” Nada ran out to go knock on Ben’s door.

KNOCK-KNOCK….nothing…KNOCK-KNOCK..

“Who’s there?”

“Nada.”

“Nada Who?”

“Dang it Ben, open up, this is serious.” The door creaked open, Naked Mole rat was now dressed in a tiny footman’s uniform. “Sheesh Ben, have you no shame?”

Ben smiled, Nada’s heart skipped a beat at the site of him, all dressed in a fine Burberry Kilt, bagpipes at his feet. “Oh Ben…we need you.”

He picked up the bagpipes and began to play, “My Bonnie lies over the ocean…”

“Ben! This is not the time for that, I mean we need your BRAIN man. Come with me.”

She had to admit the choice of Kilts was perfect, another inch shorter and she would not have been able to control herself. “Whew, another distraction averted.” She muttered as she took him by the hand and led him to her room to join the wimmins. “I got him!”

“Nada” said Mel, “nevermind we figured it out!”

Nada stopped in her tracks, “Well?”

And Forever said…..
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: AMAZING.....

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dan kicked the door open and burst through the bedroom door like the Marines hitting the beaches.

“What the ….” Mel yelled and swung the skillet in a vicious arc.

Dan ducked the wild swing and shouted, “Hey! It’s me! Call off the artillery!” He ducked the skillet on the way back on the backhand.

Mel dropped her hand to here side, “Dan, you dufus! What are you doin’ bustin’ in here like that. Don’t you know that’s dangerous?”

“Geeze, I do now!” Dan remarked as he kept his eye on the skillet. “Where’s Tor?”

“He’s on his throne.”

“Oh, well I’ll go downstairs and see him there.”

“No, Buckethead! Not that throne; the one in the little room over there! Here, put this on; he’ll be coming out in just a moment.”

Dan looked at the ancient World War I gas mask and heard the terrlet flush. Quickly he flung the mask on. A second later the bathroom door opened and out stepped his majesty King Dufus. Tor looked at Dan; he looked at the skillet; he looked at Mel; then he looked at Dan Again.

“What the blazes you doin’ here?”

“OK, we got a problem.”

Tor shook his head, “Nope, I’ll tell you when we got a problem. What we got is a situation. I know what problems are and this ain’t it! Now tell me what’s happenin’.”

“Well,” began Dan, “I was being Stealthman. You know, sneakin’ and watchin’, sort of reconnaissance. You know, you can never have too much information. Well I was stealthing in Nada’s room. I’d been there for a long time. Justa watchin’ her.”

“OK, so you were peeping in Nada’s room, what happened?”

“Well, first of all, did you know she’s a strange cookie? I mean who in the world gets totally nekid to take a nap in the middle of the day? Regular folk don’t do that.”

“You dummy! She’s from California!”

“Oh, that’s right! I forgot about that!” Dan nodded understandingly and then continued, “but as I was standing there watchin’ her, in comes this Richard ghost dude. You know, the same one that took Deb to Kissin’ Bad Butt John.”

“You sure it was the same one?” Tor interrupted Dan.

“Yeah, besides, how many of them could there be. It was the same one. Well anyway, he floats over real slowly to Nada’s bed; he bends over her sleeping body; then he reaches out for her.”

“Did he hurt our Nada?” Tor exclaimed forcefully, “I’ll vaporize the ghoul if’n he even touched her!”

“Nope, he didn’t do nothin’ to her. But, he held somethin’ in his hand that was all shiny. I couldn’t tell what it was for a moment. And then I saw. Yup, then I saw what it was. I couldn’t believe what I saw. But, I really saw it. Right there in front of….”

“Alright already! What was it?”

“Heck, it was a golden arrow. He crammed it under her mattress.”

“You sure?”

“Yup, that’s what it was alright…the golden arrow. Only, about that time Mel, here, and this gaudy Glitter Girl busted in the room. Before I knew it, this Glitter Girl had the dang arrow. That’s the dang arrow we need, dude. We just gotta do somethin’ to get that dang arrow.”

Tor stared at Mel questioningly, “Well?”

“How the heck did I know? I just thought it was a cute outfit and wanted to show Nada. I didn’t think anything about it. Hey! I was gonna tell you, but I forgot!” Mel stammered defensively to Tor.

Tor only shrugged his shoulders and said, “Women!” Then he scratched his head. He looked at Stealthman and at Max, scratched his head some more and then said. “I think I know how to get that dang golden arrow….”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Gotta Get that Dang Arrow

choices: Robin and Deb sittin in a tree
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Morning Deb,” a few folks said all happy in the cafeteria or whatever this eating joint was called.

“Well happy dang morning to yall too!”

“Madam what will you be drinking, orange juice perhaps?” Jeeves asked in a sarcastic tone.

“Ah Jeeves that sounds great but could you add a couple shots of vodka to that. I could use a good a screw…

“Deb! Tell me you didn’t just say what I think you said.” Teresa shouted out.

“I was trying to say I needed a good screwdriver before you interrupted me. Dang Teresa get your mind out of the gutter.” Deb laughed.

“Hey Teresa, how do you suppose we are going to that golden thing from Mr. Hood?”

“Beats the heck out me; you have anything in mind?” Teresa asked.

“Well I could seduce him but isn’t he like really old?”

Teresa spit out her coffee, “Dang Deb you were just saying the other day how you would like to find a rich almost dead guy. Well there you go!”

“Look there goes CC.”

“Yeah he’s pretty upset about his horses tail that went missing.” Teresa explained.

“Hmmm that’s terrible. Hey wasn’t there a story once about a horses head that went missing and the dang thing galloped around scaring people? You think CC’s horse could become an urban legend now? And to think WE were here when it started!”

Teresa put her head down and cried. Why had she had the misfortune of communicating with Deb this early in the morning?

When Teresa looked up Deb was gone. “What tha?”

Deb ran outside and followed CC into the woods. She watched as CC, Advilicuss, and some guy talk. “Who is that guy?” Deb thought. The next bizarre thing that happened was CC falling down in an apparent faint/suicide thing.

The man helped CC onto his horse and swatted the horsies butt. Bye CC and Advilicuss!

Deb sneezed. “Oh that can’t be good,” she thought.

“Who goes there?” The man said.

Deb walked up to the man and reached out to shake his hand. “Hi I’m Deb…Deb W.”

He took her hand and introduced himself, “Robin…Robin Hood.”

“Ah well nice to meet you Mr. Hood. Oh and what a pretty golden arrow you have there.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Deb heads for the hood

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Tor made his way slowly into Sherwood forest, all the time flipping pages in a book he carried with him. The book, roughly the size of the Guttenberg Bible on steroids, was balanced precariously in Tor's hands and he was reading furiously as he walked.

"What," he muttered as he read, then he flipped another page.

"What the hell is she doing there? Oh that can't be right, I just saw her at breakfast and what's she doing.....DAMN!"

Tor slammed the book in frustration. There was no way around it...he was lost. Besides that he didn't know where he was in the forest either.

He was about to give up and try to find his way back to the castle when he suddenly heard voices. Tor quickly made his way through the thick vegetation. Suddenly he broke into a clearing and he discovered where the voices were coming from.

There in front of him was...well..EVERYBODY! Dang!

Nada was there, standing next to Ben who was dressed in one of those sissy man-skirts, Lauren was standing to their left, grasping the handles of her bicycle. EmmyLoo was next to her with Party on her right, looking a bit dazed and confused. Deb, Teresa and Stealthman rounded out the mob. Well at least the Texas Posse was here, Tor thought to himself.

Just then Pastvoices and Mel broke into the clearing. Mel was accompanied by some chick in a silvery, glittering, very form fitting costume, replete with a long cape.

"Ohhh, nice outfit cutie," Tor remarked as he leered at the stranger.

Without even missing a beat, Mel heaved a frying pan at Tor's head. Tor, without even thinking, deftly sidestepped the flying pan and it whizzed by his head.

"Dang it, Tor," Mel yelled at him. "Control the hormones, this here is Forever and she is in Super hero mode as Glitter Girl!"

"Oops," Tor mumbled. "Sorry Forever, I didn't recognize you in that sexy little number".

Forever rolled her eyes and asked Mel if she could borrow a pan...just in case.

Before Tor could say anything else, there was a big racket and the crowd all looked to the east...Five men on horseback rode into the clearing; each dressed up in full Knight gear.

CC had arrived.

"Well look who's here," Tor drawled. "It's the Bare-Assed Knight and his bob-tailed Nag. Who's your buddies?"

CC drew himself up proudly and addressed the milling crowd.

"I HAVE COME TO REDEEM THE HONOR OF MY STEED".

Tor chuckled. "Hell boy, you're just a little late on that one ain't you?"

"Not so, you knarly knave," CC's voice was hard as mud (its CC, remember). "I have brought some of my fellow knights to help me in my Holy battle against you dastardly Texas barbarians".

The aforementioned knights spurred their horses and rode even with Sir Dufus. CC continued:
'
"Allow me to introduce my friends," he said in a loud, yet irritating voice. "This is Silent Knight, Three Dog Knight, Last Knight, and Good Knight. They have agreed to join me in battle for Queen and Country!"

This introduction was met with a moment of stunned silence. The assembled knights looked out at the crowd with haunty, proud stares. Suddenly the silence was broken by Nada who started to giggle. This breach in sound quickly grew into a flood of laughter and cat-calls as the large group succumbed to the collective weirdness of the motley knights and their cockamamie names.

CC and the knights sat their steeds in stony silence as everyone struggled to suppress their mirth.

"OKAY, DAT'S ENOUGH LAFFING AT MY FRIENDS!" CC yelled at the crowd. His face was a bright shade of purple from his rage.

Tor nodded as he wiped tears from his eyes, still giggling. "Oh man CC," he choked. "Only YOU could come up with a group like this. Thanks bud, that's the best laugh I've had since I got to this place".

The four enraged Knights and CC all lowered their pointy, jabby things and made ready to charge the group who were showering them with scorn. The crowd went silent. Stealthman went into 'Battle mode...he disappeared along with his stealthdog, Max. Mel hefted two frying pans and eyed the knights...figuring windage and elevation. Glitter Girl was getting set to...well, I'm not sure what she was gonna do but I bet it was gonna be fun to watch!

Mel threw a spare pan at Tor for that last one.

"Sorry hon," Tor said absently as he dodged it yet again.
Yes, battle was about to be joined and it promised to be a bloody one indeed. Then, from out of nowhere (that's how most of this stuff happens in this story) the great Queen, Scarlett steps forward.

"HOLD, HOLD AND DESIST, I SAY!" Her royal voice boomed out across the clearing. "There shall be no bloodletting in our beloved Sherwood Forest. We must find a way to settle our differences and become friends".

"Fat Chance," mumbled CC.

"Don't make me come over there," Da Queen growled at the dufus knight.

"Sowwy Queenie," a chastened CC answered her as he and his "knights" lowered their weapons.

"Hey Queen I got an idea," Tor spoke casually. "How about we settle this whole ruckus with a horse race...that's how we do it in Texas. Me against the Buckethead and his short-tailed horse".

The Queen smiled at Tor. "I think that is a smashing idea, Sir Tor," she beamed. "We shall have a Royal Horse Race: Three times around the clearing and the winner shall take all. Whosoever wins the race shall keep the bling,bling crown and septer, they shall have all the things the ghosts sent them to gather and they shall have whatever reward the ghosts promised them".

"Whatever," Tor snapped as he turned and motioned to Stealthman to bring forward his horse; a beautiful bay colored mare, a true Texas Quarter Horse complete with Texas saddle. Tor swung easily up into the saddle and wheeled the horse around to face CC.

"Okay buddy," he said confidently to a suddenly worried looking CC. "Time for me to show you how we do this stuff in Texas".

With that the race was on.

It was no contest. Tor lapped CC on his second turn around the clearing and he won handily.

A MIGHTY CHEER WENT UP! TOR HAD WON THE RACE! THE CROWD WENT WILD!

Tor jumped off his horse as he skidded to a stop across the finish line and he surveyed the field. CC was still laboring to catch up to him, the other knights were exiting the clearing with very disgusted looks on their faces. Everyone was gathered around the Queen and everyone was trying to talk at once.

It was then that Tor noticed Mel standing apart from everyone else and she was talking to another stranger. He was a short little bald man and he was glumly counting out this huge wad of bills...money...coin of the realm!

Tor strode up to his sweetie. "What's going on honey?" He asked his wife. "Why is this stranger paying you money?"

Mel smiled at her hubby. "Oh this guy just happened by before the race started and he wanted to bet on the outcome, so I agreed to bet him".

Tor looked at the crestfallen stranger as Mel continued. "This is Sam Body, he bet on the Bob-Tailed Nag...I just bet on the Bay!"

Tor smiled.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Race

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I stood with my cup of Finn at the back of the gathering, taking in the spectacle.

Tor stood on a tree stump in the middle of the clearing and raised the bling bling chalice to the crowd. He tipped the cup and drained it in three echoing gulps. “Ahh, nothin’ like milk straight from the udder,” he uttered.

The audience applauded weakly. Ben and Nada rolled their eyes in perfect unison while tapping their fingertips together, Mel clapped with one hand, patting the bulge in her pocket, Glitter Girl had difficulty clapping with the long velvet bag swinging from her wrist. The Texans though, they roared and cheered. Nanette and C.L. Hanna were off away from the group, offering the horses handfuls of dandelions.

The bay, his job completed, stood sweating and puffing, neglected by his mighty regal. The race had been a travesty; even I on my bike, carrying my pack and my fish, could have beaten the amour laden Advillicuss and CC. And now the poor, defeated man stood on the fringe of the crowd, standing next to me and fuming.

“This didn’t turn out so good,” I said to him.

“No. It didn’t.”

“I imagine you’d like to have the chance to be a hero.”

“Yes. I would.”

The redness of his hears and neck belied the nonchalance of his tepid replies.

“I think I know a way you can save the day,” I whispered to him.

We turned away from the group, now mumbling about merit circles and what was for dinner.

I gave CC the penny version of the ghost story, which explained why his horse lost his tail.

“OH MY GOSH!” he cried, too loudly. I put my hand over his mouth to shut him up. Not a pleasant experience, that. CC’s huffing nose dripped……well, it dripped all over my hand, but I kept my palm pressed firmly against his lips until he’d calmed down and was willing to speak quietly. More accurately, I kept my palm pressed against his lips until he stuck out his tongue and licked it.

“My precious had his tail cut off for a ghost?” he sputtered.

“Look, CC, what’s been done can’t be undone now, but you can save the day by getting the golden arrow.” A light went on somewhere in that vast cavern of a mind of his and his eyes sparked.

“As far as my overhearing has lead me to understand, Glitter Girl has the projectile of precious metal. Is that right, Finn?”

Finn flashed blue.

“If you can manage to get a golden arrow and get it to Deb to get to the ghost, you’ll be a hero, worthy of celebration,” I told CC.

“That’s all I’d have to do? Get the arrow and give it to Deb?”

“Yea. Of course, there may be other Texans and a few additional stragglers with an interested concern. It seems as if everyone want to have the desires of their heart granted them.”

“Oh, well, whatever. Get the arrow. Give it to whoever wants it. And I’m a hero.”

“That’s all.”

“You think it’ll be easy?”

Finn flashed red.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Baton is Passed

choices: If you aren't Texan, watch your back
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After CL and I finished pretending to feed weeds to the horses, I was able to edge Nada away from the crowd as Teresa was celebrating with the Texas Posse.

"Nada, we have trouble, big trouble."

"Everything is fine Nanette. Are you sure you should be talking to me? I heard you were going over to Texas."

"Yeah, well Teresa's mouth is just a little too big and her brain doesn't wait for an answer before she chooses to believe what she wants. I never said for sure that I was joining the evil Texans."

"OK, but Forever has taken care of hiding the golden arrow anyway and no one knows that we have it so they can't demand it."

"Yeah, well, there is another fly in the hummus, it seems Stealthman was watching you sleep..."

"HE WAS WHAT?"

"He was watching you sleep and found out about the golden arrow. I don't have all the facts but Teresa said they could get it from you."

"The nerve of him watching me sleep in the nude!"

"Nada, focus! Tor wants nothing more than to be top royal person equal with Queen Scarlett. He won't be satisfied until CC and Advilacuss are crying in the forest."

"What now?"

"Deb has met an evil ghost in a musty dungeon that she has promised Advilacuss' tail, the golden arrow, and a skillet grail to so that he is free of his hundreds of years old curse. Apparently, the Texas Posse, upon delivering these talismans will have all their wishes fulfilled. I don't know if these half-wit Texans have thought that this guy may just be yanking their chains to get out of his."

"Has Teresa told all of them that you have turned?"

"No. I have no intention of "turning" or pretending to, I think there may be another way to handle this mess. I think we need to enlist Party and Emmyloo about now."

"Do tell."

"I am sure that Scarlett has planned a ball. If we all dress up and show up, here is what I think we should do..."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Never give a Texan a Montana point of view

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I returned to the castle with Glitter Girl on my handlebars and Finn in my backpack. I’d left the group in order to return Finn to his tank, as he was again looking a bit peaked, and was surprised when GG asked me for a lift.

“Surely you can get back without my help,” I’d said. “You can probably run there faster than I can pedal.”

“Hey, look,” she miffed back at me. “I’m a powerfully strong super hero, but I have my limits, and running is one of them. Besides, sometimes I just need to be Forever, you know?”

I didn’t exactly know, but I could guess.

As we crossed the drawbridge, Forever noticed a nest of bubbles on the stagnant water of the moat.

“Would you look at that,” she said. “I wish we had Galinago with us to say what’s making those bubbles.”

But the source of the bubbles became apparent when through the surface rose the heads of Party and Emmy, adrape with green moat slime.

“Hey, you twooooo,” I called from above, waving.

Emmy blushed and smacked Party. “I told you we’d get caught!” she said, as she mounted his shoulders, submerging her frolicking partner. That was when Forever and I noticed the two of them were skinny dipping.

Party reemerged, sputtering. He held out his tongue obligingly, allowing a tadpole exit from the maw of man.

“Get us out of here!” Party hollered. “We’ve fallen in and can’t get out!”

Oh, sure.

I pulled from my backpack another length of rope and a skate board. “I’ve got the tools, Forever, but we’re going to need Glitter Girl for this.” It was a simple task for me to tie the rope to the wheels of the board and improvise a seat; it was a simple task for Glitter Girl to pull the seat from the moat with Emmy aboard.

We lowered the contraption for Party, but he refused to come up until we’d thrown down his shorts.

Emmy, who had dressed faster than I thought any human could, held up Party’s shorts and teased, “are these what you want big man? First, let me recall why you’re down there in this embarrassing state in the first place.”

“But you said you wanted to go for a swim!” whined Party.

“Don’t go and blame me. That’s just like a man. I wanted to go back and get our swim suits. I wanted to find a swimming pool But noooooo. ‘This’ll be fun,’ you say. ‘Who’s around to see?’ you ask. ‘It’s not slimy, English water is always green,’ you lie. ‘We can get back out easy, just climb the bank and dress before they all get back,’ you insist. ‘They’ll be gone for hours,’ you google eyed. How dare you persuade me to do this?!” Emmy wadded Party’s shorts and stuffed them down her shirt, then snatched his jeans and ran into the courtyard, laughing hysterically.

“Someone’s gonna have to go fetch me something to put on,” Party called up weakly. And please hurry, I’m about wore out, treading water.”

Lucky for Party, I had the solution in my backpack.

Glitter Girl pulled Party onto the drawbridge, just as the others returned.

“What in the heck is that sorry thing?” asked Ben.

Party stood, a sorry thing, indeed. His chest hairs lay matted with slime, an imperfect V of green fur peeking from the opened zipper of the snowsuit. Similar hairy patches emerged from the too-short arms and legs of the outfit. Strands of green pond weed hung from his head like creepy lagoon locks.

He held his hand out, warding off comments that were forming in the minds and mouths of the audience. “Do NOT ask,” he commanded, then turned and waddled back to the castle, following the wet footprints left behind by Emmy.

The crowd remained, suppressing their laughter for a few moments more. I couldn’t help noticing CC and a few others gave intent attention, not to Party’s departure, but to Forever, who was absently fingering through the cloth of her velvet bag, the item contained within.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dripping on the Drawbridge

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“What do you mean that’s not the original golden arrow?” Deb asked Mr. Hood.

“Well…someone stole it so I dipped this one in a chicken egg and let it dry in the sun. See it looks yellow, right? I can’t go around without my golden arrow because who would take me seriously?” Mr. Hood replied.

Deb thought about that comment for a second and shook her head. “Okay Robin we need to get your arrow back. You do great things for people and I’ll have to take this fake one and try to fool John ghost dude.

“Who is that?” Hood asked.

“Some dead guy who was a bad bad man and now his dead brother, Richard, wants me to take care of him once and for all, but then John made me a proposition. If I get him some stuff he would grant some wishes and well now I am having second thoughts. What if this spooky looking spook is lying? I think he thinks I fell off the turnip truck yesterday. Know what I mean Hood?”

“Huh?”

“Nevermind…”

Ring Ring goes Debs cell phone.

“Hello”

“Deb W?”

“Yep that’s me.”

“Camilla here…I need help with my hair.”

“Damn that ain’t no lie,” Deb replied. “I’ll see if I can work you in. Hey how would you like to attend a party tonight?”

“Oh that would be lovely. Can Charles come?”

“Uh sure and hey by the way….I need a small donation. Will that be a problem?” Deb said.

“Girlfriend if you can do something with this hair and get the world to stop telling me my style is from the 70’s I’ll make it worth your while.”

“Terrific. See ya at the party.” Deb hung up and had a big smile on her face. “Listen up Hood. Tonight you will take from the rich and spread the love brother! I will take care of John walking corpse dude and the world will be good! Now hand over that yellow chicken crap arrow.”

Deb ran back to the castle and was greeted by Jeeves.

“Good afternoon madam.” Jeeves said as he read her t-shirt. I did the “Hood” and all I got was this ridiculous t-shirt

“Yes it is Jeeves.” Deb said giving Mr. Jeeves a happy smack on the lips before running to her room. “I’m from Louisiana so only a Texan by technically. I take orders from no one and can be bought if the price is right,” Deb said to herself.

Mr. Jeeves shook his head and started to cry. “I have got to find another job.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A free agent

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After changing into her cocktail dress, a slinky little red piece of material, Deb grabbed her martini and left her room.

She stood in the hallway listening for any sound of life. Nothing! “Whoa this is strange,” Deb thought. “I’ll go find Jeeves and see what the heck is going on.”

She searched high and low and FINALLY found Jeeves picking lint off the red carpet in the foyer.

“Jeeves, howdy dude. Have you seen anyone lately coming and going?” Deb asked throwing her olive up in the air and catching it in her mouth.

“Madam…tell me you just didn’t do that.”

“Can’t do Jeeves; wanna see me do it again?” Deb asked grabbing another olive out of her drink. “So have you seen any live bodies in this here castle lately?”

“Very few madam and it has been a good day indeed.” Jeeves replied sarcastically.

“Oh? So who’s here?”

Jeeves got out his pocket pc and looked up his weirdos onstar tracker thingy.

“Well Party used his cell phone to travel back in time and uh let’s see; he is standing on an ice berg waving his arms and hands screaming “go left, go left,” and Emmylooloo is in her room making curtains to redecorate the castle but it seems she sewed herself into one of them and is trying to figure out what went wrong. Ah I see Queen Scarlett left the castle to attend an important meeting with master CC. Oh my, what in the world are they doing? Oh they are playing pin the tail on the horsey. King Tor is in his room google-ing information on where to find rubber frying pans for Mel. Stealthman is invisible so I can’t begin to tell you where he is. Nanette, Forever, CL, Lauren, esperanza and Theresa are passing out flyers for the gala tonight. Hmm the flyers say “Party at the haunted castle. Free booze!” Windini is taking a nap; the poor woman is exhausted.”

“Hey, what about Nada and Ben?” Deb asked.

“Madam my tracker is rated PG-13 and it won’t let me see.” Mr. Jeeves said closing his pc.

“I’m bored Jeeves. Want to play with me?”

"Madam I do not have time; now run along." Mr. Jeeves said resuming his lint picking.

"Okay well...I guess I'll run down to the basement and put the wine bottles in alphabet order...

"NO...I mean madam what would you like to play?" Jeeves said thinking russian roulett sounded pretty good.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: YO YO where did yall go?

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Deb and I were making our way back down into the heart of the dungeon. Our passage was far from silent as we were followed by the rest of the crew, quibbling and nipping at each other like a pack of hungry puppies.

I shone the flashlight ahead and asked Deb if she was sure she could remember how to find the ghost John’s cell.

“Just follow the burnt out torches on the walls,” she said, and sure enough, they led us right to the bolted door.

Tor and Dan came forward to release the bolt and swing open the heavy door, revealing to the crowd the grungy, stinking hairy ghost, who had promised to grant hearts’ desires.

C.L. Hannah pinched her nose and sucked in her breath. “Dang, this dude reeks!” she said.

“Careful what you say,” whispered Teresa, poking her elbow into the Tea Lady’s ribs. “He might be offended, and something tells me this is a dude we don’t want to get on the bad side of.”

“OK, John. I’ve got your stuff.” Deb handed over the iron skillet grail thingy, the horse’s tail and the faux golden arrow, gleaming with dried egg yolk. “Now, do what you said.”

“Not so fast, woman!” the ghost bellowed. “I am not to be ordered about like a serf!!!!” He shifted his eyes among the gathering and took a step back into the darkened corner. “Besides, first I have to use these things to make a potion, then I’ll have the power to grant you your desires before I leave this place for good.”

“Well, get to it then, stinky,” Deb said, clearly unconcerned with offending the oaf.

“John scanned the empty cell, then addressed the crowd. “You all better just go away and come back later. I can’t make the potion now. I need a fire and don’t have any wood or flint here to start one. You go away and leave that door open, then I’ll go out and get what I need. Come back tomorrow and I’ll be ready.”

“In a pig’s eye!” Deb said. “What? You take us for fools?” She looked at me and I delved into my backpack, pulling from its recesses my camp stove and lighter.

John watched in disbelief as I turned the nozzle on the stove, lit the HUSTLER lighter and made fire. “There you go, big guy. You can make your potion,” I said.

“Can’t make a potion without water,” he complained.

“Here! Here you go!!” Nanette pushed her way through the group and offered her liter bottle of Avian water. “I never go anywhere without my water,” she explained. “Hasn’t anyone noticed?” Everyone shook their heads, including me.

I opened the bottle and poured it into the iron skillet, then placed the pan on the little stove. “Have at it, John,” I said.

The ghost coiled poor Advillicuss’ tail and placed it in the water, which was already beginning to boil. That stove boils water like no body’s business.

The crowd standing in the doorway rearranged itself periodically over the next five minutes, so everyone could get a glimpse of the simmering tail. The odor filling that tiny cell and leaking out into the corridor was about as rank as the reeking ghost. Nada began fanning herself with her hand, and Ben stood close at hand, watching her anxiously. Winda stood in the doorway and faced her compatriots, then opened her mouth and blew. Tor held tightly to his bling crown, Emmy’s hair snapped in the stiff breeze, and Party just managed to grab his fishing cap before it blew into Esperanza’s face. But everyone took a deep breath and a bit of color returned to once ashen faces.

John lowered his face to the skillet and took a deep, satisfied breath. He picked up the arrow and stirred the potion with its tip.

“I should think a golden arrow could be put to better use,” observed Deb.

“You think I’m gonna stir my potion with this?” John held up a finger, black with grime, crowned by a nail encrusted with nothing any of us wanted to know about. “I guess you’ve go a point,” Deb answered.

John watched his stirring intently, squinted his eyes, lifted the arrow and inspected it, then let out a roar that sent chills up the spines of everyone present. He spun to face Deb, pointing the egg yolk dripping arrow at her face. “How dare you try and trick me!!!” He approached her with surprising speed and pinned her against the wall. “Shall I put this arrow to better use? Shall I use it to gouge out your eyes? Shall I use it to rip open your guts and watch you die in agony? I could use some company if I’m going to be staying here another few hundred years!” He teased the arrow along her cheek and bared his black teeth. “Which shall it be? You choose.”

Deb was having a hard time deciding on that one.

“GET OUTTA MY WAY!!” CC called as he fell into the room. Forever’s velvet pouch flew from his hand and slid across the floor. CC slithered on his belly to retrieve it, then opened the pouch and pulled out the real golden arrow, holding it up triumphantly. Or as triumphantly as was possible from the position of lying on his belly. “Just in time to SAVE THE DAY!!!” he crowed.

“CC, how did you get that?” I asked.

“I gave it to him.” The crowd parted to allow passage to an out of breath Forever. “I only wanted to use it as a mantle decoration in my new home, anyway. CC traded me some nifty merit circles, so now I have more than Scarlett!”

John threw down the crap arrow and snatched the golden one out of CC’s hand.

“Ouch!” CC hollered. “You didn’t have to go and cut me, you know!” He held up his hand; blood dripped from a scarlet line in his palm.

John dragged CC over to the iron skillet grail tingy and shook the bleeding hand over the potion. When five drops of blood had landed sizzling into the elixir, the ghost recommenced his stirring, this time with the real golden arrow.

“It is ready,” he announced. “But I can’t guarantee it will work unless I drink it from a silver chalice.”

All eyes turned to Tor, whose attempt to step back was hindered by the press of the crowd.

“Hey, No you don’t!!” Tor yelled as Stealthman wrenched the chalice from the pseudo king’s hand. The bling chalice rose above the crowd, traveling over heads in invisible hands, until it came within reach of the ghost John, who took it from the air. He poured his concocted potion into the bling chalice and gulped it down. Tor raced into the room and snatched his precious from the grimy hands, then tripped over CC in his rush to make it back out to the safety of the group.

John heaved a contented sigh, stood tall and began to fade.

“No disappearing yet!” Deb commanded. “You owe us the desires of our hearts. You promised!” She pointed her finger at the diminishing figure. “A bargain’s a bargain!”

“Well, to tell the truth,” John confessed, “I slightly overrated my powers. I can’t really give you all the desires of your heart.”

“OK, I’ll settle for just a few,” Deb insisted.

“Yea,” the crowd agreed, “just a few will do. We’re not greedy.”

“What did you think I am? A genii? I’m just a ghost. Who ever heard of a ghost granting wishes?” John gave forth a hearty laugh before becoming as invisible as Stealthman. A hot breeze wafted through the gathering, down the corridors and up the stairs. We heard the door at the top slam shut and knew John was gone forever.

“What a rip-off,” Deb whined. "Now I'm not going to have a better dress than Nada at the ball tonight!"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Potion

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The quarter moon reflected in the dark surface of the moat.

“Are you sure this is what you want?” I asked Finn

He flashed blue.

“I’ll miss you, you know. You’ve been such a good companion on this trip. I think you’re about the best fish detective I’ve ever known.”

He blushed pink.

“But you’re really not feeling good, are you?”

He flashed red.

“And you’re certain you wouldn’t survive the trip home?”

He flashed blue.

“I guess this kind of travel and adventure is just too hard on one so delicate as you. Well, there are other fishes in the moat. You won’t be lonely. I expect you’ll be happy there.”

Finn flashed blue.

I watched in sorrow as he blew his final nest of bubbles on the surface of the water in his travel cup. My tears plunked into the midst of the nest and the bubbles encircled them. Finn’s little mouth rose from the floating puddle of my tears and he took a breath.

“You won’t ever forget me, will you?” I asked.

Finn flashed red.

I tipped the cup and gently poured Finn with his water into the moat. “Farewell, little buddy.”

I put the empty cup into the recycle bin at the courtyard entrance and headed for the ballroom, silently thanking Nada for the loan of one of her gowns: a blue silk number with a flowing red train.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Final Farewell

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
On a beach somewhere in the South of England...


A seething mass of yellow, white, PANK and black bodies fidget and pace on the golden sands.

The scent of sun-burned rubber fills the air along with a few twirling feathers.

A cacophony of different quacks can be heard for miles.


'QUIET!' Yells Sonny as he puffs up his chest.

Silence falls and all beaks turn to face the rugged, handsome hero of old, known a Sonny.

'It is time we made a decision. It is obvious we have been forgotten and have waited here long enough. The humans are elsewhere and I think it's time we had our own adventure. Let's have a show of wings.'

Thousands of duck wings fly upwards.

'Okay, this is what I suggest. You know of the flotilla of ducks lost at sea and how they have become very valuable? I suggest we head out to sea and take it from there. Maybe we'll find them all and become rich, maybe we'll join them and become famous or maybe we'll do something totally different, but it has to be better than hanging around here for eternity. What say you?'

'Here Here,' echo a thousand quacky voices.

'Ducks love nothing better than water and we couldn't ask for a bigger pond than that.' Dainty beamed at Sonny as she pointed to the ocean.

'Okay - all for one and one for all. LET'S GO.'

And with that the massive crowd waddled down to the sea ...
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Meanwhile...

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Yes Jeeves?” Nada said to the butler standing before her.

“Madam, I’m sorry to bother you, but this is for you.” In his outstretched hand was an envelope.

As she took it he said, “It’s from the Queen.”

“Thank you Jeeves, is that all?”


“Yes madam, just ring if you need something.” Then he departed her room.

Nada looked at the red wax seal, yes, it was from Scarlett. She opened it and read the letter. When she finished it, she dropped the letter into her lap and laughed. What was the queen up to?

The castle was abuzz; all had received the invitations to the Farewell Humbug Ball. It was a sad time, but true to the Queen’s sense of humor she’d come up with the Humbug Ball combined with a Farewell party for all of us who had come over on that crazy transatlantic cruise.

It was to be a formal affair, so now everyone was scrambling to figure out what to wear. The Queen had made provisions though, a room filled with all sorts of appropriate clothing, it would be up to us to find the ones that most suited our personalities.

As Nada opened the door to the “selection room” she saw things flying about the room. Squeals of laughter and a general sense of excitement filled the air. Each rack of clothing came with a name posted above it; there was one for each of us. She perused the racks, looking for her own, but could not help but notice Emmyloo and Party were tangled up in something, which looked like a fish net. Hmmm. Dan’s rack was filled with a huge selection of jammies, one looked like a Santa Suit, another with reindeer, and even some baby dolls! Ben had two racks, one for him, and another tiny one for his naked mole rat. Mel and Tor were looking through theirs, an odd assortment of pink cocktail dresses...but hey, not for me to say anything. Nanette found some lovely flowing Christmas plaid, long skirts with different colored velvet jackets, Deb’s rack held a selection of minidresses, all sparkly, Teresa’s had the most beautiful gold embroidered gowns, while the Great Windini’s rack had the most elegant pantsuits all trimmed in a white fur (real?), CL Hanna’s held slinky numbers, while Forever’s rack had what could only be described as Cat suits in various colors of velvet. When she reached CC’s rack, well she stopped in her tracks, to admire the selection of armor, as well as medal covered formal wear. He was going to be one spiffy Knight! Next to that Lauren was throwing on different gowns of iridescent colors, seemingly undecided on which looked the loveliest. There was even a rack for Esperanza, though all black, as she had been in mourning since the loss of her sheep. Finally she found the rack with her name on it...the gowns took her breath away, all in jewel tones! Time to get one picked out!

The ball was to begin at seven, with a wonderful dinner, some dancing, winding up with a caravan of carriages, which would take everyone to the Queen’s jet for the ride home.

Nada thought Scarlett was being quite clever, getting everyone out before more havoc could ensue, especially in view of the past weeks of mayhem in her castle.

At precisely seven, two golden trumpets blared and the wide doors of the ballroom opened, letting everyone inside to admire the largest, most beautifully lit Christmas tree in the land. The room was decorated to the hilt in gilded gold and bright red, tiny white fairy lights light the ceiling made it look as though the night sky was visible. It truly was breathtaking, as apparent as a collective gasp could be heard upon the orderly entry. Yes, I did say orderly!

There were footmen dressed in their finery to escort each of us to our seat at the beautifully set tables, arranged in a semi-circle around the Queen’s throne which had been set among a scene of snow covered trees, and some decorative, silver deer.

Beautiful goblets were now being filled with the finest wines the Queen could find.

As soon as everyone was seated, a small group of golden ducks was being led to a tiny stage by Nottingham Bear. The lights lowered and the general buzz of the group fell silent as the ducks began to sing:


.”On the first day of Humbug, my true friends gave to me...
A knight in shining armor named CC

On the second day of Humbug my true friends gave to me,
Two big old suites

On the third day of Humbug my true friends gave to me,
Three swine to dine on

On the fourth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Four crazy Texans

On the fifth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Five cashmere sweaters

On the sixth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Six Excedrin headaches

On the seventh day of Humbug my true friends gave to me,
Seven bottles of wine

One the eighth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Eight celebrities

On the ninth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Nine naked mole rats

On the tenth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Ten exotic footmen

On the eleventh day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Eleven rechargeable batteries

On the twelfth day of Humbug my true friends gave to me
Twelve wishes granted!

At the conclusion of this charming duck-choir the trumpeters blared out the melody announcing the Queen was making her grand entrance. Everyone in the room stood as Queen Scarlett strode in, resplendent in a strapless red gown over which she wore an ermine trimmed cape. On her head was a veritable treasure chest of diamonds and rubies. She took our collective breaths away with her regalness. She stood at the throne, her admiring guests smiling and applauding, and finally motioned for us to take our seats.

The room was abuzz, the gentlemen looking handsome and the ladies were all knockouts in their attire.

“Clink..clink.” Queen Scarlett tapped her goblet.

“May I have your attention.” The room once again fell silent. “My dearest friends, I can’t tell you all how much you all mean to me. The fact that you all took so much time and effort to get to Nottingham, all for the purpose of visiting me...well, it has touched my heart.”

Heads nodded, as she went on, “You all have given me many laughs, and have had to put up with some very unsavory things to be here, and even managed to please my resident ghost, not to mention the sacrifices my dear, sweet CC made for appeasing Robin Hood. You all have made me realize just how much I am wubbed...trully wubbed.” With this, Scarlett’s eyes welled up, and her voice cracked. “I’m sorry, I am so overwhelmed that you all would do this for...me. I wanted to thank you all, by throwing this ball tonight. It is my fondest desire that each of you enjoy yourselves. So...eat, drink, be merry! I toast each of you!” She raised her goblet as we all raised ours...

”We WUB the Queen!” The crowd went wild. Then the waiters began filing in, great silver platters filled with all kinds of exotic foods. Everyone helped themselves, even Max, who sat at Stealthman’s feet.

Then the music began to play and our own CC got up and strode to the foot of the throne, bowing deeply to the Queen. (He nearly put her eye out with his jabby thing, but other than that, he did really good!) “My Queen, may I have this dance?”

Scarlett rose and took his hand, and the band played on as they took a spin around the magical dancefloor. After the song ended, the Queen motioned to the rest of the group to join her, and they did.

Everyone took turns dancing with each other, so festive was the mood...well, until Deb decided she wanted to do the Limbo under CC’s jabby thing...then things got really good. Ben’s naked mole rat managed to go lower than anyone...partially because he was the only one who could scoot around the now bent-back Tor, who was stuck! It was ok though, CC passed the Advil and Mel whomped him on the head with her ever-present skillet and he shot out unceremoniously.

At precisely midnight, the trumpets blared, and Queen Scarlett took her throne, for one last time. “My dearest friends, the coaches are out front, they shall transport you to my plane, the time has come to say farewell.”

Everyone rushed to Scarlett, hugging her, saying their special goodbyes, to her and their now, closer than ever, friends. One by one they headed out for the ride, happy to have come, but eager to return to their families and friends.

Scarlett waved from her balcony as the line of black limos now snaking their way out of the castle grounds.

It was farewell, but never goodbye.

The end.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Humbug Ball

info.brief_description: Come along for a transatlantic crossing on Nada's Ark!  Laughs!
info.description:
Nada goes into her closet, the list of demands in her hand. At the sight of her, Nottingham Bear, Delphine, Duck, James Duck, The Duckaneers, Drama, Diamante and the rest of the group lets out a cheer, “Yeah….it’s Nada!”

“Hi my buddies…I come bearing good news!” An immediate hush fell. All of their little faces looked up at me, expectantly.

“In one hour, I want you all to gather on the front lawn….we’re going on a trip..sh-h-h-h. Yes, a helicopter is on its way to pick us all up, and then, we’ll be making some stops to pick up more friends and then…it’s off to Delaware!”

“Quack?” The room was abuzz.

“Yes, our good friend, The White Knight himself, CC, has agreed to take the boat…errr Ark across the BIG POND, once we have everyone rounded up and aboard. We’re all going to see Scarlett, in Nottingham, England! What do you say?”

“We’re going to see Da Queen! We’re going to see Da Queen! Yea!!!!!!!!!” They were all pinching each other to see if they were dreaming.

“Okay, but…but…there is something we have to do once we all are there.”

“Really? Another adventure?” Asks Delphine.

“Yes, and it could be…well, dangerous, so we need to be prepared. I can’t reveal the Mission yet, just be prepared for…well, anything! And get a move on…we’ve lots to do!”

Nada went to get her suitcase and toolbox…ya just never know what you will need. Hmmmm, what shoes to pack?

R-I-N-G! Nada smiled, and who is calling to say they want to come along? “Hello, Ark Adventures, Nada speaking......”
info.pretty_title: In Search of Robin and his 7 Hoods
